campaign.story:
“The blood is the life, Mr. Renfield.”

                   The horror movie is undead and well after more than a century, its life ever renewed by drinking the blood of genre cliches. Scary movies aren’t afraid to be more terrifying, more gruesome, more daring,  more...transgressive.

Transgressive Horror—Reflections on Scare Films that Broke the Rules salutes movies and movie-makers who forever changed the way fright flicks were made, viewed, marketed, released, and merchandised. Within its possibly blood-stained pages, Transgressive Horror presents an eclectic mix of today’s most talented scribes sharing their humor and insights about their favorite groundbreaking fright films. Readers will see the classics in all new ways, and find some new gory thrills to buy, rent, or stream.

           This project is to secure money for a PDF edition. If it funds, print editions will be available for purchase through the BackerKit survey for US$10 plus shipping charges to wherever you lurk in the United States [ONLY--apologies to our Transylvania-based and other non-U.S. backers].

 Read exclusive excerpts from the book at Geek Native here and here! 

  Our esteemed list of authors (click on the links to read more about them):

**Larry Blamire on The Seventh Victim (1943)
**Bill Bodden on Congo (1995)

**Eddy Webb on The Hound of the Baskervilles (1959)
**Nicole Winchester on The Blair Witch Project (1999)

Transgressive Horror is Volume One in Everyone’s Gone to the Movies, a series of entertaining essays on cinema genres published by Ghost Show Press. GSP is the outré vision of longtime writer/game-designer Prof. Christopher McGlothlin, M.Ed. In the tradition of the original ghost shows that thrilled drive-in movie theatre patrons all across mid-century rural America, GSP brings the pure imagination of carnival wonderment to other media.
        GSP works with top creators, premier publishers, and new talent on diverse projects to bring their wildest notions to print. Our formula is simple: treat the artists well, do right by our audience, and together have as much fun as possible.
           So buy the ticket, take the ride.  We've got a triple horror-movie fright fest, a magician sawing people in half on stage, digging up a man buried alive a week ago, spirit materialization of celebrities like Elvis and the Beatles, and actual monsters abducting unsuspecting customers from the audience.
             And more.

updates.update_content:
We are back from the holiday weekend with news!
Twenty-eight of 29 writers have signed off on the final published draft of their works. Those are ready to go to layout, and will soon.
Work is progressing on both Backer-Selected essays. Novelist Alex Bledsoe is writing on Noroi: The Curse (2005), and Bryan Loy of the Epic Film Guys podcast is delving into Knife+Heart (2018).
That brings Transgressive Horror up to a grand total of THIRTY-ONE(!) films discussed--all made possible by your generous support of this project!

Hello everyone! Ghost Show Press Creative Pit Boss Prof. Christopher McGlothlin here, with all the Transgressive Horror news that's fit to print.

New Car, Caviar, Four Star Daydream, Think I'll Buy Me a Football Team
The fine folks at Kickstarter transferred the funds on Saturday 12 June, which allowed us to finally get the ball rolling. All contributors who've completed their work have been paid in full, and I must say it feels very good to be able to turn talking about treating creators well into action.

The short version of my life is: monster movies, writing, and the best friends. Thanks to you wonderful people, I get to keep on writing--and about monster movies!--along with my amazing pals. I don't know if there are words enough, but please know, from the very bottom of my heart, thank you!!!!!

If you backed us at The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari or The Ghost Show, Starring YOU! levels, we'll be reaching out to you directly soon to work out details.

updates.update_content:
Halloween.  Also known as Hallowe'en, Allhalloween, All Hallow's Eve, Samhain, and All Saint's Eve. Well, this year it gets a new title. This year, we welcome you to The Day Dead End launches! That's right gals and ghouls, today is the day the world learns that they CAN'T STOP THE HORDE!
PDF available today, print on demand coming soon!
https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/333803/Dead-End

It's official. Our Kickstarter has come and gone. But folks, you just CAN'T STOP THE HORDE! Dead End will be releasing in digital form as soon as we can! While our dream of having our own fully printed version has shuffled off to the graveyard, Dead End is very much alive! Stay tuned for more details. And remember... Stay Hungry...

Hello survivors. We'd like to take a moment to thank all our backers on this journey. It's been tough on all of us here at Atomic Ninja, as it's our first Kickstarter and we certainly do have a big goal in mind. We're not there yet, but there's always last minute backers. That being said, we'd love it if you spread the word to other potential survivors and see if we can't get that end run game sprint going!
That being said, you know what goes great with zombies? Ghost stories!

First and foremost let us say we are so thankful for everyone's support!  We've reached the mid point of our campaign and we have surpassed 33% of our funding goal!  You guys rock and we are humbled that our setting means so much to so many of you!  So what are the plans to bring this home?  Hang tight as this may be a bit long but layout several major announcements.

For starters we have reached out to several outlets and unfortunately with timing concerns as well as other projects we didn't get any takers on a fresh actual play. With that said there are actual plays from the original version of Dead End back in 2015 hosted by Jerrod himself!  While this doesn't show off the current SWADE version it does show the spiritual beginning as the original fan version for Deluxe.  Including one of the original players from the playtest group.

Also: The Wild Die was kind enough to interview us a few months ago about the Kickstarter. While the dates presented in the interview aren't correct any longer, the rest is still spot on. So please give a listen if you'd like to know a bit more about Dead End and it's creators.
https://thewilddie.podbean.com/e/dead-end-kickstarter/#comments

updates.update_userinfo: Over a third of the way funded with as many followers as backers!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone. It's only been 3 days and we're already 25% of the way to our goal. With over 100 backers unlocking the first two Survivor goals we can't stop grinning at the support so far.
Dead End was absolutely a passion project for us here for the last few years, and we're glad we can share it with the Savage Worlds community. We've taken Dead End on a wild ride for quite a while and seen it evolve from a simple small scale setting with nary a variation on the Savage Worlds basic rules to the scale that it exists in now. We're very proud of the work we've done, and we're chomping at the bit to show it off to all of you.

First and foremost I want to recognize patient zero! Morgan Stjernström was successfully our very first backer and as such is the very first zombie to spread the disease!  We have been in talks with him through out the day and he will indeed be getting a unique one of a kind comemorative t-shirt declaring himself the Dead End Patient Zero.  While that shirt will not be available, you can get other Dead End and Atomic Ninja merch from https://teespring.com/stores/atomic-ninja-studios including a limited time backer shirt which will only be available while the campaign is live!

This is the SOUL Kickstarter, funding an epic setting for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE)!
Click here for a video talking a bit about myself and this project.
 SOUL 
“This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.”
Check out our free 40 page sample book!
SOUL-Reap the Galaxy Test Drive
Thank you for stopping by!  The finished book is expected to be in print by July 2021, will feature adventure generators, settlement/space station builders, a galactic setting featuring over a dozen planets and their controlling factions.  It will be available in  both hard and soft covers, and expected to be over 100 pages long.
SOUL is a sci-fantasy setting for the Savage Worlds game system, set in the far future. The scope of this setting is broad. Travel anywhere in the galaxy or hop over to another if you want to explore. It's a high tech world with a dash of magic. The setting takes on some dark themes. Slavery is permitted almost everywhere, but more concentrated in certain realms. The universes universal currency is the souls of the dead.
The scope of play is galactic with room for all types of adventures. Need some Dune like sandworms? Convoys through the desert? High tech floating cities? Massive android armies? You got it. World eaters? You bet!
It is the year 9135 on Earth. Humans lay claim to hundreds of thousands of worlds in the Milky Way, but humanity is not united. Three significant factions wrestle for power and territory while hundreds of minor factions fight for the scraps.
What are they fighting for?...
 Shade is a multidimensional particle used for hyperspace travel and powerful incantations. Shade or soul dust is a currency throughout the galaxy. To the average citizen, shade funds their way of life and is a means of freedom. To factions, shade is power, plain and simple. This stuff moves armies.
How do you get shade? It needs to be reaped from living material, usually plant life or animal and quite often slaves and the less fortunate.
SOUL the game is going to be about 80-120 pages of content. Rules for hyperspace travel, tables for adventure building and random encounters for on land and in space.
The finished product will ship by fall 2021. Balancing gear, weapons, edges, and hindrances take some time. Also, any editing that needs to be wrapped up. I have artists lined up and have already gone over my budget on the few pieces of original art I have. Much of the raised funds will be for artwork and editing.
What is SOUL? It's an attempt to bring a few awesome themes together. It is inspired by other settings like Interface Zero for its high tech futuristic atmosphere, Star Wars for its epic storytelling, Star Trek for flying starships as a team, and starship troopers for its grittiness. Soul is a setting that gives much creative license to the GM and also keeps them on their toes. There is plenty of content to lean on and room for injecting material from other settings.  The final release should include lots of roll tables, gear porn, and a full beastiery.
Three significant factions rub against each other, always on the brink of war. The only thing stopping them is the incredible cost it would have. So instead, they hire smaller factions or mercenaries to perform black ops and spycraft against one another.
Ruled by Tiberia Abadons iron fist.
Doing what she can to maintain her position in the empire. She puts down repeated rebellions as quickly as they crop up.
The empire has an abundance of slaves, much more than anywhere else. However, it is becoming a problem. Recently a law was passed saying any slave can be reaped for shade by the age of 20. The law was passed to help control the population but backfired somewhat, and now many planets are in full revolt, and the slaves are in an uprising.
The will of Abadon is to rule the galaxy by force if necessary. She is building a Dyson ring around a star, the first-ever to prove her godhood. It will make the empire beyond rich with landmass available to grow their population and grit farming capabilities.


Mark Five
President of Dynamus.
Mark has spent the last 200 years involved in politics, climbing the ladder to where he is now. The best schools in Dynamus taught him. He comes from an elite family who sells some of the most popular androids in the galaxy. His family has monopolies on several planets, some of which they own.
Dynamus is home of the wealthiest inhabitants in the galaxy. Like the other major factions, Dynamus has extensive farm planets growing algae, rodents, and other lower forms of life to be reaped for their shade. Dynamus' strength though is in its lively market and advanced tech.
It's also known as the empire of sharks because of its loaning practices. Smaller factions will find themselves in a bind trying to procure military or advanced tech, and Dynamus lends a hand. Dynamus usually loaning the tech they need or the funds to acquire it. The interest rates are intense and sometimes unpayable, which leads to the sharks owning the smaller faction and turning their worlds into shade farms. The most substantial loans Dynamus has out are to the Astras Empire who is paying through the nose for the tech to build their Dyson ring.
Dynamus seeks to rule financially.
StarMecha controls fewer systems than either Dynamus or Astras. Humans have no roles in government here; a machine runs the nation. AB is its name, and he has ruled since the bloody founding of the nation more than 4000 years ago.
AB is a mysterious character that few have seen in person. He has been a mediator to many conflicts in the galaxy. He seems to value peace almost as much as he values his chosen few.
The big three avoid all-out war with each other. However, that doesn't speak to the minor factions who are often clashing with armies and weapons of mass destruction. Spycraft and black ops are the norms. Every faction is trying to get a leg up on each other. The smaller factions are less cautious going into open war with one another. Planet killing weapons are available but highly regulated by a treaty between the big three. This keeps the weapons out of the hands of most other factions.
Shade is harvested from any organic material, from trees to people. It is abundant but also in very high demand. It's used as a catalyst for opening wormholes into hyperspace and also in casting powerful mystical incantations. Once in hyperspace, you can travel anywhere in days, weeks, or perhaps months, instead of thousands of years.
Although most of the galaxy being discovered, much of it is not habitable.
Magic is used widely throughout the Astras Empire. Almost every ship has at least one magic user. They are there in place of an auger engine which is used to open wormholes into hyperspace. A navigation computer than takes over until they reach the other side and a hole is needed to leave hyperspace.
Magic is rarely used and even looked down upon in places like Dynamus who see it as inferior to technology. Some minor factions have outlawed the use of magic. They believe it's evil at its very core. Users are locked up and placed on prison planets.

updates.update_content:
Some things to touch on here are a couple of the big forms of tension or conflict in the setting. Should shade(which some belief to be the soul of living things)be reaped or farmed from people, or just plants, or at a certain age, or at all? Or is it just a renewable resource to be used freely?
The setting also touches a bit on slavery which also questions the value of life in the galaxy.
I intend for each faction to be driven by their different ideologies, and have them rub up against or even go head to head with each other's beliefs to create conflict. And this conflict usually plays out by pushing smaller factions to wage wars with each other. Avoiding an all-out galactic war,.

Hi backers! I’ve been getting lots of love, we made the Pinnacle newsletter. I have been in talks with another world builder about maybe turning Soul into a collaboration. Because there is a lot of work to be done and I could really use the help.
We have reached 60% of our goal so far and according to kicktraq we are trending to reach our goal.
Since we launched the Kickstarter I have not had a chance to play in a session of Soul yet. The game I had planned fell through, but we will try again.

So it looks like we are hitting our first plateau.  Funding has stalled out at the 40% mark, hopefully not for too long.  I have my two sons with me for the weekend, which limits the amount of time I can spend on the Kickstarter.  I may have them until Tuesday.  After that will be spending a lot of time to continue spreading the word about SOUL.  I will also be spending time prepping for a session this coming weekend. 
I spent a few hours putting together the roadmap for what needs to be done to finish the book as far as writing and rules go.  For that I used Trello.  In the future ill be sharing some of the board to give you guys an idea of what ill be working on.  There is lots to do but it's all planned out.  I know this should have been done before I had even started the Kickstarter, and it was planned to a degree, but I've filled the plan out with more detail and had it organized.

campaign.story:
We're back! And issue 02 of The Savage Sign is chock full o' fast, furious fun! Did you miss issue 01? You can get it right now from DriveThruRPG.
Inside this amazing-looking volume, you’ll find an entertaining bundle of goodies to enhance your Savage fun. There are two immersive settings, exciting new character options, awesome gear, new custom setting rules, creature features, stand-alone Savage Tales, short stories, and more to make your fun faster and even more furious!
If you are a Savage Worlds GM, you’ll love the new ready-to-play settings. They feature worlds organized around a familiar central story or theme, but all are compelling and original. Each setting is supported by specialized rules to really create the kind of game experience you want at your table. There are also cool new creature features, presenting terrifying monsters, both horrible and strange, for you to challenge your players’ characters. Each setting also includes at least one adventure, complete with maps and pregenerated characters! The Savage Sign will make your games hum and help you create a memorable experience for your players.
If you are a Savage Worlds Player, you’re going to want to get in on this too. The character options alone will have you drooling to play these new Wild Cards, not only in our outstanding original settings but in any Savage Worlds game. Beyond character options, you’ll also find inspiring portraits, tokens, and maps all to help you imagine your own adventures between sessions!
If you just like games, there’s plenty here for you, including game designer diaries, gripping short stories, and truly top-quality art by our award-winning artist team. We hope you’ll want to page through The Savage Sign again and again!
If you play or run Savage Worlds, enjoy fiction and art, then The Savage Sign is for you!
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise production funds for the creation of a graphic novel-sized, 96+ page, full-color book and other Savage Worlds Adventure Edition goodies. 
Want an insider's look and some extras? Check out our Patreon.
Want to meet fellow Savage Worlds fans? Chat with our developers? Play some games? Join our Discord community!
Want to see our games in action? Check out our twitch or youtube channels. 
Want to play now? Check out these Pay What You Want titles:
The Temple of the First Fire by Eugene Marshall.
Dragon vs Lich Showdown by Matt Cutter.
Below are some additional details about the content you'll find in this issue of The Savage Sign 02.
Each setting contains player options, setting rules, gear, a gazetteer, Creature Features, and Savage Tales supporting the setting.
Depths of Madness
THE DEPTHS OF MADNESS by Eugene Marshall
In "The Depths of Madness", experience a Lovecraftian spin on Jules Verne’s 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea. Join Captain Nemo’s intrepid Submariner’s League, exploring the unplumbed deeps of the Pacific Ocean. The League’s purpose is to save humanity from the eldritch beings that have begun to stir from their slumber in their sunken crypts and cities, swallowed by the waters aeons ago. Even if mind-bending monstrosities don’t get them, the heroes must still survive the dangers of giant sea creatures, intense water pressure, drowning, and the bends, as well as the vicious cultists working to awaken their fell masters. Only the League stands against them and only the League will risk the Depths of Madness!
Islands of Fire
ISLANDS OF FIRE by Brian Reeves
"Islands of Fire" takes you to the world of Mokukai, a place of vast and dangerous oceans, remote jungle islands, lakes of steaming lava, mysterious magic, and of natural beauty and savage cruelty. Warriors battle with shark-tooth clubs, raiding by torchlight from their double-hulled voyaging canoes. Demons and spirits stalk dense jungles hiding crumbling ruins. Bold navigators ply the vast oceans and those who can beseech the gods for mana – or steal it from them – can wield their ancient power. Mokukai is a world in need of heroes – if you have what it takes to survive it.
Virulent
Mother Lode by Darrell Hardy (Virulent Savage Tale)
As the only substance known to kill werewolves, silver is incredibly valuable—and in the hands of a silversmith, it can be the difference between life and death. When the local silversmith runs out of raw materials, she turns to the heroes for help.
Thicker Than Water by Darrell Hardy (Virulent Savage Tale)
One man holds the key to destroying a master vampire, but he doesn’t know it, and no one else knows where to find him. The heroes must track him down—and quickly, for time is running out!
Psinaut
The Derelict by Eugene Marshall (Psinaut Savage Tale)
The scavenger ship SPINOZA is passing an insignificant and lifeless system when its scanners pick up a derelict ship in a nearby asteroid field. From long-range scans, the derelict seems human and intact, but no sign of life can be found. It could be the score they’ve been hoping for. What could have happened? A Psinaut adventure for a team of Seasoned heroes.
Psi Cadets Go! by Eugene Marshall (Psinuat Savage Tale)
A group of cadets is on a training flight when the Gauranx attack their school, Psi Corp Academy, and capture their teachers and classmates. Now the cadets are the only ones who can save them. But what can they do? Their training vessel is defenseless. Fortunately, there is an old but functional psi-mech in the school museum near the school, which should be more than enough to take back the Academy. There’s only one problem; they’ve never piloted one before! A Psinaut adventure for a team of Novice heroes.
The Last Bastion by Darren Pearce (Psinaut Savage Tale)
What starts as a seemingly normal pirate attack on a remote space station soon evolves into something far more sinister. The Station Head, Commander Travis Clayton, was killed during the pirate's assault, but it turns out he was killed by friendly fire. When our heroes investigate, they end up in the line of fire as well. A Psinaut adventure for a team of Novice or Seasoned heroes. 
Revolution
Infiltrate the Bastille! by Eugene Marshall (Revolution Savage Tale)
It is Spring, 1789, in Paris. The characters are revolutionaries, working to bring down the Ancien Régime and deliver liberty, fraternity, and equality to France. Their mission is to infiltrate the notorious prison, The Bastille, and rescue a political prisoner held there, the infamous but wildly popular writer known as the Marquis de Sade, so that he might serve the revolution with his wicked pen. The Bastille is highly fortified and stocked with guards. How will the heroes pull off the prison break that might win the Revolution? A Savage Tale for a team of Novice heroes.
Pantheon
Big Trouble in Bay City by Eugene Marshall (Pantheon Savage Tale)
Something is rotten in Bay City. The city’s water is polluted with some unknown toxin and the city hasn’t been able to remove it. What’s more, the city government is poised to turn over its public utilities to a corporate conglomerate that promises to fix the City’s problems. But at what cost? A Pantheon Savage Tale for a team of Seasoned heroes. 
Once we meet our original funding goal, we’ll add Stretch Goals to make this project an even better deal. Let’s unlock as many as we can and make The Savage Sign as entertaining as possible!
$5500 - Unlocked! THE STICK RIDERS OF GANAREEF. An original short-story by J.V. Jones, featuring art By Douglas P. Lobo.
 $6000 - Unlocked! Ride Along (Pantheon) By Darrell Hayhurst
Reporter Marcie Flay arranged to film a day in the life of up and coming superheroes trying to make a name for themselves in a world where The Pantheon reigns supreme. As luck would have it, it's the same day a raid on The Cannibal King's compound sends the villain and his cult of followers on a rampage. The cameras are rolling,  Marcie isn't known for asking softball questions, and the Cannibal Crew are causing trouble everywhere. It's going to be a long day.
$6500 - Unlocked! Buzzards of Ol’ San Antone By Sean Bircher
As one of the first stops on the cattle drives heading north, San Antonio has grown into one of the biggest cities in Texas. Rarely does the weirdness of the Old West haunt it’s environs. Now, though, buzzards are massing in the thousands downtown, watching and waiting for something. Can your posse discover the terrible secret haunting the River City before the buzzards feast? A Weird Western adventure for Novice heroes.
$7000 All are Punish’d By Tracy Sizemore
“All are Punish’d” is a noir adventure set in the late 1950s, where the occult is real, and crime and lies blanket the big city like a festering cancer.  A young woman named Emily LaSalle is kidnapped, and a ransom note is left demanding $10,000 for her release. But all is not what it seems, as the investigators uncover the sordid story of a corrupt businessman, a decades-old murder, and the hush money paid to cover it all up.  The heroes must discover the true villain behind the kidnapping and find Emily before a dark ritual ensures all are truly punished—both the innocent and the guilty.”
$7500 The Beast (Revolution) By Eugene Marshall
It is 1789, in France. The characters receive a cry for help from the rural village of Langogne, in the mountains in the southern region of Gévaudan. They must travel to the community Langogne and offer what help they can. What they find there, however, is monstrous. A  Savage Tale for a team of Novice heroes.
$8000 The Last Voyage of the Herald By Brian Reeves
One year ago, the voyaging canoe The Herald departed from Kuahiki on a trading mission to other islands in the Holua Iti archipelago. When months went by without her return, her crew were mourned as lost. Now, the Herald has been spotted foundering on Kuahiki’s rugged barrier reef, her sails tattered and her sleek koa hulls ravaged. Is anyone left alive on board? What is preventing her from sailing into the harbor? And why is she surrounded by ravenous sharks? A Savage One Sheet for Novice heroes.

Want extra print copies of the book? No problem we will supply additional print-at-cost vouchers for $16 each.

Our creative team includes Aaron Acevedo, Carol Darnell, Ian Eller, Min Lungelow, Eugene Marshall, Kevin Andrew Murphy, Darren Pearce, Brian Reeves, Alida Saxon, and we've lined up a few guest stars for stretch goals!
Our team has worked on numerous kickstarter projects, including Savage Worlds Adventure Edition, Deadlands, Torg Eternity, and Unknown Armies. We have won multiple ENnie and Origins Awards for our previous work. 
Savage Worlds is a tabletop role-playing game published by Pinnacle Entertainment Group. It is the core ruleset for all Pinnacle’s current roleplaying games, including Deadlands, Rifts, Flash Gordon, Lankhmar, and more. It has everything you need to play narrative or miniature-based games, with quick, simple, yet comprehensive rules for everything from combat to Dramatic Tasks, Chases, and Interludes. The emphasis is on less bookkeeping for the Game Master so she can quickly and easily create worlds and adventures for any setting, and focus on the players and their actions during frenetic combat.
New to Savage Worlds? Want to try it for free? Search the Pinnacle store for “test drive.” They have several options for you to print a simple version of the rules with an adventure to test it for yourself! 
This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.
 **Please note that backers pay for printing and shipping costs.**
We are using DriveThruRPG print-at-cost fulfillment for this project. What does that mean exactly? After funds are delivered by Kickstarter, we'll send you a voucher, and then you pay DriveThruRPG the actual costs of printing and shipping, and they ship your products directly. 100% of backer money goes toward creating this project, so we don't have to increase the goal or pledges to cover the costs of printing and shipping.
The estimated print cost for softcover books is $8 and card decks are $7 each. Shipping costs vary by location. DrivethruRPG ships internationally and estimated shipping costs can be found here. 
Thank you so much for considering our project! We deeply appreciate all pledges. Please spread the word and help us bring The Savage Sign to life!

campaign.story:
Pirate Press presents this adventure set in a reimagined and modernized version of L. Frank Baum's classic World of Oz. The events of Baum’s original stories are over a century in the past. The original Wizard and Dorothy are long dead although many of their friends and companions are still around. A new Wizard from Dorothy’s world has conquered half of the land of Oz and a new sea has overcome the once deadly dessert that isolated Oz from the rest of the world. Players can take the role of a freedom fighter, mercenary, pirate, privateer, or countless others to explore Oz on land or sea. Join the fight to liberate a wartorn Oz or join the many that profit from it.

May 17, 2020, marks the 120th anniversary of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, by L. Frank Baum. We at Pirate Press couldn't imagine a better day to launch our Kickstarter for this new book. Join us in celebrating over a century of wonder and delight, compliments of this amazing American author. Thank You, L. Frank Baum, may your legacy continue another 120 years and beyond!
Battle for Oz: Pirates is a complete game setting custom-built for the award-winning Savage Worlds rule-set published by Pinnacle Entertainment Group. You will need the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition core book to play the game. If you are not familiar with the Savage Worlds RPG, check it out at Pinnacles website HERE.
Battle for Oz: Pirates will be professionally designed by Fat Goblin Games, artist Rick Hershey, and published through drivethrurpg.com as a print on demand product. It will be available in hardcopy and softcopy in two different affordable print quality options.
The Battle for Oz: Pirates core book will not replace the original Battle for Oz book that was designed for the Deluxe Edition of the Savage Worlds core rules in 2014. It will UPDATE the setting for SWADE (Savage Worlds Adventure Edition) as well as add a large amount of new material centered around the new Oz sea. Battle for Oz: Pirates will convert all of the existing NPC's and creatures into SWADE as well as tweak the Oz setting rules to flow seamlessly with the new core rules.  It will include an updated timeline to account for the last six years of conflict, new maps, updated city descriptions, as well as new playable races. In essence, Battle for Oz: Pirates will be a sequel, game companion, and SWADE conversion all rolled into one setting core book. 
What is Battle for Oz: Pirates
It's the land of Oz, but not the one you remember. Oz is no longer a free land. For the last six years, Oz has been subjugated by a new Wizard from the outer world that calls himself, Ozymandias. Glinda the Good and many of her allies have been captured or killed, and over half of Oz is a military state. Ozymandius is using a forgotten magical discipline called Technomancy, and its energies are literally shaking the foundation of Oz itself.  From the Emerald City, the new dark Wizard commands a legion of soulless Tin-Men soldiers and ferocious flying monkeys to enforce his will. Anyone who dares to speak out or organize against him is met with a silent end at the hands of Scarecrow assassins that live in the night.  The only real resistance comes from the north in the nomadic country of Gilikin.  It is there that Amber Gale, daughter of Dorothy Gale, rallies the Beast-men and scattered few against this new evil. Most have lost hope and turned a blind eye, while others such as privateers, and mercenaries have chosen to profit off of the constant conflict. Our modern-day Oz is a darker, less friendly place than Dorothy Gale encountered when she first crossed over from Kansas over a century ago. After six years of bloodshed, a stalemate has developed as neither side has the resources to continually wage an all-out battle. Ozymandias’s forces still occupy three of the five countries of Oz and a large portion of Munchkin country has become a demilitarized zone.
Then about a year ago, a change in the landscape of Oz further complicated the cold war. An unexplained phenomenon magically transformed the deadly desert that surrounds Oz into a sea. The transformation engulfed the coastlines of Oz and the accompanying storms ravaged the cities and towns for over a week. In the aftermath, the residents of Oz had to contend with and adapt to a new unexplored seascape. Even Ozymandias was forced to commit resources to the exploration of the new sea in a race to control it before his enemies did. Against the backdrop of war, a new era of commerce, trade, smuggling, and piracy, is unfolding carried by the strong tides of the magical sea. Sapphire City, the second-largest city in Oz next to the Emerald City, has become the center of this new wave of commerce and exploration. What no one knows, is that lurking in the depths of the new sea is an ancient creature that was once worshipped as a god. This new sea terror is beholding to no one, and will not discriminate when consolidating his power of the sea and the land dwellers that trespass on it.
Battle For Oz was a successful original setting published in 2014 for the Savage Worlds Deluxe Edition. It set the familiar fiction against the backdrop of war and revolution. The initial concept was simple, a modernized version of Oz with a rich history that extended largely from Dorothy Gale's arrival in the year 1900 to modern-day times with the introduction of a new tyrant, that did not arrive in a state fair balloon.  The plot point campaign threw the players directly into the crossfire as agents of the resistance working directly for Dorothy's daughter, Amber Gale. 
We have been planning a sequel for some time but with the arrival of the new Savage Worlds Adventure Edition core rules, we knew it was the right time to move forward. Battle for Oz: Pirates will do the same thing for Oz that SWADE did for Savage Worlds, make the game even more- fast, furious, and fun!
I've broken the rewards down incrementally as easily as I know how but in essence there are three basic pledge level types available.
1-The OZ DECKHAND is the PDF only pledge level available and will not only include the NEW Oz Pirates setting book in PDF, but also the original Battle for Oz setting book (2014 Deluxe Edition) in PDF as well as ALL digital-only stretch goals that are unlocked during the campaign.
2- All of the pledge levels beyond the OZ DECKHAND will include the New Oz Pirates setting book in PDF AND softcover print, with the exception of the following pledge levels that include an upgraded hardcover book: Oz Freedom Fighter, Oz Merchant, and Oz Sea King.  If your chosen pledge level includes a softcover book and you prefer a hardcover book, see the ADD ON list and simply add the total amount listed to your pledge amount. There is also an option in the ADD ON list to pay an additional amount to upgrade your book printing quality from standard to premium printing. Drivethrurpg.com has examples of the difference in the two print qualities HERE.
3- Lastly, the contributor pledge levels that include, OZ MARINE,  OZ PIRATE CAPTAIN, SHIFTERS POINT VIP, SAPPHIRE CITY VIP, OZ MERCHANT, OZ NAVIGATOR, and OZ SEA KING, are limited premium pledge levels that allow the backer to actually have a hand in creating content for the new Oz Pirates book. We had similar pledge levels in our 2014 campaign for Battle for Oz, and they were extremely popular. These contributor pledge levels include all physical and digital stretch goals unlocked during the campaign, original custom artwork, special contributors credit in the book, as well as a limited 3D printed dice roller only available to pledge contributors. Please note that since the artwork and 3D dice roller will be produced and delivered by Pirate Press, a separate shipping fee will be generated and become the responsibility of the backer. If stretch goal items like Oz Dice, or Oz Bennies, are unlocked during the campaign and included in your pledge level, ALL ITEMS- including the original artwork and dice roller- that are produced by Pirate Press will be consolidated into one total shipping charge and shipped together.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Pirate Press has learned a great deal from the success and failures of the original Battle for Oz Kickstarter campaign. Mistakes in selecting printing options, unrealistic shipping costs, unorganized stretch goal fulfillment, and unreliable vendors are just a few of the shortcomings experienced in the first campaign. Though we feel we delivered a fantastic high-quality book, we let several small details fall through the cracks, specifically on stretch goal fulfillment. Those missteps are being corrected and will not happen again. Some of the things we are doing to ensure that is to commit fully to print on demand and drivethrurpg.com as our sole source of printed material. By the conclusion of this campaign, we hope to have a new setting book, three companion books, and several PDF adventures and GM material available for Battle for Oz: Pirates, all through drivethrurpg.com. 

We have found a local artist in Fat Goblin Games to spearhead all of our book design which we hope will enable us to put out regular updates and new adventures for Savage Oz, something we did not have before. We will also be using Backerkit to fulfill our backer's pledges and add-ons on this campaign. If you are not familiar with Backerkit, it is a recognized industry leader on Kickstarter and other project funding sites that does an outstanding job organizing pledges, add-on orders, and assisting the project creator in collecting funds and shipping product. Their website can be viewed at Backerkit.com. 

To ensure we don't lose time or material we have partnered with Savage Worlds vets like, Charles White of Fabled Environments to fulfill PDF stretch goals and included book content. We are also pulling from a multitude of local talent for art, editing, writing, and social media promotion. We believe that a combination of some amazingly talented writers and artists combined with the best version of the Savage Worlds RPG ruleset to date will make the ultimate Savage Oz experience! We just need your help to get there.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The sun has risen. After hasty preparations, your party gathers up their gear and enters the dungeon beneath the ruined temple. You tread carefully across cracked flagstones, stepping over shattered stone, pushing aside overgrowth and cobwebs. Without warning, a deafening rumble echoes behind you as dust fills the air, the sunlight disappears, and darkness shrouds your vision... 
Brave adventurers delving the depths of an ancient dungeon.
Introducing Dungeon Delve, a new fantasy roleplaying zine from Sigil Entertainment Group, bringing dungeon crawls to fans of Savage Worlds Adventure Edition!
Dungeon Delve's 32-pages include an adventure generator by Alan Bahr (Tiny Dungeon), a short story by John Wick (7th Sea), a hoard of magic items, brand new monsters chock-full of savage goodness, dozens of deadly traps and more! 
Dungeon Delve will be delivered as a PDF via DriveThruRPG and we'll also provide an option to print-at-cost! 
The zine will be a 32-page, 8 ½ x 5 ½ saddle-stitched booklet with a color cover.
Dungeon Delve in print! Print level backers get the PDF and obtain access to purchase the print version of the zine at cost + shipping & handling from DriveThruRPG.com (roughly $2+S&H). See Fulfillment section below for further details.      
Sigil has been creating roleplaying game books, illustrations, maps, and more since 2005, contributing to hundreds of products including fan favorites such as Deadlands, Savage Worlds, Torg Eternity, and Unknown Armies.
 Check out the ratings of our successful Savage Worlds kickstarter project, The Savage Sign. 
Download our Dragon vs Lich Showdown adventure by Matt Cutter for free!  
Rulership of the fabled Broken Tusk Pass is muddy at best, with a dragon, a lich, and an independent village all claiming sovereign rights to the lucrative route. But when vast timber and gold discoveries on the frontier lure explorers to Broken Tusk Pass, its true leader shall be decided— in battle!
 Want to chat with Sigil creators and fans, check out our Discord server.
Inspired by classic titles like Judges Guild and Alarums & Excursions, Kickstarter is inviting creators to launch their own RPG-inspired zines in February 2020.
With your help, we look forward to creating this exciting new zine! It is our hope is that through continued support, Dungeon Delve can grow over time from a single zine into many issues, complete with more adventures, monsters, atmospheric illustrations, and character options.#zinequest

Color 3D Print

Never picked up a brush in your life?
High-detail, vibrant color prints will capture your creativity better than ever before--no art skills required. 


If you prefer the more traditional route, check out our backer tiers that offer professionally hand-painted options where artists replicate your color design by hand, the old fashioned way.

 Are you a painter?
Use deep “digital paint” tools to plan your color schemes and see them applied to your model in real-time. Experiment with color theory, easily try out different schemes, or work with clients to ensure you have the right design before you even put brush to model. 
Are you a virtual tabletop user? 
Select backer tiers offer new tools for users who play online as well. Design and export custom "tokens" for use in your favorite virtual tabletop platform. These beautiful, drag-and-drop, 2D graphical representations of your characters will be exportable in several styles, at ready-to-use resolutions and formats.

Don't use minis at all?
Even “theater of the mind” players will find something to love! Use new photo booth tools to create the perfect character sheet image which can be updated as your character and equipment grows and changes.
Full-Color Custom Miniatures
Design your own digital 'paints' and see them applied to your model in real-time as you experiment with different designs and color schemes.  In-depth rendering and material design features will allow a revolutionary new level of customization. 
Then, make it real; we will provide two options for producing your custom color model and help capture your creativity better than ever before.  With your support, we’ll offer the most customizable and easiest to use color design tools the web has ever seen!
About the Color 3D Printed Miniatures...
For the 3D printing fan, we are using cutting edge additive manufacturing technology to make your design real with vibrant, highly detailed 3D printing. With groundbreaking 3D printing technology, color figures can be printed with remarkably vivid colors and dimensional accuracy. This represents one of our most ambitious additions to date—never before have we been so excited about a feature! We continue our long partnership with Shapeways, Inc., one of the leading names in 3D printing, to print and ship these revolutionary new figures all over the world.
About the Hand-Painted Minis...
For the traditionalist, we are also offering professionally hand-painted options. Design your color scheme online and have your miniature sent directly to professional artists who will recreate your digital color designs by hand!
We are working with top-notch painting studios like Den of Imagination and Mixed Dimension to bring you high-quality display-worthy professional paint jobs that are true to your digital design.
Our favorite painters will work from your saved color design, replicating your color scheme choices by hand-mixing paints to match your digital design.
Token Maker Unlimited
Design and export unlimited custom "tokens" for use in your favorite virtual tabletop platform. Available in both ‘profile picture’ and ‘overhead view’ style, you will be able to easily populate a virtual tabletop world with your hand-crafted character tokens formatted for easy drag-and-drop use.
This feature represents one of several new "pro tools" we will roll out in the coming year. Pledge for a year of Token Maker access, or pledge more for lifetime access with no future recurring subscription cost. 
Achievement Unlocked! The unlocked Portrait Studio stretch goal features will be included with Token Maker Unlimited, offering new and improved camera options and effects to our screenshot tools for the ultimate character sheet image!
Populate your virtual tabletop world! Export beautiful tokens in a wide range of styles.
At the conclusion of our Kickstarter campaign, your support will immediately go to work helping us deliver these full-featured color tools while continuing regularly to expand the library of parts and customization options on www.heroforge.com.
February 2020: We begin updating our library of thousands of parts for color compatibility. 
May 2020: Finalized user interface for color application, and the launch of beta access to color tools for all Kickstarter backers, and launch Token Maker Unlimited. 
June 2020: We will open order submission to Kickstarter backer for both 3D printed color and hand-painted color custom miniatures. While we ultimately expect to reach our typical fulfillment speeds, note that orders placed during this closed beta may take several months for fulfillment as we ramp up capacity. Fulfillment will be gradual, as we work through orders in the order they are received. 
This timeline is our best estimate, but we will open submissions and start shipping orders as early as possible. Note that, in the case of high order volume, order submission for both hand-painted and 3D printed color miniatures may be made available in stages, with priority based on time of the pledge. Backer reward redemption will be facilitated by digital voucher codes redeemable on www.heroforge.com.
We have been developing exciting new tools to fully utilize the most revolutionary 3D printing technology and hardware. It is a big job, but who better to do it than the makers of the original 3D printed custom miniatures?
High-Quality Web-Based Rendering
Whether you want to fully paint your design with a couple of clicks or hand-tune unique digital 'paints' to capture your character's aesthetic perfectly, we have you covered.
We wanted users to be able to do more than apply flat colors, so we looked to traditional, real-world painting techniques to inform our designs. Our rendering and UI has re-imagined classic techniques for the digital world. Replicate the beautiful subtlety of dry brushing, ink-washing's ability to add depth, and much more. Printed designs will include subtle shading and lighting within the color texture, making details pop and adding fantastic realism to your design.

By giving you the option to hand-tune highlights, low-lights, shininess, hue shift and more, we will give you unparalleled design tools and let you see a whole new spectrum of possibilities.
Cutting Edge Manufacturing Technology
3D printing has evolved at incredible speeds, with new technologies emerging all the time. We're happy to say that this thrilling new print technology means that highly detailed, color printed tabletop minis are finally possible! 
High-tech, full-color 3D printers turn pixels on the screen into atoms in your hand!
Color is produced by mixing a range of color materials on the fly, allowing for full, vivid CMYK prints with beautiful gradients and detail. This technology employs dissolvable support materials, removing the need for support sprues and allowing for smoother, more consistent surfaces than ever before.
This plastic is similar in durability to our premium plastic material. Faint layer lines may be visible on the surface of the figures, especially in strong direct light.
One-Click Color Schemes 
No need to have an art degree or knowledge of color theory to have fun coloring your character. You will be able to quickly paint your character in seconds, using a wide range of artist-designed color motif presets so you can “try on” a wide range of color schemes or use them as a jumping-off point for your own design.
A Multitude of Digital Paint Options
We'll offer a library of artist-tuned paint options for a wide range of materials. Experience the coloring-book joy of turning a character from grayscale to full, rich color quickly and easily!
 We'll also offer the ability to "mix your own paint." Customize more than just the color: adjust shininess, highlight, mid-light, and low-light tones, and more. Your hand-crafted digital 'paints' will be saved with your character, allowing you to revisit and tweak them to your heart's content.
Tons of artistically tuned options for every material, all at your disposal!
Five years ago, Kickstarter's support allowed us to launch revolutionary web-based design tools for custom miniatures. Since then, we’ve shipped hundreds of thousands of miniatures to dozens of countries around the world. We've continued to work tirelessly, adding content and working with the world-leading 3D printing service providers to deliver the latest and greatest technology--and the best custom miniatures on the market.

Since our launch, we've expanded our tools and customization options. We've added over a thousand new parts, two dozen new fantasy races, and ever-improving materials in both plastic and metal. In 2019, we began adding fresh content every single week. 
Tens of thousands of users have visited every "Treasure Tuesday" to see what we’ve added from our ever-growing ‘user wish-list’ of content requests. And we're certainly not done yet! You'll even find several sneak-peeks at upcoming parts sprinkled throughout this very Kickstarter! We continue to develop new models for the site, prioritizing the most commonly requested additions. 
Hero Forge adds new content every single week on what we call "Treasure Tuesdays!"
Why Kickstarter? 
Kickstarter has been an incredible tool to help us connect with tabletop and miniatures fans. This direct connection has helped us work with our most passionate supporters and offers an avenue to hear about what features and content you'd like to see added. Your backing will help us in the process of updating our library of thousands of parts to support rich, in-depth color customization, and launch exciting feature additions sooner.
The Future of Hero Forge

                       Hero Forge 2.0 will expand and enhance the design capabilities that Hero Forge is famous for. You can expect us to continue our tradition of innovation, setting the bar for customization and artistry for custom miniatures. 
Preview just a few of our planned additions and advancements in the hero featured in our splash image: XL epic wings, dynamic and detailed bases, magical weapon effects, and cute new companions represent just some of the exciting new features we have planned, so even more people can design their perfect miniature. With your support, we can add this new content even faster, and with the new Hero Forge 2.0 color tools in mind.
Hero Forge 2.0 is the platform for the future of 3D printed custom miniatures. Design and print the most epic of characters, not only in stunning detail, but in gorgeous full color.
Backer rewards include early or permanent access to a range of new features and tools on www.heroforge.com.
Early Access to Color Tools
Be among the first to start designing in color! Backer tiers starting at $34.99 will be given early access to our color design tools. Watch our UI and tools develop before your very eyes!

The First Opportunity to Order Custom Miniatures in Color
We are employing cutting edge technology to bring full-color custom miniatures to you. Backers will be first in line to have figures printed in this exciting new material as we scale up production.
Early and Permanent Access to New 'Token Tools'
Our token tools and new photo booth options will add a range of easy-to-use image capture features to Hero Forge. While we intend to one day add a range of pro-tools to a Hero Forge subscription services, Kickstarter backers will get access to the Token Maker Unlimited with no recurring subscription fees, receiving either a full year of access at lower tiers, or lifetime access at higher backer tiers!
...and Much More!
Want to offer even more support? Check out backer tiers which will allow you to work with our art team to add parts of your own requests and design to Hero Forge! Pledge to add decals, weapons, or armor to Hero Forge and be credited in the mouse-over flavor text of the character builder!
Do you want more than our existing backer tiers offer? No problem! Customize any backer tier with “Add-Ons.” Simply add the following amounts to your pledge to add these perks to your pledge à la carte:
We have a long list of features that we'd like to add to our color options. Your support will help us deliver them even sooner! Read on to hear about the first batch of six stretch goals, with more to be announced once these are met soon!

We're so excited about these last remaining stretch goals. We can't wait to see how many you will help us unlock during these final days of the Hero Forge 2.0 campaign!
Sky Castle Studios, LLC is a Santa Monica-based development studio dedicated to using gaming and technology to inspire creativity and connect people. Established in 2014 after the runaway-hit Hero Forge crowdfunding campaign, we continue to grow our cutting-edge web-based design application and explore the latest in 3D printing manufacturing. 
Special thanks to Fantasy Grounds for letting us feature screen captures of their virtual tabletop program, Kraken Dice for providing the dice featured in our photography, Izzy Gramp for color design, and Kate Elliot at www.kvephotography.com for editing our Kickstarter video.
We are lucky to work with incredibly talented artists all over the world, and would like to thank them for their contributions to Hero Forge. In particular, for their creativity and dedication, we would like to thank Glenn De Leon Garza, Ilya Bondarenko, Roman and Vadim at ZugZug Art, and Rich Carey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Q: Will reaching your funding goal distract you from adding new content? Color is great, but I want more stuff on Hero Forge too!
A: Our modelers’ time and effort will still be dedicated to new content, parts, fantasy races, and features, even as our tech development team works on color at the same time. With independent, focused effort by our art team, we anticipate accelerating additions to the site, even as we add our new color features.

Q: Will I be able to redeem my reward for an "XL" or mounted "XXL" figure?
A: For simplicity, we have set rewards for our standard size-range, unmounted figures. If you prefer to redeem your reward's value towards a more expensive XL or mounted figure, that's alright: we will apply your pledge value and you can pay the difference. Pricing on larger-sized XL and XXL figures is TBD.

Q: I saw a part or feature in your video which isn't on your site yet! What's the story?
A: We have new parts, features, and content in development constantly. In order to keep up with weekly content releases, our art team works diligently on future releases, both those near completion and ones much further away. If you don't recognize any particular parts on this page, chances are they are in development and will appear on the site in the future!

Q: When are you going to add X part? Will Y feature be available when color launches?
A: We process all feature and part requests through the following survey, so please feel free to fill it out to have your request added to our official user wish-list: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/HeroForgeRequest. Our user request wishlist has many hundreds of unique entries, so we cannot provide estimated dates for specific additions.

Q: Will Hero Forge 2.0 be backwards compatible?
A: Yes! All of your existing characters and saves will be fully compatible with our new tools. You will be able to revisit old designs and add color.

Q: Will digital download .stl files be available in color?
A: No. Not initially, at least. File formats which support color are less widely supported by 3D printing software platforms, as color is not yet common for home 3D printers. While we expect to one day offer textured, color 3D model files, for the time being we will continue to distribute digital download model files in .stl format: the most commonly supported format for 3D printing software platforms.

Q: What Printer are you using for your color prints?
A: We plan to manufacture full color prints using the Mimaki 3DUJ-553 full color printer. We have experimented with a wide range of color printers, and have found this technology to offer the most vivid color, cleanest gradients, and best quality at miniature scale. At Hero Forge, we are always exploring the latest and greatest materials, and have historically added to or updating our material options as 3D print technology improves--this is always a possibility for the future.

Q: Do I have to use all my rewards at once, or can I order figures one at a time?
A: Backer tiers include one instance of shipping. If you'd prefer to redeem your backer rewards one at a time, you will simply need to pay for any instance of shipping after the first.

updates.update_userinfo: 'Mud and Blood' Decals and a New Beta Feature!
updates.update_content:
Hello Hero Forge Fans! 
We’re constantly amazed by the creativity with which this amazing community approaches each new feature, achieving all kinds of inventive looks, effects, and characters that we'd never imagined possible when we first launched Hero Forge. To that end, we're excited to announce two cool new features, including a highly anticipated stretch goal and a new experimental option for our full color miniature prints. Read on for more info!

Hello there, Hero Forge Fans!
We hope the new year finds you well. We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Kickstarter news and content additions. Since our last backer update, we’ve launched three more exciting stretch goals: “Light Emanating Surface Effects,” “Expanded Hand Items as Side Items with Posing,” and “Banners!” These new features are available to all Kickstarter backers through their beta access privileges and, as always, we welcome your feedback. Drop by our official color feature feedback survey (https://heroforge.com/color-feedback)and let us know what you think.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re back again with a very merry backer update! Read on to learn about how Hero Forge celebrates the season and find out about special Kickstarter content releases for the holidays.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Update - 3D Virtual Tabletop Models and More Stretch Goals
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest stretch goal progress, new content releases, and to announce an exciting new Hero Forge® product option! Read on for the latest news.

3D Virtual Tabletop Downloads (Compatible with Berserk Games’ Tabletop Simulator)

Ever since we teased the addition of color, we’ve had tons of folks ask about full-color download options for their favorite 3D virtual tabletop applications. Well, we have some good news! We’re thrilled to announce a brand new way to use Hero Forge: for gamers who play online using Berserk Games’ , we now offer a full color “3D Tabletop Download” option!

3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed in .unity3d format. This single-file format makes importing easy and provides superb faithfulness to your original design. 3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed via your user profile page, just like STL downloads, and we offer a free pre-made sample model which is available on your Digital Downloads page . Instructions for importing these models can be found in our support page . Please note that this is a beta feature which will only be visible for users with beta access--a ”public” release date is TBD.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re continuing to hustle on stretch goals and are happy to report that we’ve added several new batches over the last couple of weeks!

New Arm Options
We’ve recently added a wide range of design tools to customize your character’s arms. Hero Forge® now supports four or six armed characters, and arm amputation options including shoulder disarticulation, transhumeral amputation, and transradial amputation. We also added a range of wraps and prosthetic choices for artificial limbs in both realistic and fantastical varieties, including the oft-requested pirate hook hand.

On top of that, we’ve also added the stretch goal for a brand new slider: arm length! This will allow you to stretch your character’s arms to longer, less human proportions.

updates.update_userinfo: The First Batch of Stretch Goal Decals Has Arrived: Hair Ombrés!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans
We're excited to announce that we've arrived at another 'first.' Our first set of decals is now available to Kickstarter backers! As a reminder, decals are additional color-customizable graphic elements that overlay existing parts and colors, adding a whole new layer of flexibility. They also represent one of the most labor-intensive additions to our new color tools, and account for a whopping 14 of our unlocked stretch goals.

updates.update_userinfo: Hero Forge Reddit AMA begins tomorrow at 11:00am PST!
updates.update_content: We will be hosting a reddit AMA on https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/ tomorrow at 11:00am PST. We’ll be answering questions about Hero Forge 2.0, 3D printed tabletop miniatures, and more. Feel free to drop by!

Greetings, Hero Forge Fans

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Hero Forge news. Today is a big one, so read on for exciting updates!

Hero Forge 2.0 Released with New Content
After six months of tireless work, we’re excited to announce that Hero Forge 2.0 with color tools has been released publicly! The first thing you’ll notice is a new, more colorful restyling of our background and menus. We wanted to create a more epic environment for your creativity, and a space where color felt at home, so this aesthetic change felt like a natural evolution from our old grayscale background and menu. This also includes some minor, but long-overdue reorganizations, such as moving expression and eye direction into the “pose” menu.

We also wanted this update to be accompanied by ! Keen eyes will spot the arrival of a several exciting features:

updates.update_userinfo: Public Release for Hero Forge 2.0, “Hero Forge Pro” Subscription News, and More!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans,
We’re back again to keep you posted on the latest and greatest Hero Forge news. Read on for important backer information!

Public Release of Hero Forge 2.0 Color Tools
Over the past six months, you've put our color tools beta through its paces, provided us with fantastic feedback, and created some of the most colorful characters we have ever seen! Now that a significant percentage of Kickstarter backers have redeemed their rewards and a multitude of bugs have been slain, we are excited to launch color tools to the public. At long last, we’re ready to announce an official date, and we’re happy to say it is right around the corner! campaign.story:
In this high-intensity, deductive game, you’ll work together with your friends to find hidden symbols, piece together clues and arrest a culprit, all in just five minutes! 
You’ll win together. You’ll lose together. But every time, you’ll have fun together.
Easy to pick up and quick to play, 5 Minute Mystery is great for newbie gamers, busy families, and game groups looking for an ice-breaker.
So if you’re ready to cheer as you arrest a frog while a British walrus yells at you, then clear a spot on your games shelf for 5-Minute Mystery! 






We’re incredibly grateful for all the support we get from our Kickstarter backers. We wouldn’t have made it this far without you!
So if you supported either (or both!) of our previous Kickstarter campaigns (5-Minute Dungeon, and Curses! Foiled Again!), we have a special gift for you: a free upgrade to the Mastermind Edition! 
How do you claim this fabulous gift? It’s easy! Here’s how:
Back the project for the Standard Edition. If you managed to get the Early Bird version, that qualifies too!
  After the campaign ends, BackerKit will e-mail you a survey to complete your pledge. If you were a previous backer, your survey will include an offer to upgrade your pledge to the Mastermind Edition for free.
  Click “YES!” and grab a pipe and deerstalker cap. You’re now a Mastermind!
  Limit one free upgrade per returning backer.
No problem! Each game you add to your pledge will be at the regular pledge price, plus a nominal $5 CDN shipping charge per extra game. Just add the amount when you make your pledge. 
 Add Standard Editions: +$40 CDN for each additional copy (This includes shipping costs)
 Add Mastermind Editions: +$50 CDN for each additional copy (This includes shipping costs)
Please note that only one Early Bird discount and one Returning Backer Gift can be applied per pledge. Additional copies are at regular price.


For this campaign, we've decided to focus on community involvement rather than stretch goals. We wanted to make sure that no matter how funding turned out you got everything we envisioned for this game: upgraded materials, extra scene cards, more suspects & culprits, and plenty of additional case files to keep the game fresh. Everything that we were planning as stretch goals have already, automatically, been included in each copy of the game!
So instead, we've got some great stuff planned: several polls so you can help to shape the finished game, sneak peeks at game content and components, and contests to win cool prizes!
Once again, we're partnering with BackerKit to make it much easier for backers to manage their pledge choices and shipping information at the end of the campaign.
When the campaign ends, you'll receive a BackerKit survey asking you to provide your shipping information so we can get your rewards to you. As part of this survey, you'll have the opportunity to add more copies of the game at regular price plus $5 shipping per additional game.
We are partnering with depots in the USA, Canada, Europe, China, and Australia to minimize the chances of additional duty and taxes being charged to you. Shipping to areas outside these regions may result in additional charges out of our control. Please research import regulations to learn about these potential costs for your country before  placing an order.
Each pledge must be shipped to a single delivery address. Unfortunately, we cannot split pledges to ship to multiple addresses.
Currency Conversions
Remember that your pledge is in Canadian Dollars, and your card will be billed in Canadian Dollars when the campaign ends. Currency exchange rates change regularly. Look at your local currency exchange rate toward the end of the campaign for the most  current price.
Special Thanks

campaign.story:
We believe the best communities are the ones that form around tabletop games. Whether it’s board games, roleplaying, cards, miniatures, or party games, bringing people together is what tabletop games do best.
You are invited to join Rick Rollz America as one of the Road Warriors, with host Rick Ankney on an epic road trip across America, visiting the incredible local game stores where communities gather, and talking with the amazing designers, artists, publishers and other creators who make the games we love. Together, Rick Rollz America will shine a spotlight on everything great about tabletop gaming and grow our communities by creating captivating videos that show what everyone else has been missing out on!
With Rick at the wheel, The ROAD WARRIORS will go behind the scenes with some of the biggest names in the tabletop industry and see how they’re bringing more games to more people. If we’re lucky (and Rick is famously lucky), we’ll even get some exclusive sneak previews of upcoming games!
Most importantly, the landmarks on our adventure are the pillars of every community: the FRIENDLY LOCAL GAME STORES! These bastions of games and gathering are where tons of communities are built, and this road trip will pay homage to the noble mission we share with them: to grow the ranks of tabletop gaming. The Road Warrior(s) will crash through the front doors and show off the space, staff, and selection of some of the greatest friendly local game stores across the country.
We would be honored to have your support as a member of Rick's Road Warriors on this epic road trip. We have some incredible loot for Road Warriors and Rally Point retailers to show they were one of the first to join us on this journey!
We are also very proud to be welcoming some fantastic companies that will be providing sponsorship in various forms over the course of Rick Rollz America. Here are some of those we have secured already!
PLEDGE LEVELS 
Tommy Rice - Author of THE LOK
As I roll across the USA we’ll be celebrating the best there is in gaming and geek culture! We see comic book characters like Superman, the Hulk, Thor… and we play games as Half-Giant Barbarians or Rogues that can leap over ANY wall with a crit! Well, why can’t we be those people ourselves? We can certainly try! So, as I roll to your city, I’m getting fit and who is helping me? One of our own gamers, my correspondent... the Iron Author… Tommy Rice!
Author of THE LOK, game designer for Mythic Games, bodybuilder, and former Pro-footballer,  Tommy is offering up some great things here to help our Road Warriors start their fitness journeys!
STRETCH GOALS
Who is your fearless Host?
You probably know Rick Ankney as the former host of innovative video series such as “Painting Happy Lil Minis”, “Board Games and Beyond”, and “Building Character.” Rick has been making tabletop content and spreading gaming for over 5 years, and was the Production Manager of Sapphire Studios: the home of Game Trade Media and Previews World Weekly for comics and games distribution companies.
HERE is a look at Painting Happy Lil Minis 
HERE is look at some Building Character episodes 
And HERE are a bunch of interviews from Origins Game Fair 2019: 
But did you know that Rick is a retired Navy Corpsman, was a bona-fide Roadie, and loves the open road? Rick Rollz America is an engaging project that combines his loves of tabletop, travelling, and talking to people who share his passions.
But he can’t do it alone! Together with your help, Rick will take the road less travelled (and many well-travelled roads, too) to personally visit the people who make the magic of tabletop gaming possible, and share it all with the world. Your support as a member of The Road Warriors means you’ll be there right beside him, fueling this year-long adventure of connecting communities across the country. 
The rubber hits the road on January 1st, 2020! Rick  will be out on the road through December, updating you all along the way via social media, so be sure to follow Rick Rollz America everywhere:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/rickrollzamerica
Twitter: @RickRollzAmerica
Instagram:  Rickrollzamerica
Twitch:@RickRollzAmerica
Youtube:Rick Rollz America
If you’ve made it this far, thanks a ton for learning about Rick Rollz America. If you’re a fan of tabletop games and value the communities that make this hobby so special, we would love your support. Even if you can’t pledge right now, sharing this campaign and our social media account links with your friends would mean the world to us.
Hopefully we’ll see you out there on the road and can get in some games together!
SHIPPING
Shipping will be collected in backerkit at the end of the campaign.  Shipping for most pledges (Minus Retailer Pledges)will be $10.00 or less in the USA depended on pledge level selected.

This Kickstarter is to publish the first comic based on the role-playing game Little Fears Nightmare Edition and on the Cthulhu Mythos, will also include an adventure for the role-playing game and a bestiary with 10 creatures of the Cthulhu Mythos adapted for Little Fears Nightmare Edition.

Little Fears Nightmare Edition is a modern horror storytelling game written by Jason L. Blair and published by FunSizedGames.
Monsters are real and they hunt children like you from the shadows. All you have are your wits, your belief, and the friends by your side. No adults can help you. No one else can save you.
Vampires, witches, werewolves, magic, and more await you. Find your courage, fight the monsters, become a hero.
You’re not scared, are you?
Little Fears Nightmare Edition is a story game for two or more players.
Little Fears and Little Fears Nightmare Edition are trademarks of Jason L Blair dba FunSizedGames, used with permission of author.
More information about little fears on the following websites:
http://www.littlefears.com/
http://www.jasonlblair.com/
In 1985 a meteor fell from the sky and crashed into a forest near the small town of Dunwich. For five years a cosmic horror was taking over the forest and the inhabitants of Dunwich, but the adults failed to realize it or decided to ignore it until a small group of children noticed that something eerie/weird/dreadfulwas happening...
Lisa, Nick, Steven, Alex and Micaela, a local group of friends, have realized that pets are disappearing around Dunwich and the worst thing is that adults don't seem to give a damn.
They started investigating on their own and discovered that the latest disappearances have occurred near Steven's house, so they decide to spend the night at Nick's house to keep an eye on Rupert, his dog. They want to find out who is kidnapping the pets.
Faced with Rupert's sad disappearance, the kids decide to go out at night to search for clues, following the trail left by the person or creature. The one responsible for Rupert's kidnapping leads them into the sinister forest on the outskirts of Dunwich.
Fighting their fear by staying together, they arrive at an unknown part of the forest where they find an abandoned house they had never heard about. There, they will encounter the cosmic horrorthat is taking over the darker side of the forest.
The gang does their best to escape from the abandoned house, but in their flight one of their members is snatched. Alone, in the middle of the terrifying forest, frightened and not knowing what to do, they decide to return home.
However, a strange character meets them and gives them Axel's camera. The last photograph taken shows an absolutely dreadful nature.
They quietly return home and begin to prepare the rescue of their kidnapped friend. They already know what they are facing, an unnameable horror, but they don't know how they will save their friend. Then they find that the creature is part of a sect that worships a strange sea monster, a sect to which several adults of the town seem to belong.
Meanwhile, the mysterious character who met the kids before is deceived and led into a death trap. The members of the sect cannot allow this enigmatic individual to continue meddling in their affairs.
The kids, already equipped and prepared for their mission, go out to confront the cosmic horror. They are terrified, but they are much more worried about the fate of their friend than about what might happen to them. The road has become darker and more sinister, but something catches their attention: the mysterious character is in mortal danger.
The sect is preparing a human sacrifice. The countdown to the dawn of a new era begins. Cthulhu awaits to be brought to this plane and the sect wants to offer the soul of the kidnapped kid to fuel the eldritch ritual. 
The kids make it to the altar where their friend is ready to be sacrificed to Cthulhu. Then they discover which villagers belong to the sect, their parents are among them. Lisa gets a sad, but wonderful revelation.
Cthulhu starts to wake up, to finish her transformation he only needs the kid's body...
It shows the true nature of Mr. Cool.
