updates.update_userinfo: Lighting and Vision added to our TEST channel
updates.update_content:
Good morning Kickstarters (if you are in the U.S.),
While we don't plan to continue updates to the Kickstarter now that we've delivered the promised features, I think this is a somewhat special circumstance. Part of the appeal of moving to Unity and rewriting Fantasy Grounds was that it would give us a better platform to expand upon. Many backers asked us about supporting Vision and Dynamic Lighting, and we specifically excluded those items from the scope of our Kickstarter deliverables. Instead, we gave general responses that we would be looking into that and other features once we completed the initial port to Unity.
I am now happy to announce that we have released this feature into our TEST channel for people to play around with and experiment. We will be leaving this in TEST for a few weeks to solicit feedback and to identify any final bugs that were not caught during internal testing. Once we feel that we have ironed out any important issues, we will look to move it into our LIVE channel and everyone will get updated.

updates.update_userinfo: Official Version Released - Goobye Early Access

Thanks to everyone for helping us achieve our goals. We are now officially launched and no longer under Early Access. 
What does that mean?
It means that the app is running smoothly, installing smoothly and has all the features we set out to implement when we first created this Kickstarter. If you were waiting until official launch to switch over to Fantasy Grounds Unity, then this is the time to do it.

updates.update_userinfo: Token Locking version 1 is now available
updates.update_content:
One of the more often requested features from FG Classic was for token locking. It allows a GM to lock the token positions and requires the GM to approval any player movement. It also has the nice side effect of helping players show their intended path and total distance traveled.
We will be following this up with a similar graphical update for pointers and area of effect drawings.

You can see instructions for how to use it on our wiki here (which will be updated over time):


Token Locking is a feature that allows the GM to lock tokens in place and force all movement to be displayed as planned pathways. The GM can then approve or reject movement on a per token basis. Once enabled on a map, any attempted move by players will need to be confirmed by the GM. GMs can continue to move NPC or player tokens without token locking, or they can use the same feature by holding CTRL when they start their move.

We brought on a few new resources since the last update. One of these new people is Steven Melton, a Sr. Full-stack Network Developer. We tasked him with taking over the installers and updaters and also with finalizing the Linux builds. He has been working alongside another of our new hires, Derek Batting, to test everything across multiple operating systems. We are happy to report that the first of these are now available for people to test.

updates.update_userinfo: Latest news on Fantasy Grounds Unity July 2020 - big speed improvements
updates.update_content:
It has been nearly a month since the last update and we have been working hard on addressing some of the biggest issues on our agenda. We have some good news to report on a number of items.
List Loading times have been significantly improved
If you have used Fantasy Grounds Classic for a while, then you were aware that loading the same lists of data within FG Unity was significantly slower. The root cause for this had to do with differences in the LUA library we are using for Fantasy Grounds Unity. To resolve this, we have tried a number of different libraries and we didn't see any noticeable changes. Marshaling of the data between LUA and C# seemed to be the main pain point and large lists suffered very badly from this.

updates.update_userinfo: FGU Update for June, 2020 - Performance is the focus
updates.update_content:
It has been a while since we last posted an update. Our team has been working on a number of issues since that time and we were holding off posting an announcement until after we had a chance to reach a significant milestone. We have released 18 software updates since the mid-March's Open Beta announcement. You can read the details of those in the FGU Early Access Forum. 
March and April Updates

Greetings Backers and Friends!
We have some good news and some bad news.
Bad news - It looks like we will need a bit longer than Q1 2020 (3/31) to get Fantasy Grounds Unity fully launched. We are working through a few minor issues with the main program, Steam's launch may not be able to use third party keys like we planned, and the Linux build is taking a little bit longer to whip out. We still feel very close, but I think it is looking more like mid to late April is a more realistic date.

Version 3.3.10 Released
This update to Fantasy Grounds Classic and Fantasy Grounds Unity helps us further prepare for launch on FGU. The biggest update is that it allows us to split radial menus and button backgrounds from the icon or label to make it easier to theme and develop rulesets. We are still working on some updates to the sidebar buttons and play mode management that should improve the intuitiveness of the system for new users.

campaign.story:
Con on the Cob? What the goose is a Con on the Cob?
Con on the Cob is a FOUR DAY CELEBRATION OF GAMES, ART, FREAKS, AND FUN!
It’s a gaming con, chock full of RPGs, board games, card games, party games, and all sorts of that kind of jazz. It’s also an art fair, with a large selection of talented artists in attendance and an amazing abundance of fantasy, science fiction, horror, and geeky art and art activities. Oh, and it’s The Mother of All Marketplaces, with more than 60 vendors showcasing a wide variety of jazz, snazz, and zazz, boosting the geekonomy like old school Robin Hoods but without the stealing and the archery (ok, not like Robin Hoods. I failed analogy class in Kindergarten). Don’t forget the parties…Did I mention the parties? There are parties. A LOT of them. Also there are other things, like amazing special Guests, the Children of the Cob, the Comedy Music Extravagasm!, a Drag Show, a Burlesque Show, Karaoke, a super sweet Auction, Food Trucks, a Games Library, free snacks in the Con Suite, Panels, Workshops, and Demos, a whole track of Cosplay and Fandom related activities, and a massive horde of potential friends and peeps who dig the same things you dig!   
Why Kickstarter?
This Kickstarter fundraiser will allow us to bring more value to your Con on the Cob experience. Not only will we hopefully have more funds on hand to cover advertising, guests, and venue expenses, we can also provide exclusive items and rewards, such as the CotC annual yearbook and exclusive d6 provided with almost every pledge.
At Con on the Cob we strive to create a safe, welcoming community for all people regardless of age, gender, race, sexual orientation, or strain of geekdom.
Con on the Cob happens October 3-6, 2019 at the Days Inn & Suites in Richfield, Ohio. It's a former Holidome with a huge atrium, indoor pool, miniature golf, playground, and all sorts of other incredibly fun stuff. 
Book your stay at the host hotel by June 8th and be sure to tell them you are with Con on the Cob in order to qualify for a FREE COB CRATE (scroll down for more information). Here's the phone number to call:  (330) 659-6151.

Flying Disk: Holy suffering socks on a stick! Is this a genuine 9.25" flying disk that tells me to get my shiny wazoo to Con on the Cob? It is! $10
Plastic Cup: Lug this plastic drinking cup around to the parties at CotC and you never have to worry about someone swiping your drink. You also use it at the gaming table or to build a sand castle or whatever. $5

THE COTC ONSITE GUIDE
Each year Con on the Cob produces a program book that lists the convention events and schedules, introduces the staff and guests, presents maps of the place, and shows off ads and coupons by vendors and sponsors. The book is 8.5"x5.5" inches and is printed in full color. Ads should be 300dpi jpeg format. Anyone who purchases an ad of any size will also have their name (or company name) listed on the front page of the Con on the Cob website.
To nab an ad simply add the amount listed below to any pledge and send us a message letting us know what you added. Please email ads to andy@andyhopp.com by September 1, 2019.
Eighth Page Ad (2.125"x2.25"): $35
Quarter Page Ad (4.25"x2.25"): $50
Half Page Ad (4.25"x5.5"): $100
Full Page Ad (8.5"x5.5"): $200

PRESTIGE SPONSORSHIPS

Guest Patron: One of our special guests (artist, writer, game designer, performer, etc…) appears courtesy of you. You get name and logo recognition in the onsite book and at the guest's booth as well as a personal introduction to the guest. $250

Just about any CotC room or event can be thusly named so message us to discuss possibilities. Recognition will be on onsite signage, the onsite guide, and on the CotC website. $200
These incredible rewards come into effect when we reach certain funding goals and other milestones.
A Side Hug from a Bald-Headed Black Man ($2000): Kylan Toles, International Man of Mystery and self-proclaimed bald-headed black man, has promised to give a side hug to every single consenting attendee at Con on the Cob once we reach this stretch goal! Maybe someone equally famous will attend. You will be involved in the decision making process, should the goal be attained...

More Stretch Goals to come... 
This year's theme is a weird one. Robots and giant monsters is a familiar and perhaps overdone genre but ROBOTS VS GIANT MONSTERS BUT ALSO EVERYTHING IS MADE OUT OF PRETZELS is something completely new and original! See, every year Con on the Cob has a different theme. This theme carries into many of the activities and parties, as well as the decorations, badges, and other such subtleties. In the past we've had some doozies (Cyberfunk Invasion, Cosmic Circus, Rise of the Elder Cobs, Cobs and Cobbers, The Gawds of Coblympus, Some Sort of Enchanted Fairy Forest or Something, etc...). Guests at Con on the Cob get to vote on the theme for the following year and Robots vs Giant Monsters won by a slim margin. However, it wouldn't be Con on the Cob if we didn't weird it up, so there you go... 
Coins on the Cob are special collectable plastic tokens we use to reward game masters and others for their exemplary participation in Con on the Cob. To read more about these wondrous artifacts please follow this link. 
COB CRATES are special boxes (sometimes bags) of awesome jazz we give FOR FREE to Con on the Cob attendees who meet a few requirements. They are stocked with some really great stuff (board games, card games, jewelry, candy, books, geeky stuff, etc...) donated by our sponsors and by our incredible friends at Alliance Game Distributors. Last year's COB CRATES contained items with a combined average value of over $100. They're a fantastic prize for pretty much doing something you were probably already planning on doing anyway. Here's all you have to do to nab one:
Back this Kickstarter for at least $45 (at least one 4 Day Badge).
Book your stay (at least two nights) at our host hotel (Days Inn & Suites in Richfield, Ohio) by June 8th and be sure to tell them you are with Con on the Cob. Here's the phone number to call:  (330) 659-6151. 
Send me a message on Kickstarter with your reservation number or the name the reservation is under so we can verify your qualifications.
You must attend CotC 2019 in order to claim your COB CRATE.
If you already qualify for a COB CRATE because of actions taken before this Kickstarter launched you will still receive it. No worries.
We reserve the right to limit COB CRATES to the first 50 qualified backers, so pledge early! We'll make as many as we can, but we can't promise more than fifty.
The contents of the COB CRATES depend on what our generous contributors send us and how many people claim them. If you are interested in contributing to the COB CRATES please send me a message.
Con on the Cob is an Includicon, which means everybody is welcome! Please familiarize yourself with our Rules and Policiesbefore attending the con.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Con on the Cob has been an ongoing adventure since 2004. We've changed a lot over the years, learning from mistakes, expanding options, switching dates and venues several times, and working hard to bring you the greatest, safest, most inclusive, and most fun experience possible.

There's always the risk that guests will have other last minute obligations or a meteorite could crash through the ceiling, crippling Gandersnitch the Goblin and ruining a perfectly good Dungeon Master's Guide, but that's remarkably unlikely.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Legion of Liberty: Superheroes of 1776 is an officially licensed setting book for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition role playing game.
In Legion of Liberty, you play a young superhero who joins a group of other heroes to free the American colonies from British rule. As the Revolutionary War progresses, you develop new superpowers, such as shape change, energy weapon, elemental mastery, transmute, disguise, state shift, or weather control, and fight supervillains with powers such as puppet, hunter's path, witchsight, gift of luck, or gate. In Legion of Liberty, your actions may change the course of history, for better or worse! 
Great RPG setting books have great illustrations, so great books need an art budget. Happy Monster Press is a two-person operation. Scott's background is in business and physics; Joy is a writer, with a few traditional watercolor skills and a basic grasp of Photoshop. When the Happy Monster creative team put their heads together to make a piece of custom art, the following masterpiece was the result.
Jacoby Barnes, the Boston Lobster Man, battles Greycoats at the Salem Willows. ZORP.
Some of our friends have said, YES, DO THE WHOLE BOOK THAT WAY! (For you folks, we've added in a stretch-goal; if this project funds at $10K, we'll produce a special edition, fully illustrated by Scott and Joy, for anyone who thinks this is a good idea.) Otherwise, we'll be hiring professional artists to illustrate Legion of Liberty. For Children of the Apocalypse, our first setting book, we hired Yihyoung Li to make custom illustrations.  
"Illuminated," "Aleulama," and "Bastelin" by Yihyoung Li.
Paying for these images consumed Happy Monster's entire art budget, so for the rest of the Children of the Apocalypse, we had to use royalty free stock images. Happy Monster Press believes that professional illustrators should be paid pro rates for their work, which is why we're Kickstarting Legion of Liberty. With a larger art budget, we can pay illustrators like Yihyoung Li to create professional cover art and custom characters like Jacoby Barnes (the Boston Lobster Man), Philomon Smith (the Plymouth Rock Boy), and Deganawidah (the sonic Wampanoag warrior). Adventures such as the Battle of Salem, where Paul Revere (the Silver Speedster) faces off against were-porcupine Jane Goode (aka, "Mauler"), would be even more awesome with full-page illustrations. Please help us bring Legion of Liberty to full-color life with great art.
Background
In the Americas, a tiny percentage of young people (~age 12) develop superpowers. North American Superhumans are a new resource that the European powers are fighting over; whoever rules the most colonies, and commands the most superhumans, will surely gain supremacy across all of Europe. Those superhumans loyal to the British join the Royal Superhuman Regiment (the Greycoats), whereas those siding with the resistance join the Sons of Liberty, who are conspiring to cast off the rule of King George and establish an independent government.
Plot Point Campaign
You, as a young superhuman, will fight historical battles, such as Bunker Hill and Yorktown, but your victories and defeats will affect the course of the American Revolution. The Legion of Liberty Plot Point Campaign includes traditional battles, from early conflicts in Massachusetts to the final confrontations in Virginia; however, the Plot Point Campaign includes several alternate histories the gamemaster can put into play if, for instance, the heroes win a battle that was historically lost. In these alternate histories, for example, the Continental Army might conquer Canada; or General Washington could be captured while crossing the Delaware. Legion of Liberty has been structured to maximize flexibility for the gamemaster and increase the stakes for the players.
For gamemasters wanting to go beyond the American Revolution, Legion of Liberty's new Edges, Hindrances, and Powers provide a framework for other historical or present-day low-power superheroes campaigns, all fully compatible with the new Savage Worlds Adventure Edition.
Game Play
Interact with historical figures like Washington, Hamilton, Franklin, and Sam Adams.
Exert political influence to support the Declaration of Independence.
Foil a secret society of superhuman villains (the Order of the Seventh Circle).
Trounce Redcoat forces in traditional, close-quarters, black powder battles.
Pit your superpowers against elite British superhumans (the Greycoats).
Fight mass battles with custom rules for superhero skirmishes.
New Tools for Players and Gamemasters
18 new Powers (bomber, conjuration, elemental mastery, energy transformation, energy weapon, gate, gift of luck, hunter's path, immunity, implant memory, legion, mimic, nature bond, state shift, stretch, transmute, weather control, witchsight).
22 new Edges and Hindrances for heroes with superpowers.
10 Savage Tales set in the colonies, Europe, and Native American territories.
An adventure generator for raids, battles, reconnaissance, and skullduggery in the American Revolution.
For a sneak peek of Legion of Liberty, download the Jumpstart free at DriveThruRPG today!
Legion of Liberty requires the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition Core Rules to play.
At the Patriot level and above, backers will receive a PDF copy of the Legion of Liberty setting book and any digital stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter. Backers at higher levels will receive softcover or hardcover print copies and any unlocked digital and print stretch goals.
A limited number of backers have the opportunity to be Tuckerized; non-player characters (both heroes and villains) could be named after you!*** For General(s) of the Continental Army (the highest backer level), the co-creators at Happy Monster Press will run a custom session of Legion of Liberty for you and four of your friends, using the Roll20 online platform!
All PDF and print books (other than signed copies) will be fulfilled through DriveThruRPG.
***All Tuckerizations are subject to the approval of Happy Monster Press. The Happy Monster Press Party Poopers(TM) reserve the right NOT to have a superhero called WonderFly McSuperface, because that would only be funny for ten seconds. 
$4000
If funding reaches $4000, we will add two custom digital, printable Chase Decks (Wilderness and Urban). These Chase Decks add obstacles players must negotiate during escape/pursuit scenarios. For instance, after freeing Paul Revere from house arrest so he can run at super speed to alert the colonial militia that the British Are Coming, you must escape a unit of angry British Regulars. But wait! The Chase Deck says there's a cart full of Sam Adams beer kegs blocking the alley! What do you do now?
$5000
If funding reaches $5000, we will provide all of our print backers with print copies of the Chase Decks!
If funding exceeds $5000, we will add additional digital and print stretch goals. 
$10,000
If funding reaches $10,000, Joy and Scott will produce a special digital edition of the Legion of Liberty core book featuring all original Sharpie/watercolor art! (This is for those backers who've noticed and appreciate that the abbreviation for Legion of Liberty is LOL.)  
Founded in 2017, Happy Monster Press is a collaboration between Joy and Scott Marchand Davis. Joy is a published science fiction, fantasy, and horror writer, and an RPG player. Scott is a game writer, with 25 years of experience as an RPG gamemaster. This is Happy Monster Press's second setting book. Their first setting book, Children of the Apocalypse, is currently available on DriveThruRPG. 
This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.

campaign.story:
A Savage Worlds Adventure Edition Licensed Product!
Welcome to Terra, a parallel world where magic lives and the dinosaurs never died out. Humans never evolved on Terra--instead, the world is dominated by floral life and saurians. Humans exist on Terra, however, drawn from the legendary world of Earth.
On Earth, humans number in the teeming billions, unaware of their magical potential and heroic birthright, but when Terra's fate hangs in the balance, it draws human champions across the Warp of space. These champions can act for good or ill, but theirs is the power to change the fate of a world.
Five years ago, the Dragon Empire subjugated the peaceful Mandragoran Kingdom, slaying the Sunflower King and sending his daughter and only heir, the Peachblossom Princess, into exile. The barbarian kappa and their fungal berserker allies run roughshod over the mandragoran people--and the land can no longer bear their pain. It calls for champions!
Whether Earth-born or Terran, it matters not! What matters is a hero's spirit. You will need power, wisdom, and courage to face the dangers of the Mushroom War.
Terra needs heroes!
Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War is a role-playing game using the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition rules by Blackwing Productions. Come adventure in a world of floral sorcery and saurian savagery!
Heroes of Terra is a pulp-fantasy setting in the vein of classic sword-and-sorcery literature, with a world that pays homage to classic video games of the early 1980s. It's also strongly influenced by the isekai genre of Japanese anime and manga. You can think of the world of Terra as Conan the Barbarian, but the main character is a mustachioed Italian plumber instead of Arnold Schwarzenegger. Or The Lord of the Rings with characters from Super Smash Brothers as the Fellowship.
Influences on the setting include Super Mario Brothers, The Legend of Zelda, Elric of Melniboné, Conan the Barbarian, John Carter of Mars, the Lankhmar novels, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, Donkey Kong Country, KonoSuba, and more, all thrown into a blender on high speed.
Jump high, grow huge, and break open chests filled with gold coins and flowers that give you magic powers. The various wink-and-nod references throughout the setting help Heroes of Terra work on two levels: first, as a semi-parody of beloved classic video games; and second, as a semi-serious pulp-fantasy setting where the stakes are as high as the survival of nations.
Human Channeler
Art by Jen
Terra is a parallel world, created 65 million years ago when a rogue asteroid came hurtling from the void of space. The life force of the world burned hot to save itself from destruction, but the effort spit the fabric of reality in two.
In one world, the asteroid struck the world; while life was spared by the world-spirit's power, the life force of the world-spirit was irrevocably damaged, slowly draining away magic. That world was Earth, a place with almost no magic remaining by the modern day. Humans have evolved to utilize what little magic remains to its fullest potential, though they remain largely ignorant of their potential.
In the other world, the asteroid missed by the slimmest of margins. This world, Terra, remains a highly magical place. Dinosaurs remained dominant and mammals remained small and unimportant. Modern Terra hosts dozens of sentient races, the most numerous of them descended from saurians or from plants and fungi.
Until five years ago, the greatest nation in the world was the mighty Mandragoran Kingdom, a peaceful land of flowers and floral sorcery. In a devastating attack, the kingdom was toppled and is now occupied by the forces of the Dragon Empire, a barbarian horde of saurian warriors and fungal berserkers united by the mighty Dragon Emperor.
With the Sunflower King dead and his daughter either imprisoned or in hiding, the kappa have begun to exploit the kingdom's land to the breaking point. The land has begun to awaken, calling out for heroes and giving powerful gifts to those who will aid it.
This initial setting book is designed to introduce players to the world of Terra and the return of humans during a time of great crisis, the Mushroom War.
Mandragoran Floral Sorcerer
Art by Jen
Humans and their return to Terra are the focus of the game, but they are not Terra's only heroes. Join the peaceful mandragora, quick quetzal, clever pudica, and even renegades from the dreaded kappa and myconite hordes as they seek to overthrow the Dragon Emperor and end his reign of terror!
This Kickstarter is designed to fund the first book of the setting line, Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War, a setting book specifically focused on the continent of Lemuria and the conflict between the Dragon Empire and the Mandragoran Kingdom. This book will give you everything you need to adventure in the pulp-fantasy world of Terra and explore its wonders, mysteries, and terrors.
Additionally, one of this Kickstarter's major stretch goals is the writing of a Plot Point Campaign about the rebellion against the Dragon Emperor. Even without that campaign material, the Heroes of Terra setting book will give you all you need to run epic sword and sorcery adventures in a world where the dinosaurs never died out and magic still reigns.
Kappa Warrior
Art by Jen
All rewards for this Kickstarter are digital in nature, as well as vouchers for at-cost printing through DriveThruRPG's print on demand service. This is being done in order to avoid many of the pitfalls of role-playing Kickstarters, which often over-promise physical rewards and then have a hard time delivering on them. By focusing on the game itself--the setting, the plot point campaign, and adventures--it is my hope to be able to provide everything in a timely manner.
The writing for the setting book is around 90% done as of the beginning of this Kickstarter, barring additions from the reward tiers. The proceeds from this Kickstarter are primarily being used to pay for editing, professional layout, and art.
Everyone who pledges at least $1 will have access to the 12-page Heroes of Terra Jumpstart that was originally included as part of the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition Kickstarter! This 12-page document gives a brief overview of the world, the role of the players, mechanics, and a short adventure, "The Plumber's Dilemma." This jumpstart is intended as a preview of the setting to help $1 backers decide if they want to upgrade their pledges to get the full player's guide or setting book. Even if you cancel your pledge, feel free to keep the jumpstart!
(The Heroes of Terra Jumpstart will be included with Update #1 of this Kickstarter.)
Everyone who pledges $5 or more will receive a copy of the Player's Guide to the Mushroom War, a primer on the world of Terra, character creation for Terran heroes, and the magic of the land. This product currently exists in a "rough" version--fully written and edited, but without much in the way of art or layout. A finished version of the Player's Guide (in pdf) will be distributed to every person who pledged $5 or more upon successful completion of the Kickstarter!
Quetzal Wanderer
 Art by Jen
The most basic stretch goal is for the writing of a Plot Point Campaign for Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War, entitled "Our Princess is in Another Castle." This campaign will take members of the Peachblossom Resistance through a whirlwind adventure to find and rescue the Peachblossom Princess, restore her to the throne of the Mandragoran Kingdom, defeat the seven generals of the Dragon Empire who rule the subjugated kingdom, and overthrow the hold of the mighty Dragon Emperor.
Even if that stretch goal is not achieved, the basic setting book will include plenty of plot hooks, adventure seeds, and ideas for campaigns, but the plot point campaign will take those ideas, expand on them, and deliver a full-length campaign for immediate use. Since this portion of the book is in outline form only right now, the additional cost above the basic rewards is to set aside the time to complete writing, as well as additional costs for extra layout, editing, and art.
$4000: The plot point campaign gets written! Backers will receive a .pdf copy of the Plot Point Campaign "Our Princess is in Another Castle" as well as a random adventure generator and random encounter tables for adventuring in the world of Terra.
$5000: A set of eight pre-generated characters will be included with "Our Princess is in Another Castle," as well as bundled separately into lavish .pdf character folios as part of the Player's Guide. All characters generated through the Mandrake pledge tier will also be included in the character folio!
$6000: A full-color poster map of the Mandragoran Kingdom and the surrounding territories will be created as part of the Kickstarter campaign. A high-resolution .pdf of that poster map will be added to all digital reward tiers (Wildflower and up).
$8000: The amount of full-color art in Heroes of Terra will double, including character illustrations for the eight pre-generated characters from the Plot Point Campaign. This is the stretch goal needed to ensure lovely art for the Plot Point Campaign!
$10,000: "Our Princess is in Another Castle" will include a series of Savage Tales to round out the adventuring possibilities of the world of Terra, increasing the overall length of the plot point campaign!
Pudican Artificer
 Art by Jen
As mentioned above, the basic writing for Heroes of Terra is virtually complete, requiring only editing changes, plus whatever additional materials are added to the setting as part of this Kickstarter. Should the stretch goals be met, some amount of additional time will be needed to complete the plot point campaign, commission the extra art, and so on.
In order to give everyone plenty of time to get everything done, I'm noting full completion as being by February of 2020, though everyone who pledges for $5 or more will receive a pdf of the rough-cut Player's Guide at the Kickstarter's completion and funding, as well as the finished Player's Guide as soon as it's done.
Myconite Scavenger
Art by Jen

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The setting book is mostly written and the material has been extensively playtested over a period of several years before being updated to Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. Even if I were to fall ill or (gasp!) die, I have colleagues who can oversee the completion of the project.

I am financially stable, with a regular career and a full-time job, so even if the costs somehow balloon out of control, I can make everything work.

This is my first role-playing Kickstarter, but I have learned extensively from other authors and creators, as well as being an active supporter of many other role-playing Kickstarters. I know what is expected of me, as well as how to juggle the various necessities of running a Kickstarter campaign.

The greatest risk involves delays due to artwork or layout issues, which I've done everything I can to mitigate, especially by limiting the rewards to digital-only or print-on-demand. I will consistently communicate with the team and all backers to ensure we're all in the loop about the project's progress. It is my intention to send out updates every couple of days during the Kickstarter itself, and then at least once a month thereafter until everything is done and ready.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
Just a quick reminder: After you download Heroes of Terra from DTRPG, please remember to rate the book and share your purchase on social media! Ratings help drive site statistics, and we want as many eyes on the finished product as possible to help improve the odds we'll be able to do another one. Your ratings and support on social media can make the difference between HoT being a one-off and the writing of things like supplements and the plot point campaign!

Dear friends,
The POD vouchers from DTRPG should be en route to everyone whose pledge level included one. A few of you are getting vouchers for both the softcover and hardcover versions due to a mailing error; feel free to use whichever one you like, or even both. Consider it a special gift!
Make sure to check your DTRPG account that is associated with the email address you gave during the survey. It's possible for the discount codes to get caught in your spam folder or to not show up in your email account even though it's been in your DTRPG inbox for several days. (That's certainly happened to me!) If you haven't gotten a discount code by Monday and think you should have, message me and I'll check to see what's going on.

Dear Friends,
DTRPG has approved the print files (at last), so the final version of Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War is now live for purchase! Those of you who backed at levels that included POD coupons will be receiving those shortly, and everyone who was waiting for the finished product can jump on that now!
The DTRPG page is live!

Dear friends,
The final PDF version of Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War is now available for download! New download links are going out from DTRPG as we speak! The PDFs won't be available for public sale until the POD version is ready, so for now you're all part of a very exclusive club!

Dear Friends,
Exactly one year ago today, Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War completed its Kickstarter run successfully. Today, I am happy to announce that the book is (almost) ready for release! The full layout and art version of The Mushroom War is ready to go out to backers for a corrections and errors pass before getting finalized and being released to the public! This year-long journey has been absolutely incredible, and it wouldn't have been possible without all of you.

campaign.story:
After the wipe...
A vile contanimator known as THE LITTER BUG is waggling foul zazz, draining Mutha Oith of its once vibrant colors and generally bumming everyone out. Are you awesome enough to discover his dread motives, rebuke his fell ministrations, and return the world's erstwhile tints and hues? It will take all your gumption, half your smarts, a steady hand, and at least one crayon (or pencil, marker, paintbrush, spork, etc...).
It's a coloring book for kids and adults (although there might be some butts)!
It's a rhyming story book!
 It's a Low Life game accessory (No knowledge of Low Life is required)! 
PLAY

 Project Specifications:
8.5"x11" high quality coloring and story book.
70# white uncoated paper for easy coverage with a variety of coloring media.
At least 96 pages (probably more - check out the STRETCH GOALS!).
Coloring pages on one side so you don't have to sacrifice one to color another.
Signed and Personalized.
Metal coil binding so it lays flat when you open it.
Perforated pages for easy tear-out. 
Includes at least THREE new monsters for the Low Life game available nowhere else.
A broad assortment of pledge levels and extras to choose from (scroll way down for descriptions of the stretch goals, extras, and a graphic depicting the various pledge levels).
 There's a free gift for you at the bottom of the page. It's yours just for taking the time to peruse. Thank you! 
This thing shows what the original illustration looks like compared to the coloring book version.
PLAY

Friends and fans have been requesting a Low Life themed coloring book ever since we first plopped printed coloring sheets featuring Low Life artwork in the Children of the Cob room at Con on the Cob over a decade ago. My goal is to provide a highest quality, fun and whimsical artistic and literary experience for people of all ages and experience levels. 
Click to enlarge.
Although absolutely no previous knowledge of (or interest in) the Low Life game is needed to enjoy this book, certain things in After the Wipe expand and expound upon material in various other Low Life publications. 
Will your enjoyment of this book be increased if you enjoy Low Life? Absolutely, it will. 
Will your enjoyment of Low Life be increased if you have this book? Again, it most certainly will.
Do you need to have one to enjoy the other? Nope, you do not. It's kind of like how you don't have to read the entire spectrum of superhero comics in order to enjoy a superhero coloring book.
What does After the Wipe add to the Low Life game? In addition to creating a narrative that helps the reader explore and understand various peeps, creeps, and locales on Mutha Oith, this book features new monsters and, if the proper stretch goals are attained, new playable character species and other extremely interesting things.
Are other Low Life items offered as part of this Kickstarter campaign? Yes indeed, they are. Some are already included in various pledge levels and others are described in the Add-Ons and Extras section below.
Low Life is a tabletop roleplaying game (RPG), which uses the amazing Savage Worlds rules system by Shane Lacy Hensley and Pinnacle Entertainment Group. All of the books in the Low Life line are written as if they are actual books created by a denizen of Oith. All game references and material are in the appendices at the back. This means you can read and enjoy the books on their own merit without even caring that it's a game at all. Similarly, they can be used as props in-game and referenced by players. The rule is, if you have the book so does your character (unless the Boss decides otherwise).
Download a FREE 113 page preview copy of Low Life by clicking this link! 
Low Life is an official Savage Setting!
These features will be added when the requisite funding level or happenstance occurs. Some are attained when a particular dollar amount is reached. Others are dependent on various criteria described below.   
ATTAINED! If we reach the initial $3000 funding goal within 24 hours of launch every coloring book sent to kickstarter backers will be SIGNED AND PERSONALIZED by the author and every backer's name will be included in a special The Whole Hole Benevolence Society Thank You section in the book.

 ATTAINED! The book will feature a special metal coil binding that will allow it to lay flat for easier use. Additionally, we will be producing a number of LEFT-HANDED books with the binding on the right hand side so left-handed people won't get sore wrists.  
ATTAINED! Pages will be perforated along the spine to facilitate easier removal from the book.    
ATTAINED! Sixteen additional pages will be added to the book!   
Another batch of sixteen pages will be added!   
An exclusive new monster for the Low Life game will be included in the book.   
The pages that face the coloring pages will feature greyscale versions of those same images. The greyscale images offer a varied coloring opportunity.  
This reward happens when we reach 500 responses (Interested or Going) visitors on the After the Wipe Facebook event page. I will produce a live video of myself coloring a brand new Low Life drawing. The drawing will appear in the upcoming The Whole Hole - A Gadabout's Guide to Mutha Oith - Volume 03: The Incredibly Huge Monster and you'll be among the first to see it. The video will be posted here as well.
All $30+ backers will receive a FREE 5"x7" print of the Litter Bug and his horde of contanimants.  
The kickstarter backers and I will work together to create a new playable character species for the Low Life game. It will be featured in the book as a colorable line drawing and a grayscale illustration. If the $20,000 stretch goal is attained the character species will appear as a full color illustration as well.   
Yet another batch of sixteen pages will be added to the book.  
The sixteen pages added by the $12,000 stretch goal will instead be FULL COLOR and will include new content for the Low Life game (the backers will get to help me decide what to include). In PDF form this will be a separate book. In the printed version it will be a new section of the coloring book. 
These things can be added to any pledge level. To do so, simply increase your pledge by the listed amount and either send me an email (andy@andyhopp.com subject =Coloring book extras) letting me know what extras you added or include that information in the survey you will be sent after the campaign ends. You can turn them into jewelry, magnets, suncatchers, fetish totems, or whatever other wacky things your mind can conjure. They're just like Shrinky Dinks but not in any sort of copyright violating way. I'll even include the images as PDFs so you can nab more shrinking paper on your own and print as many as you want.
We will work together to create a really cool peep or creep. The best part is YOU GET TO KEEP THE ORIGINAL DRAWING!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fortuitously, much of the work for this project has already been completed. Printer quotes and publishing arrangements have been acquired and all is in readiness. Well, most is in readiness. There are still words to write, illustrations to draw, and images to trace, but the release projection accounts for such phenomena. Barring societal collapse or environmental devastation few reasons exist why After The Wipe shouldn't soon be a thing that's a thing. All is proceeding as I have foreseen.

Nevertheless, the whims of incidental happenstance are fickle. Should problems arise they will be dealt with. Contingencies are in place. The only major obstacle to overcome is the allotment of time required to create new drawings for the various sections of the book that require them but I am confident they will be completed on time and within the proposed budget.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The plagued living and the restless dead clash as the wall crumbles down in this unique board game from Twilight Creations. 
Victory is had by eliminating the opposing army but it's not a simple matter of superior numbers or strength of arms. The battlefield is divided by The Wall, an ancient un-scaleable barrier. The wall has been boobytrapped and the playing fields riddled with mines. As play progresses, spans of the wall fracture and collapse opening the way for troops but also triggering boobytraps. Don't forget about the mines. Walk carefully, shoot straight and cross your fingers! 
The wall is an exciting and unique element in this game. Players will physically remove portions of the wall during play, causing parts of the playing fields to become vulnerable. Reveal enough of your opponent's forces to crush them on your way to victory!

campaign.story:
Lord of the Chords is the punniest, geekiest, most secretly educational music theory card game in the world! The card game that musicians play when they're not playing music!

Press Ctrl+f and search for the keywords to skip to the section you want to look at! E.g. search for "Shipping" to jump to the portion on Shipping!
WOW
You get a chord! They get a chord! Everybody gets a chord!
Rewards
Was the pun too much of a strrrrreeeeetch?
 SGD $55 Minor Edition

"I got you a GIF!"
SGD $88 Major Package



SGD $288 Augmented Package


Rewards Summary
 Initially, we laser-cut a keyboard-shaped box from thick cardboard to store our cards, just for fun. To our surprise, people went crazy over the box! There were actually some people who bought our early test version of the game just for the box, without even trying the game! We knew we had something special on our hands.
"I love the box!" - Jordan Rudess
However, it was definitely not feasible to handcraft all the boxes! And the cardboard version wasn't durable enough. Most people told us to just go with a normal cardboard box since it would be easier but we wanted our backers to feel the same sense of amazement we did so we're glad to announce we've found a great manufacturer in China who's working with us to design the box!
Add-ons
Stretch Goals



Gameplay
There's a small mistake in the video - can you spot it? ;)
Check out our rulebook here, it's currently a work in progress hosted on Google Docs. Feel free to comment and offer feedback :) 
Public Reception
 Gameplay video with Kirsten Long and Wanning Wong (full time musicians and music teachers)!
 Listen to our interview with Shelly Davis from PianoParentPodcast!
 Video interview with The Cardboard Stacker:
The Dream Team
The Wusbands - "Work Husbands"
We are just 3 Musically-inclined(hence the theme), Engineering-trained(hence the box) and Game-addicted(hence the game) guys from Singapore(hence the asian parents forcing us to learn music). 
We had a horrible experience learning music theory when we were younger.  We created this game because we want to transform that terrible experience into a terrific experience, and we believe we can - with your help! 
While this is our first Kickstarter, all 3 of us have backed Kickstarter projects before and we each bring strong complementary skills to form a great team. From video filming to digital marketing to game design to publicity outreach, the three of us have been hard at work daily to chase our dreams. We've tried to do as much of it by ourselves as possible so that we can ensure that every part of this campaign and journey retains the style, humor and quality that we've promised with the game.
If you’re into geeky Musical references and epic Composer puns, Pliszt Bach us and help us to make this game a reality. 
Check out Jonathan's Medium Article for the detailed composition of our bach story, filled with lots of be-haydn-the-scenes action and accounts of our crazy sustained hustling.
Thank you! - Keith, Jon and Jun Yu
Additional Notes
Why support us on Kickstarter
We need your help to fund the production of Lord of the Chords and make it the best music card game ever. As a backer, you'll also help us unlock stretch goals that will improve key components of the game for everyone.
In return, we're offering major discounts for both the Minor and Major tiers from the MSRP and we'll make sure that all backers get their copies before retail release. 
Work together with us! Music theory can be complicated and downright different between countries and cultures. We love hearing your feedback and advice and we've already been receiving lots of advice from supporters pre-campaign that has helped us made many useful changes to the game.
Translations and Musical Variations
All of the below options will be available as choices on the backer survey we will send out at the end of the campaign. Select the options you want and we will make sure you get the best version of the game for you!
Language options available:
English (default)
 Spanish
German
Game content options available:
Default version (with crotchets and Bflat)
EU version (Bflat becomes B and B becomes H)
American version (Differences in rhythm terminology - "crotchets" become "quarter notes")
If you know of other differences or things we should take into account, please let us know! Here is a Google Sheet with descriptions and translations for the Minor Edition. Feel free to add translations in your own language!
Manufacturing, Shipping and Pledge Manager
Manufacturing
We are currently working together with WhatzGames (King of Tokyo, Krosmaster Quest, Antidote) to produce our game components and IdealHard (Robo3D, Body Boss) to manufacture our box - both in China. Both companies have great records of working with Kickstarter campaigns and we have been in close communication with the companies pre-launch.
Shipping
Shipping will not be charged during the campaign. It will be charged through the pledge manager after the campaign based on the actual costs incurred to ship. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.
We will be working with various experienced fulfillment centers. We are offering tax-friendly options for US, EU, Canada, Australia and Mexico.
The shipping rates below are an estimate but they will be the maximum possible value charged to the pledge manager at the end of the campaign. We have slightly overestimated some of the rates so as to give ourselves some leeway to work with unforeseen circumstances. 
Delivery is expected to be in October 2019.
Pledge Manager
We will be working togther with CrowdOx. For those who are new to Kickstarter, a pledge manager will help us to manage the orders and information more effectively. About a week after the campaign ends, all backers will receive an email with a survey to confirm shipping address, shipping costs and any additional add-ons or purchases that they'll like to make.
Retailers
Please email us at hello@lordofthechords.com. Thank you!
Our Estimated Timeline
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Lord of the Chords LLP was founded in 2018, by Jonathan, Jun Yu and Keith. All three of us engineering majors at university. We are proud to say that the three of us have taken a year's leave of absence to ensure that fulfilment goes smoothly. There's nothing more that we want than for Lord of the Chords to be in your hands, wow-ing your friends, making you laugh, and showing you that music theory can in fact be fun!

At Lord of the Chords, we strive to make products that are beautiful, hilarious, and enlightening, and we think we've done that with this game.

The money raised by this campaign will be used to fund the first round of production for Lord of the Chords. This includes injection molding for the box, manufacturing costs for the cards, rulebook and tokens, and shipping.

We have done our best to accurately gauge our costs by building relationships with our future manufacturers and suppliers. 

While printing, shipping, and processing delays are always a possibility, we have set a reasonable delivery date based on our experience.

Fun Guaranteed! 
We want you to love your experience with Lord of the Chords. If you don't enjoy the game after you've received and played it, just send it back to our headquarters and we'll issue you a full refund, no questions asked.

Refunds – Kickstarter 
If you'd like a refund before your item ships, you have until one week before the scheduled ship date to request one. We can offer you a 90% refund since Kickstarter retains about 10% of your pledge for various fees. If there is something wrong with your item, we appreciate the opportunity to replace or exchange it. If a refund is preferred and there is no defect with the product, you'll be responsible for shipping it back to us. Upon receipt of the returned item, we'll issue you a 90% refund. Refund requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.

Replacements 
We are always happy to replace defective or damaged tokens, cards, or other components. Just send us photos of the damage, and we will ship a replacement at no additional cost to you. If your item needs to be returned, we will cover the cost of the return shipping. We provide replacement pieces while titles are active in our catalog, which is typically at least a year after their initial printing. Replacement requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Alternate Action Deck Add-On!
You may have heard about the big Kickstarter release of the new edition of Savage Worlds. Well, Savage Worlds Adventure Edition is out and eager GMs and Players are already having fast, furious, fun. We at Sigil want to help you have even more, so we’re bringing you The Savage Sign!
Inside this amazing-looking volume you’ll find an entertaining bundle of goodies to enhance your Savage fun. There are four immersive settings, exciting new character options, awesome gear, new custom setting rules, creature features, stand-alone Savage Tales, short stories, a 6-page comic, and more to make your fun faster and even more furious!
If you are a Savage Worlds GM, you’ll love the new ready-to-play settings. They feature worlds organized around a familiar central story or theme, but all are original and compelling. Each setting is supported by specialized rules to really create the kind of game experience you want at your table. There are also terrifying and cool creature features, presenting monsters horrible and strange for you to challenge your players’ characters. And each setting includes at least one adventure, complete with maps and pre-generated characters! The Savage Sign will make your games hum and help you create a memorable experience for your players.
If you are a Savage Worlds Player, you’re going to want to get in on this too. The character options alone will have you drooling to play these new Wild Cards, not only in our outstanding original settings but in any Savage Worlds game. Beyond character options, you’ll also find inspiring character folios, portraits, tokens, and maps all to help you imagine your own adventures between sessions! 
If you just like games, there’s plenty here for you, including game designer diaries, action-packed comics, gripping short stories, and truly top-quality art by award-winning artists like Jason Engle and Aaron Riley. We hope you’ll want to page through The Savage Sign again and again!
If you play or run Savage Worlds, enjoy comics, fiction, and art, then The Savage Sign is for you! 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise production funds for the creation of a 96+ page color book and other goodies chock full o' fast, furious, fun! 
Want an insider's look and some extras? Check out our Patreon..
Want to meet fellow Savage Worlds fans? Chat with our developers? Play some games? Join The Savage Sign Discord community.
Below are some additional details about the content you'll find in this issue of The Savage Sign.
Each setting contains player options, setting rules, gear, a gazetteer, Creature Features, and Savage Tales supporting the setting.
PANTHEON by Ian Eller
Welcome to a world of super-heroic adventure. Here you will find both four colored fisticuffs and secret laden shadows, empowered modern demigods and mere mortals willing to face them. 
Our comic, SIGNAL STRENGTH, takes place in the Pantheon setting, and the story will unfold in 6-page chapters through the multiple issues of The Savage Sign.
Our fiction also takes place in the Pantheon setting, and reveals the origin story of a brand new super.
PSINAUT by Aaron Acevedo, Ian Eller, Eugene Marshall
The future. Humankind has expanded into the universe. We have discovered not only wonders without, from the remains of ancient civilizations to a dizzying array of habitable worlds, but also wonders within: the inherent power of consciousness called psionics. Despite its expansions and advances, however, humankind remains ever at war, and in the far future those wars spread across the cosmos powered by billion year old weapons of mysterious origin.
REVOLUTION by Eugene Marshall
Set in France in 1789, on the eve of the French Revolution, Revolution features swashbuckling musketeers dueling in the streets, alchemists concocting strange compounds in their alchemical labs, and intellectuals, spies, and members of secretive, occult societies plotting and plying their revolutionary ideas in the salons of French aristocratic Paris, all while the heady draught of revolution brews across Europe.
VIRULENT by Aaron Acevedo, Sean Bircher, Darrell Hardy, Eugene Marshall, Brain Reeves, and John Wick
This is a post apocalyptic setting of dark survival in a world ruled by three plagues: vampires, werewolves and zombies. The players take the roles of survivors trying to find a way to close the Door: a gateway that links their world to our own.
The Bride by Brian Reeves (Sword & Sorcery Savage Tale)
When a prince's bride-to-be is kidnapped by a vile sorcerer, the heroes ride out to her rescue, only to find things are not always as they appear.
Brimstone Messiah by Matthew Cutter (Modern Horror Savage Tale)
They once followed Grimes on his path to magical revelation. But now a group of former cultists must revisit their darkest nightmares to save a helpless captive—before her blood is offered up to the demon, Nil!
The Wizard by John Goff (Modern Horror Savage Tale)
Heroes’ search for a missing person leads them onto the streets and into an abandoned park where they find a hidden society that stretches from the bottom of the social ladder to the very top.
 Land Ho! by Zach Welhouse (Fantasy Savage Tale)
A vengeful pirate is transforming small islands into large warriors! Join a crew of heroic sailors, descend a living mountain, battle a demon, and (possibly) reunite a shattered family.
Savage Worlds Licensees
We also have several other Aces interested in contributing new material for their settings, including Suzerain, Shaintar, Low Life, Tropicana, SAINTS and Synners, and others. We're still working on the final line up however, because we have limited space for additional content.
Our creative team includes Aaron Acevedo, Carol Darnell, Ian Eller, Min Lungelow, Eugene Marshall, Brian Reeves, Alida Saxon, and a host of Sigil's talented creators. 
Our team has produced the official art for Savage Worlds products since 2012, among numerous other projects like Deadlands Classic, Torg Eternity, and Unknown Armies. We have won multiple ENnie and Origins Awards for our previous work. 
We've also got contributions from Savage Worlds veterans too: Matthew Cutter (Deadlands), John Goff (Deadlands Noir), Darrell Hardy (Irongate), Sean Bircher (Rifts), Sean Roberson (Rifts), Darren Pearce (Suzerain/Shaintar), and Zach Welhouse (Suzerain).
Savage Worlds is a tabletop role-playing game published by Pinnacle Entertainment Group. It is the core ruleset for all Pinnacle’s current roleplaying games, including Deadlands, Rifts, Flash Gordon, Lankhmar, and more. It has everything you need to play narrative or miniature-based games, with quick, simple, yet comprehensive rules for everything from combat to Dramatic Tasks, Chases, and Interludes. The emphasis is on less bookkeeping for the Game Master so she can quickly and easily create worlds and adventures for any setting, and focus on the players and their actions during frenetic combat.
New to Savage Worlds? Want to try it for free? Search the Pinnacle store for “test drive.” They have several options for you to print a simple version of the rules with an adventure to test it for yourself!
This game references the Savage Worlds game system, available from Pinnacle Entertainment Group at www.peginc.com. Savage Worlds and all associated logos and trademarks are copyrights of Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Used with permission. Pinnacle makes no representation or warranty as to the quality, viability, or suitability for purpose of this product.
**Please note that backers pay for printing and shipping costs.**
We are using DriveThruRPG print-at-cost fulfillment for this project. What does that mean exactly? After funds are delivered by Kickstarter, we'll send you a voucher, and then you pay DriveThruRPG the actual costs of printing and shipping, and they ship your products directly. 100% of backer money goes toward creating this project, so we don't have to increase the goal or pledges to cover the costs of printing and shipping.  
The estimated print cost for softcover books is $7 and action decks are $6 each. Shipping costs vary by location. DrivethruRPG ships internationally and estimated shipping costs can be found here.
After Kickstarter retail prices.
Once we meet our original funding goal, we’ll add Stretch Goals to make this project an even better deal. Let’s unlock as many as we can and make The Savage Sign as entertaining as possible!
Unlocked - $6000 Stretch Goal 1: Additional Savage Tale by Matthew Cutter.
Matt has penned several award-winning game supplements for Deadlands: The Weird West. He wrote Pinnacle’s licensed adaptation of Eric Powell’s Eisner Award-winning The Goon™, contributed a Plot Point Campaign book for The Last Parsec: Eris Beta-V, and his short story “A Lonesome Place to Die” appears in The Cackler graphic novel for Deadlands.
Unlocked - $8000 Stretch Goal 2: Additional Savage Tale by John Goff
John Goff has authored, co-authored, or edited over two dozen works for Pinnacle, John is certainly best known for his first solo project, the Dime Novel Night Train. There is no truth to the rumor, however, that John receives a royalty for each player character slain while playing the adventure.
Unlocked - $10000 Stretch Goal 3: Additional Fiction by Kevin Andrew Murphy.
Kevin Andrew Murphy writes for many worlds, including George R.R. Martin's Wild Cards series (in development for television at Universal), Paizo's Pathfinder Tales, White Wolf's World of Darkness, and worlds of his own invention.  
Additional copies of The Savage Sign 01 (PRINT) - add $16 each
Want extra print copies of the book? No problem we will supply addition print-at-cost vouchers for $16 each.
Additional Action Decks (PRINT) - add $6 each
Want extra print-at-cost Action Decks? We've got you covered with additional vouchers for $6 each.
Character Folio / Table Tent (PDF) - add $5
Custom Character/Monster Art - add $125 each
Want to create a signature character or monster of your own to appear in The Savage Sign? With this add-on, you'll work with one of Sigil's artists to create a full-color, digital portrait of a character or monster of your own design. You'll receive a high-resolution, print-ready image, as well as a custom character folio with your new character art inserted.
Custom Maps - add $ 225 each
Want to create a signature map of your own to appear in The Savage Sign? With this pledge level, you'll work with one of Sigil's artists to create a full-color, digital map (8.5 x 5.5 inches) of your own design. You'll receive a high-resolution, print-ready image and PDF of your new map.
Custom Action Decks - add $225 each
Want to create a custom action deck for your game? With this add-on, you'll work with one of Sigil's artists to create 2 full-color joker cards and a card back of your own design. You'll receive high-resolution, print-ready images, as well as a PDF and print-at-cost copy of your new deck.
Thank you so much for considering our project! We deeply appreciate all pledges. Please spread the word and help us bring The Savage Sign to life!

updates.update_content: The sun has risen. After hasty preparations, your party gathers up their gear and enters the dungeon beneath the ruined temple. You tread carefully across cracked flagstones, stepping over shattered stone, pushing aside overgrowth and cobwebs. Without warning, a deafening rumble echoes behind you as dust fills the air, the sunlight disappears, and darkness shrouds your vision...

Thank you all for your patience, we've got the second batch of proofs in and they have been approved. We'll be delivering voucher codes over the next few days directly to your kickstarter account. Thank you all for supporting us, we can wait to get these books and cards in your hands.

All rewards have been designed, and we're ready to roll out all of the digital rewards! We can't wait to hear what you think. We hope you enjoy using them as much as we enjoyed creating them. 
Issue 01 rings in at 160 pages, and includes: 4 new settings, 12 savage tales, 7 creature features, 2 short stories, 6 comic pages, Aaron Riley's artist spotlight, and a Revolution designer diary by Eugene Marshall. We've also included content for Freedom Squadron, Low Life, Saints and Synners, and Titan Effect. Our good friends from Savage Mojo and Gun Metal Games are still working on material for us - we'll release those savage tales with our upcoming second issue.

Thank you all so much for your support, we're hard at work finishing issue 01. Matthew Cutter has finished his final edit, and we completed the first pass of the layout. We'll be tweaking things for a bit longer, but we're closing in on the final book. The first two stretch goals are in from Cutter and John Goff, and we expect Kevin Andrew Murphy's short story to come in soon. Both action decks are complete and we've orders proofs from DTRPG, and the rest of the add-ons are in work and close to completion. We're excited to wrap everything up and get the files out to you!
Thanks to Knight Errant Media for contributing to The Savage Sign!

Hi all!
We had a couple folks interested in the Character Folio/Table Tent as an add-on, so we updated the list to include it.
