campaign.story:
An epic fantasy comedy from Zombie Orpheus Entertainment, JourneyQuest is a five-season web television series that is 100% funded by fans like you!
Want to catch up? The entire series to date is streaming on The Fantasy Network and Amazon Prime. Go on, check it out...we'll still be here!
Did we mention that JourneyQuest is epic? It's so epic that it should be impossible to produce. And we've solved that by ruthlessly cutting what we couldn't afford to shoot.
For three seasons.
Showrunner Matt Vancil has delivered the scripts for Seasons 4 and 5, which will complete the story. And they're good. Really freaking good. So good that when we realized that we were going to have to cut scenes and characters who we love...and that we might never see how their stories resolve...we stepped back and said "Not today, The Budget. We want to tell the complete story!"
This campaign will fund the scenes from JourneyQuest seasons 2, 3, 4 and 5 that would otherwise be lost. We'll shoot them, we'll share them with you, and then we'll cut them into Seasons 4 & 5 when we fund and produce them.
Plus, this is the perfect time to create something that fans have been begging us to create since Season One: a comprehensive Fartherall world bible and campaign setting! And yes, this world bible is your chance to help Matt name and create the heroes, demi-gods, guilds, and kingdoms that will fill the world of Fartherall!
Finally, we're bringing Matt Vancil on board to run several story canon Livestream Roleplaying events, where he'll explore the early days of the questing party with Christian Doyle (Perf), Brian Lewis (Carrow), and more!
There's a ton of information in this campaign, so if you want to jump ahead, here's a guide to where to find what you want to know.
JourneyQuest Season 3.5 (What we'll be shooting)
The Team (Who's making this)
The World Bible (What's in the book)
The Livestream Adventure (How to watch)
The Rewards (So Many Cool Things)
Shipping (We charge shipping in BackerKit after the campaign)
The Shared Cinematic Universe License Agreement (Tell your own story)
Risks and Challenges
And coming soon, the campaign FAQ
Due to budget constraints and time, we’ve been forced to cut important scenes from JourneyQuest since the very beginning. And the full scripts that Matt Vancil writes for each season suffer every time we have to make these hard choices. Plus, months are spent going over the script deciding what has to stay and what can be cut. Frankly, it’s awful. Cutting characters or scenes that we have fallen in love with is one of the hardest things we, as a company, have to do. 
But you deserve the whole story. 
Thanks to our Patreon supporters, the scripts for JourneyQuest Seasons 4 & 5 are complete...and epic...and need to be cut down...and rather than leave some crucial scenes out, AGAIN, we decided to create JourneyQuest 3.5
Just like one of our favorite roleplaying games, this is where we make some important fixes and upgrades. It’s where we catch up with moments that we couldn’t afford to shoot for seasons 2 and 3 and preemptively shoot what we would otherwise have to cut from Seasons 4 and 5.
Scenes vital to the overall story arc of JourneyQuest. 
Where did the Orcs go when they used Silver Tom’s “magic device”? Where is Karn? Will Rilk wake up before winter?
Completing these story arcs are important because you, the fans, the lifeblood of JourneyQuest, deserve to see the entire story from beginning to end without cuts. 
SO HOW DOES IT TIE TOGETHER?
We'll release Season 3.5 as a backer-exclusive (yes, that includes Patreon!) miniseries that follows the orcs and Karn. It will play like a shorter season of JourneyQuest. This is the version that will appear on the DVD and download.
Then we will cut these scenes into where they belong in JQ 4 & 5 as we shoot those seasons. (The scripts have moved some scenes that were cut from JQ 2 & 3 into 4 & 5. We won't recut 2 & 3.)
JourneyQuest is created by an ever-growing team of talented and passionate actors, producers, crew, support staff, and showrunner Matt Vancil.
Together, we've not only produced three seasons of JourneyQuest, but the ongoing Gamers series, Dark Dungeons, Demon Hunters, Attacking the Darkness, Strowlers, and much more.
The team also needs to support their families. Shows of this scale can't operate under volunteer effort. While our budgets are still a fraction of what Hollywood spends, doing it right means taking care of everyone. Your support is what lets us keep telling original stories that you can't find anywhere else!
For Season 3.5 we're bringing in...
Matt Vancil - Writer and Director
Tony Becerra - Producer
Rennie Araucto - Producer
Maggie Doyle - Kickstarter Manager
Ben Dobyns - Executive Producer
Bob Sapp - Karn the Unpleasant
Darlene Sellers - The Oracle
Jesse Lee Keeter - Rilk
Luke Amundson - Yart
Jeremy Spray - Grellnock
And a few more surprises who qualify as massive spoilers
Everyone on this team has delivered excellent work in the past and we're confident that the show will continue to evolve in their competent hands.
Not only do we want to give you the entire JourneyQuest story by creating Season 3.5, we also want to introduce the Fartherall World Bible!
A beautiful 8.5x8.5 volume modeled after our Strowlers World Bible, this will be the definitive guide to the world of JourneyQuest and The Gamers.
Join writer Matt Vancil on a trek through a world of many ages, ancient gods, mysterious wyrms, interstellar travelers, and so much more!
You'll learn the history of Fartherall, the major and minor gods and religions, the sentient species (past and present) who vie for dominance and survival, systems of magic, geography, kingdoms, organizations and factions, and all the backstory you could dream of.
Plus, at the $100 reward level and up, backers will have the opportunity to make their own official contributions to the world in the Heroes of Fartherall section, where you will have a chance to create and share your own character. Then, from $250 and up, Matt will work with you to gather information about your hero or villain and write them into the history!
You can check out the Fartherall Wiki for core information and a taste of everything that Matt has planned for this book.
BIBLE STRETCH GOALS
Backers at all levels will benefit from stretch goals that will expand the scope of the bible considerably, adding tens of thousands of words of additional content. Plus, backers at $100 and up will see stretch goals that transition the book to hardcover, upgrade to premium paper, add foil stamps to the cover, and other physical changes that will make this a unique, deluxe collectible!
After our experience publishing the Strowlers World Bible this year, we're excited to bring similar upgrades to this book as well.
Strech Goals: 
$137,000 – The History of Fartherall, Expanded (First through Ninth Ages), approximately 32 additional pages
$144,000 – The Peoples of Fartherall, Expanded, ~30 additional pages
$150,000 – The Epics of Fartherall, ~20 additional pages
$152,000 – Locked
$161,000 – Locked
$169,000 – Locked
$172,000 – Locked (would complete all additional possible materials for the world bible!)
After over a year of broadcasting weekly tabletop adventures with our friends at HyperRPG, they moved to Los Angeles and we opened our own livestream studio, where we're currently broadcasting Masters of the Metaverse on Twitch.
For this campaign, Matt Vancil has written an original adventure that will feature Christian Doyle as Perf and Brian Lewis as Carrow, exploring how their party began the quest that had been going for five years when we joined the story in JourneyQuest Season 1. Barring unforeseen technical difficulties (which could move us to a backup broadcast on Twitch), the first episode will air on Kickstarter Live on September 22nd, then be available for replay afterward.
But we're not just going to livestream. We're planning on involving you, our backers, in the adventure! Your pledges will not only reserve you fantastic rewards and help fund JQ 3.5 and the world bible, but they will help affect the livestream adventure. As we reach funding, social media, and backer milestones during the campaign, you will unlock buffs and trolls that our heroes will be able to use in the adventure. Plus, you'll have the opportunity in chat to offer input and feedback in real time at key moments!
The biggest reward for pledging, of course, is that you help us continue the story! We're committed to putting over 70% of dollars received straight into our production budget. And the rest? It goes towards Kickstarter and credit card fees, campaign management, and creating some kick-ass rewards!
Here's what you can reserve with your pledge:
 CREDIT - Your name, in the credits. Yes, it's a lot of names. Yes, it's worth it to thank every one of you for making the show possible. (Just don't, you know, try to sneak something evil or defamatory past us. We read every name. EVERY. NAME.)
 STREAM  - Watch the new video content first with a private link to enjoy what the public will need to wait until Season Four to see.
 THE FANTASY NETWORK - We'll give you a month of free access to our new video streaming platform, The Fantasy Network, where you can watch all of our shows, plus incredible shows from other fantasy producers from around the world. Available in your browser and with apps on iOS, Android, Amazon Fire, Roku, and more, this is an awesome  way to catch up on everything. And it comes with your pledge of $10 or more!
 DOWNLOAD - A digital video download of JQ 3.5 and our livestream adventure. Always DRM-free. Just what it sounds like. Comes with all pledges of $20 or more!
 WORLD BIBLE PDF - The complete digital edition of the Fartherall World Bible!
 DVD or BLU-RAY - A backer-exclusive disc (your choice of format) of Season 3.5 and the Livestream adventure. (We may have to edit the livestreams to fit. More comedy in less time!) Available at $30 and up.
 WORLD BIBLE SOFTCOVER - A unique 8.5" square format that will fit perfectly next to our recently released Strowlers World Bible. Available at $50 and up. And at $100 and up we'll also sign it!
 CREATE A HERO OF FARTHERALL - We'll ask you for NAME, SPECIES, CLASS, LEVEL, and a 30-character description of your hero, then we'll put her in the World Bible and on a...
 ETCHED METAL HERO CARD - Remember the awesome metal cards from JQ Season 3 that had your Orcish word, definition, and name on them? Now you can carry a hero in your pocket. And you have our permission to whip out the card every time you need a character for your next tabletop campaign! Available at the $100 level!
 CREATE AN EPIC HERO (OR VILLAIN) OF FARTHERALL - This is where Matt Vancil starts writing about your character. You get everything from the $100 level, plus a much longer character description and history that integrates your character into the world more fully. Yes, she's canon. She'll be a part of the official lore forever. Available at the $250 level!
 CREATE A DEMI-GOD OF FARTHERALL - A child of a god and a mortal, the demi-gods stride larger than life across the history of Fartherall. And now you can make Matt Vancil turn your character into one of them. These heroes (or villains) are legendary. And to reflect that legendary status, they also come with...
 A LARGER ETCHED METAL CARD - The same size as our Red Cards, these will be limited, etched with your unique character information, and did we mention that they're larger than the other metal cards? Available at the $500 level and up.
THE HIGHER LEVEL REWARDS
In the immortal words of Darkwing Duck, let's get dangerous!
 $1000 LEVEL - You're going to create a guild. Or an organization. An alliance. A group of people who exert power in Fartherall. Maybe a thieves guild. Or a merchant caravan. An adventurers club. And then you'll make yourself into a key character from that organization. Yes, Matt Vancil will write all of this into the world bible. But then we'll invite you to visit the JQ 3.5 set to APPEAR AS YOUR CHARACTER in the Bard College. This isn't a speaking role, but as an important guest of the bards, this will show how vital your story is within Fartherall.
 $2500 LEVEL - Why lead an organization when you can create a kingdom? Matt Vancil will write the history of your kingdom. Then fantasy artist Rob Carlos will paint you as its ruler. We'll display your painting in the series, then you get to keep the original artwork! Plus, you'll receive Associate Producer credit for JQ 3.5 and  JQ 4. (You're also welcome to visit set, although a ruler likely wouldn't appear in the bards college.)
 $5000 LEVEL - Create a god. Receive a larger original painting, again by Rob Carlos, of the god. Affect the pantheon of Fartherall forever. Also comes with Co-producer Credit on JQ 3.5 and JQ 4. (You too are welcome to visit set, but not as the god.)
In other words, Matt Vancil is going to do a whole lot of writing. And yes, he gets the final say on how to execute your ideas. He has to make the world work effectively! 
A second time, because it's important: the creator of JourneyQuest will decide how to write and present your character. We can't predict what he will do. And we'll all choose to enjoy his interpretation! Cool? Cool.
We will charge for all shipping after the campaign in BackerKit. In order for your rewards to ship, you will need to pay shipping fees at that time. Do NOT add shipping fees to your pledge now.
 International Backers: expect to pay less than $9.00 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
 Domestic Backers: expect to pay less than $5.00 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
The JQ 3.5 campaign will be fulfilled by our partners at Ship Naked. If we have enough European pledges we will fulfill from the Ship Naked shipping depot in Germany. If not, we'll fulfill from the USA in as EU-friendly a way as we can manage.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Our policy for excess funds pledged during the campaign is to spend them on producing JourneyQuest 3.5. Any amounts that you gift over the cost of a pledge level will not count as credit in BackerKit. Only give more than a pledge level if you want us to spend your money making the show awesome.
If you're a creator who loves JourneyQuest, this may be the most exciting news of all: we're releasing the World of Fartherall under ZOE's new Shared Cinematic Universe License Agreement (the SCULA).
What does this mean?
It's like the Open Gaming License and Creative Commons had little license babies: it's an agreement that gives you permission to create, adapt, and release your own derivative works within the world of Fartherall!
Check out the web page for the full details, but the fast, dirty, and legally-nonbinding summary is that as long as you abide by the terms of the agreement, you have the freedom to create non-commercial AND commercial Fartherall derivatives. Make a roleplaying game. Shoot a web series. Create your art. Sell it if you want. Or give it away. It's your choice.
You, the fans, have made these works possible and this new agreement helps us give back. Come and play, you're invited!
Just remember to Share Alike, Transform (don't copy), provide accurate Attribution, and don't break the law.
Plus, if you want your creations to become a canon part of the world, we offer a path to make them official. And a cool seal. It's pretty awesome.
IN CLOSING...
Thank you for supporting more creations within the world of Fartherall! We're thrilled to bring back JourneyQuest and to help make Seasons 4 & 5 easier and faster to shoot. And to tell the complete story.
We are a fan supported and creator distributed company and we exist entirely because of the support from fans like you.
We also know that money isn't the most important part of your pledge. A pledge is an emotional investment in a shared goal. You're a key part of our community, whether you're giving one dollar or a thousand.
And a pledge is only part of the process. We succeed when we work together: to fund the campaign, to spread the word, to encourage the creators, and to create a community where everyone is welcome.
Welcome to the ZOE family!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we work hard to mitigate our risks, the unforeseen can always throw a curve ball. Sometimes we have to recast a role at the last minute. Sometimes we have to redo work in post if it doesn't meet our standards. Sometimes product gets delayed at the manufacturer. But with a nine-year track record of success, our reputation should speak for itself.

Additionally, we now have excellent relationships with manufacturers, our fulfillment partners at Ship Naked, the team at BackerKit, and everyone else who's part of making sure that our campaigns are completed to your satisfaction.

While the story that we create may not match the one in your head, we're excited to move closer to the epic conclusion of JourneyQuest in Season 5, where all of the pieces fit together and resolve. We know, we've read it. Let's get this story told!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi Everyone! It's Norita popping in with a quick update about the upgrades.
First of all, a huge thank you to everyone for their patience! This is a manual process that is individualized for the 475 unique responses we have received on our survey. This means I have 208 people (just over 50%) who have not heard from me yet, Please do not fret if you have not gotten your email yet - it will take me several more days to get all emails out but I promise that I will get to everyone!

We have exciting news to share today: the editing on the Fartherall World Bible is complete!
So what comes next? We're doing a final pass for errors, then will bring the book straight to layout. We'll aim to distribute the digital text to all of you ASAP, followed as quickly as possible by the physical rewards.
It's been a long process, with hundreds of thousands of words and thousands of years of history to cover, but the end is finally in sight!

campaign.story:
Here is a summary of the pledge levels to make choosing your pledge level a bit easier.  If you'd like to grab a copy of Olympus Inc in .PDF or print or even the entire Fabled Environments catalog, check out the "Add-Ons" below! To learn even more about the book, keep scrolling! 
To add onto your pledge to grab these items, simply use the "Manage your pledge " button once you've pledged or add the amount of the "Add-On" to your initial pledge. :-)
Welcome to the Kickstarter for The Pelion Report. Thanks for checking us out! This is the Kickstarter for the second setting book for Olympus Inc. Just to be clear you need both the original Olympus Inc book(Need a copy? Look above for "Add-Ons")  and the Savage Worlds core rulebook to play. For a test drive of the Savage Worlds rules, click here 
So what is the world of Olympus Inc like? I’m glad you asked! Unlike most settings that have tackled the concept of demigods in the modern world, we are a bit different. Olympus, Inc answers the question of what would happen if the Olympians were kicked out of the heavens by Gaia and the Titans ruled instead. 
After she ejected them from the heavens, Gaia was also kind enough to use the Lethe River to cause all humans to forget that the Olympians existed. This nearly killed the Olympians, who began to fade away. However, the Olympians realized that they could draw from our obsession with the almighty dollar and gain power. Therefore, the Olympians traded their stone temples for towers of glass and steel. They formed the world's largest corporations. Now the Titans and Olympians fight a battle for control of the Heavens and Earth with each wielding incredible power. In the midst of all of this are normal humans who are asleep to everything that is around them.
Gaia has put a few rules in place to ensure that the Titans and Olympians don't tear each other apart as well as the rest of the inhabitants on Earth. This safeguard is known as the Nemesis Effect. The Nemesis Effect prohibits the use of visible supernatural abilities in front of sleepers (normal mortals). It also prohibits mythical creatures from appearing in front of a sleeper in their true form. If anyone breaks the rules, the Goddess Nemesis punishes them. It can be anything from being wracked with intense pain to death. It really depends on the severity of the infraction. 
Therefore, the Titans and Olympians fight a secret proxy war in a world identical to our own. However, most humans don't know that the gods exist and they certainly don't know that monsters and demigods with superhuman abilities roam the earth.
The Pelion Report is slated to be roughly 120 pages and adds to the already rich Olympus Inc setting by presenting five new Paragon bloodlines (Artemis, Athena, Demeter, Hephaestus and Hera) and two new Demihuman bloodlines (Cyclospawn and Centaur). Like the Minospawn presented in our first book, Cyclospawn are human size versions of their mythical cousins. In the case of Cyclospawn, each member of this bloodline is a human size Cyclops. 
Each of the new bloodlines has its own set of powers. In the case of the Paragon bloodlines, the book presents new corporations and subsidiaries that reflect the parent Olympian's spheres of influence. Not to be forgotten, The Pelion Report also presents new powers for existing bloodlines as well.  On the Titan side, we do present new corporations that GMs can utilize to make life more interesting for their players.
Along with new bloodlines and powers, the book contains a plethora of new edges and hindrances as well as new NPCs, IMBs Slosi and more! In addition to new equipment and weapons, The Pelion Report has rules for working with Orichalcum. Skilled PCs can infuse Orichalcum with properties that allow them to craft better weapons, equipment, ammunition and more!

In our stretch goals, you may notice some minor Greek deities listed. Minor deities do not have Paragon bloodlines. Instead, they have powers that Protean bloodlines can draw from. Minor deities have a much shorter list of associated bloodline powers than their Paragon counterparts, but these powers are still quite interesting and effective. In addition, minor deities don't have their own corporate conglomerates. Instead, many spearhead subsidiaries under the control of one of the major Greek deities.

campaign.story:
We have BIG minis...
Let a professional voice actor read this page to you!
That isn’t entirely true. It isn’t your lives that are at risk. In Nexus you and your friend will be playing the role of a Lanista. Think Don King, but instead of Mike Tyson, the two of you will be commanding genetically engineered gladiators called Helots. Just like Don, you don’t care if they live or die, win or lose, as long as it entertains the fans! Your fame and fortunes are all that truly matter.  
People's Champion
High atop your Aeries, a kind of hovercraft that sits above the action, you both shout out commands to your hapless servants. Your Helots have the attention spans of goldfish and these space barge arenas are rife with distractions. The thunderous crowd noise coupled with the smell of rotting flesh from previous bouts do nothing to help a Helot’s concentration. Needless to say not every command gets through.
 Your Helot will use these points to perform numerous actions such as movement, attacks, grappling and in some cases acrobatic feats such as standing up. You will receive bonuses for positioning relative to your opponent and could suffer disadvantages based upon your positioning relative to the environment. Be mindful of your surroundings.
Hoarder
Each Lanista marks off the values from one to six on their individual Turning Point Counters as they are achieved during their Action Point Rolls that begin each action round.
Turning Point Counter
Once all values from one to six have been rolled a Turning Point is achieved and a respective card is drawn. These cards can be beneficial or detrimental to your Helot. Some are neither and only good for a laugh.
Turning Point Cards
A barge arena equipped with floor saws is certain to elicit excitement. When a Lanista tosses an Action Point Roll and finds that he has previously rolled that value the spectators cheer and both Lanistas brace for something extraordinary. It is time for a Floor Saw to scream across the barge arena floor indiscriminately ripping flesh and limb from any Helot unfortunate enough to find itself in its path.
To determine a Floor Saw’s starting position the Lanistas use NEXUS RPO (Randomly Placed Object) rules. Each Lanista rolls a d8 and uses its value along with the numbered board grid to determine the Floor Saw’s starting location. After the Lanista triggering the Floor Saw roles a directional die the floor saw is off to do the rippin’ and the tearin’.
Weapon Crates – Bust them open to equip a Helot with a random weapon card.  
Radioactive Waste Barrels – Eats away at a Helot’s Action Points the closer it gets. 
Braziers – Kick them over and watch the fire spread across the arena floor. 
The Creature Pit – Complete with its own AI deck. 
The Barge Beast – 150 mm of pure AI deck destruction roaming the arena. You must decide if your Helot will team up or does it kill its opponent and try to take on the beast alone?
and Many More...
The board is made of sturdy plastic with grooves that when combined with the custom bases keep the pieces from being knocked around by table bumping do to aggressive shit talking and high fives.  
The beautifully illustrated cards are made of PVC plastic. So, no need to sleeve.  
The coins have a middle finger on them and are made of metal.  
Just about the only cardboard you will receive is the box the game comes in.
The book is hard-cover faux leather bound with over 200 pages of lore, artwork and RPG rules for developing your Lanista and its troupe of Helots. Gain additional influence cards, bribe barge captains and get your Helots access to better weapons and armor as you profit from their brutal existence.
       While we include the rules for the one-off game for you to download and review we do not include the PDF of the NEXUS RULEBOOK for the same reason any RPG wouldn’t. While it isn’t entirely an RPG in the traditional sense there is a great deal that has gone into this 200+ page rulebook. The book is packed with Illustrations, lore and loads of additional rules that will maximize your enjoyment of game. Below is an overview of some of the enhanced game mechanics you will find within its pages.  
Barge Beast
You will continue to play the role of the Lanista and track your progress with the included character sheets. You will keep track of your character's…  
Bitcoin (finances) 
Influence (EXP) 
Prominence (level) 
Troupe of Helots 
Win/Loss Records
Bloodthirster
As a starting Lanista you will begin with a troupe of 3 Helots. Each of your Helots will have their own character sheets. You will track your Helots’…
Rep (EXP) 
Fame (Level) 
Injuries and Insanites 
Equipment Win/Loss Records
Critiqueur
Each bout will have its own rewards for each of the participating Lanistas as well as their Helots.  
Lanistas will earn Bitcoin and Influence based on bout purses that are established before the bout begins. These purses are calculated based on the Fame of the competing Helots.
Helots will earn Cred during the bout itself. Cred is achieved by performing various actions during the barge bout. This takes the focus from simply defeating an opponent and shifts it to putting on a show. At the end of the bout any Cred achieved from each participating helot is translated into Rep. 
Famished
As a Helot rises in Fame it not only rewards its Lanista with additional Influence and Bitcoin during the bout purse phase, but it also opens access to better weapons and armor to be used in future events.  
Sadist
As Lanistas rise in Prominence they begin to unlock additional Influence Cards, their maximum troupe of Helots increase, Influence and Bitcoin rewards compound and increase as their Helots add your Prominence to their Fame calculations when checking requirements for their weapons and armor.
Supremacist
This version of the game also features…  
Bout Fees 
Helot Repair Costs 
Helot Purchase Costs 
Bout Wagering 
The Fame Action Group 
Helot Weapons and Armor 
Raids 
Unique Turning Point Cards 
Zealot
With the first expansion already being developed including…  
Cybernetics 
The D-Mart 
Mutations 
Sanctioned Barges and Hazards 
Specialty Motivations 
And Much More!
We have worked hard to find a way to service everyone wanting to back the project. We realize that our game is bringing in different people from different genres and you have all been attracted by different things. Some of you have been drawn in by the artwork, some by the humor, some by the lore and many of you by the miniatures.
We are also well aware that there are many different types of miniature hobbyists out there. Some of you prefer to assemble and paint resin miniatures, because you want to see every bit of detail from the original sculpts. While others would love that , but would much prefer the savings that plastic brings and find that level of detail satisfactory. 
There are also those of you that just want to play the game and are either sick of having to paint miniatures or simply have no desire to.
And then there are some who just want a copy of the rule book.
We did our best to have you all covered.
Some things to keep in mind...
Plastic sets will be manufactured in bulk and will all be delivered at the same time.
Plastic is lighter and less expensive to ship than the resin miniatures.
We will fulfill resin orders on a first-come, first-served basis with resin sets having priority over a la carte resin miniatures.
As resin figures are cast by hand and it is a labor-intensive, time-consuming process, there may be a delay in filling your order if demand is great. Please be patient!
We have made the decision to not use stretch goals as a marketing strategy in this campaign. The only way to make stretch goals work without exposing ourselves is to pull stuff out of the box, then start putting things back in as funding hits certain marks. Instead of doing this, we put everything in the box already and have planned timed-releases.
We will be posting a different miniature add-on as a timed release every 3rd day of the Kickstarter! These will be previously unseen alternate Helot Motivation miniatures and will only be available in resin. Again, a new resin miniature will be released as an add-on every 3 days regardless of funding amount!
We also have a lot of cool stuff planned for the pledge manager after the campaign. Pin-Ups, T-Shirts, Original Artwork, and even an opportunity to collaborate with us in the creation of custom Turning Point Cards along with other goodies which will all be available to backers after the campaign in the form of add-ons. We will be releasing more information about these items as the campaign progresses.

a series of articles and interviews with the creators
THE D-VERSE and ITS NEXUS
Throughout the infinite expanse of time, every intelligent race eventually realizes their universe is expanding. Upon discovering this, it becomes apparent that while there is no end to space, there is, in fact, a center of it. For those possessing the technology and an adventurous drive, reaching this “middle” of their universe becomes an ultimate goal. Once there, they find an inter-dimensional gathering of the most advanced species in the multiverse and are considered to have “arrived” as an esteemed and respected member of the D-Verse. The D-Verse, as it has come to be called, refers to the seemingly infinite dimensions that share this junction at the center of their respective universes. 
LANISTAS
At this central meeting point of all known dimensions, a brutal and no-holds-barred bloodsport known as Nexus is held. For eons, countless beings have converged to pit their greatest champions against one another aboard bloodstained barges. Nexus bouts have become the most popular form of entertainment across the furthest corners of time and space. And overseeing it all, permeated with the stench of death and decadence, are the masters of this pandimensional dynasty—the Lanistas. 
Here is where we find you, a young entrepreneur looking for fame and fortune, out to make a name for himself and his species among the legendary ranks of the Nexus Lanistas. The long-storied history of Lanistas is filled with rags-to-riches tales of interdimensional nobodies and their ascent to power. Those among this Nexus elite are without equal in the prestige and influence they command. With success comes anything imaginable (universal fame, near-infinite wealth, endless political and judicial favors, etc.). Count yourself lucky—whether good luck or bad—to even be given this opportunity.  
Welcome to the seedy, salacious, and oh-so-profitable underworld of Nexus! 
REGISTRATION WITH THE INC
The Interdimensional Nexus Commission (INC) is the regulating body behind Nexus. After you file the proper documentation and bribe the necessary high-ranking board members, the INC will issue your Lanista License. The INC oversees everything from barge inspections to Helot cloning standards. If you are looking to be a major Nexus player, then there is no way around dealing with the INC… except for when there is, of course. INC-sanctioned barge bouts broadcasted across blood.stream are the most viewed events in the D-Verse. It is there that your legacy will join the ranks of legend or fade into obscurity.  
NEXUS BARGES
INC-sanctioned barge bouts take place on Nexus barges. When entering the D-Verse nexus the first thing you will see are hundreds of these barges tethered together. Some are quite ornate and massive while other seem hastily made and designed to draw as little attention as possible. Species from across the D-Verse are gathered here, placing bets, haggling with Gnoems, or looking for marks. You will see INC officers everywhere looking for, and raiding, unsanctioned matches in hopes of making arrests (but more likely collecting bribes). Nothing prepares one for this strange sight of countless beings spread across hundreds of barges that are infested with violence and bustling with activity.   
GNOEMS
So, you want to buy a Helot? Then you’re looking for the Gnoems. Gnoems were the first race to discover the D-Verse nexus. Ever since, they’ve been traveling between dimensions collecting and analyzing DNA from countless species. Their accumulated knowledge coupled with their familiarity with pandimensional lifeforms has earned them the nickname “Toy Makers,” and makes them the only source of Helots that are worthy to compete in Nexus. Gnoem expertise, while unmatched, is still limited. Some of the nuances of other lifeforms tend to escape them. Gnoems, for example, have no gender, so their attempts at breeding species could get a bit unsettling. In fact, nothing is quite as terrifying as watching two males attempt to conceive a child for fear of torture by the Gnoems’ devices. Due to this, the INC established guidelines instructing Gnoems to sell genetic clones of only the samples they have collected and discouraging them against further abduction of lifeforms from their home worlds.
HELOTS
The official term for a Nexus fighter is a Helot, although they are more commonly known among Gnoems as “Mamluk” (the Gnoem word for “meat”). Helots are grown by Gnoems in what are known as the Meat Gardens. For a reasonable fee, aspiring Lanistas can purchase their future champion from the Meat Garden’s weekly harvest. Gnoem Helots are in large demand; unless you’re paying premium prices, you just get the next one off the line. No refunds. If you don’t like the result, kill it and buy another. If you’re squeamish however, the Gnoems will gladly destroy your unwanted Helot for you (but they keep the leftover organic matter).
Gnoems have already handled everything concerning your new purchase. Helots come out of the Gardens ready to fight. From an early age, they are given a series of tests to determine their motivation to survive. These tests involve analysis as subjects are exposed to extreme mental and physical stimulus. Gnoems will always find a way to motivate a Helot. Upon purchasing your Helot, you will receive his Biometric Species Analysis. This sheet will give you a comprehensive explanation of not only your Helot’s strengths and weaknesses, but also how to care for your Helot. Be sure to keep the sheet and the information on it updated, as it will be handy if you are given the opportunity to sell any organic matter after the Helot expires. This, however, is very unlikely; the Spleen Team is very thorough.  
THE SPLEEN TEAM
The official cleaning service of the INC. After any officially INC-sanctioned barge bout, there is a wealth of equipment and biological matter left behind. The Spleen Team is there to steal… err… “clean up” the mess. Any disregarded Helot and their belongings are collected by the Spleen Team and redistributed by the INC’s charitable Weapons for Tots program—furthering their mission of putting a weapon in every child’s hand. As far as leftover biological matter, Gnoems are always interested in collecting whatever the Spleen Team doesn’t eat.   
THE BOOK
If Helots engage in a barge bout and nobody is betting on it, did it ever really happen? Gambling on Nexus outcomes is far and away the number one moneymaker in the D-Verse, making “The Book” the nexus of Nexus. The Book is the official odds-maker and bookie of Nexus. Not much is known about what goes on behind the scenes of The Book. That said, The Book is the only organization that the INC fears. While the INC has spoken in the past about the Nexus’ “integrity” and how the Nexus must steer clear of gambling connections to eliminate any nefarious actions (fixing bouts, etc.), its actions suggest otherwise.   
While nobody (at least, nobody alive) can draw a direct line between the INC and The Book, many rumors suggest the two organizations are, in fact, one and the same. One extremely vocal propagator of such information is the interdimensional hacker and pirate broadcaster known as Crypt. Crypt has been a thorn in the side of both The Book and INC for the last millennia. Recently, many of Crypt’s sources have found themselves conducting interviews in Gnoem torture devices, but Crypt has thus far eluded capture.
D-MART
Whoever said, “It’s not the weapon; it’s the Helot behind it!” was an idiot. They have obviously never seen what a Krillion Forearm Blade can do to an opponent’s flesh. The right weapons and armor can make or break a Helot in the barge arena. While weapons aren’t cheap, they are necessary. An investment in your Helot’s equipment is an investment in your Helot’s future. The Nexus Dimensional Market, better known as D-Mart, is your one-stop-shop for the greatest weapons and armors in the D-Verse.   
Manufacturers from across the D-Verse compete here for profit and exposure. They sell everything from tried-and-true classics to cutting edge, next-gen, and highly experimental weapon systems. Their armors—commonly known as “Meat Packaging”—are detested among Gnoems, having been blamed for the first decrease in Helot sales in four centuries.
Be warned! These vendors won’t just sell to anyone. A Helot getting destroyed in a particular vendor’s equipment is never good for that vendor’s sales. The more established vendors require the Helot and their Lanista to have a bit of notoriety and experience before they will consider selling their wares. For these same reasons, vendors may also require a Helot to have a specific skill set.  
MORE ABOUT BARGES and BARGE BOUTS
There are a dizzying number of barges in the nexus, with new ones being flown in every day. It is every Lanista’s dream to one day have their own officially INC-sanctioned barge. The amount of money and resources involved is steep, and that’s not accounting for the equally pricey under-the-table costs. This hindrance to free market violence means there are many unsanctioned barges to be found in the nexus. This is most likely where you will begin your career as a Lanista. Not by owning an unsanctioned barge, mind you, but by having your Helots compete on these floating piles of… well, sub-quality vessels.   
This does, however, have its advantages. First off, you make far more bitcoin when avoiding the INC’s bout fees. You usually must hire your own cleaning crew—that’s good news because that means no Spleen Team involvement! You can collect all your dead Helot’s equipment and biomatter. And think of all the interesting people you’ll meet!  
Now for the downsides.  
First, unsanctioned bouts don’t bring anywhere near the exposure of an officially INC-sanctioned barge. While you might grow in popularity among the “hardcore” fans, nobody important will know you or your Helots exist—except the INC, which disapproves of not getting their cut.  
This brings us to the second problem: Raids.  
INC officers take their duties very seriously. They’re quite vigilant in their search for rogue barges to shakedown for bribes. Whenever your Helots engage in an unsanctioned barge bout, there’s a chance of a raid. If this happens, you’ll find the INC cut to be quite generous in comparison. It’s a small comfort knowing that you’ll have no choice in the beginning of your Lanista career. Your crap Helots will most likely die on crap barges after raids bleed you dry and you’ll fade into obscurity like billions before.
Good luck!
NEXUS is the result of 2 guys, who grew up together in Detroit, working on their passion while also holding down full time jobs, raising 6 kids between them, attending soccer games, baseball, and a myriad of other activities. Imagine what other things we could create if this was our full-time job. When you back Nexus, yes you are buying a game, but you are also funding a company who will bring you innovative, smart, and nostalgic projects like this for years to come.   
Our purpose is greater than ourselves. We want to elevate the real rock stars in our eyes – those are the artists, the writers, the guys that stay up all night developing unique game mechanics, and many more of the talented people who have a passion for the tabletop gaming industry but just haven’t had the chance to make a living from it yet.  
We believe this expressly fits the spirit of Kickstarter and is why we have chosen it for our funding platform. There have been many people that have helped us along the way to where we are. We are very thankful for each and every one of them and it is our hope that with the success of the NEXUS Kickstarter will also come the success of many talented individuals who will get to do the things they love as a means to earn a living.

updates.update_content: For starters, thank you all for your continued support!

We are back from our first GenCon. What an incredible experience! Almost 100 people played Nexus and we received tons of great feedback and testimonials which we will be posting soon.  
A quick update on where we are on the KickStarter relaunch. We are working with the manufacturer to obtain quotes and samples for a more accessible version of Nexus. We are working as fast as possible, but we don’t want to rush things. We want to make sure the game will be at an affordable entry price point and still have most of the high-quality components available to those that want them.

So, we have read your comments here and elsewhere and it is apparent we need to make some changes to the Kickstarter campaign.
The passion behind making a game can become overwhelming at times. We now see that, in the name of passion, we have over-developed the game by making every piece the best possible quality available which prices it out of the market for a lot of backers. The feedback is that people seem to love the game but the price point is just too high in its current form. We would not have known this unless we put it out there and received the feedback from all of you and we are very thankful for that.

campaign.story:
When we started Restoration Games, we asked you to tell us which games to bring back. The number one request, by far, was Fireball Island. After more than a year of hard work, we are thrilled to announce: Fireball Island is back!
If this is your first time checking out the campaign, good to see you! You'll be thrilled to know that our amazing backers have already unlocked tons of stretch goals (and more still to come). As you check out the page, keep in mind that your pledge will also include all of this amazing stuff.
On the other hand, if you know you want it all and you want it now, we've got you covered.
So what are you waiting for? Come on and join the fun!
Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar improves on the art, components, and game play of the original. If you loved the game as a child, you'll see we turned that "delightful chaos" up to the max. If you never played it before, you'll appreciate it as a fun, exciting game for kids, families, and gamers alike.
We found a way to make the new island bigger, taller, faster, and cooler -- all while fitting in a smaller box.
Tom Vasel and the Dice Tower crew sat down with Justin Jacobson, the president of Restoration Games for a full, live playthrough of the base game, which should give you a good idea of how the game plays.
Sometimes, you may face Vul-Kar the way you want...
... but even then you can't be sure which way it will come out.
Even as the marble careens down the mountain, the paths and trees can divert it one way or another.
A tree might even save your life.
While the fireballs are unpredictable, we made sure that players have more control over their actions and more meaningful choices.
On your turn, play one of your two action cards to move your pawn and perform a special action.
Grab a snapshot from each part of the island and get back to the helipad.
Earn points for collecting sets of treasure.
If you get knocked down, you'll lose a treasure but gain a useful souvenir.
If you draw a Cataclysm, Vul-Kar gets to take a turn.
In all, the game remains fast, fun, and light, but offers meaningful choices.
We've also made arrangements with Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! to do a rules video at the time of release. 
NOTE: The board in the images above is a hand-painted prototype and does not reflect final art for the island. Here is the near-final art for the island and some renders showing off the detail that will show up on the finished board.
Blades of grass and cracked stones ease your path.
A lonely crab woos visitors at Skeleton Head Beach.
There are four expansions available in this campaign, and they are fully interchangeable with the base game and each other. We've also added some amazing new components, through hitting stretch goals, with no additional charge to backers.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       The view from the poop deck.
Hope you got that snapshot, Saul.
                                                                                                                                                                                        If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easy to get involved, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun. All you have to do is:
Click on the pledge level you want to back.
Enter your email address and “Continue as guest”.
Enter your payment information.
Click the big green “Pledge” button 
To keep things simple, there are only two tiers for regular backers.
(You can order additional copies or optional buys by increasing your pledge amount. See Shipping and Fulfillment below for more details.)
For verified brick-and-mortar stores: We also have a special pledge level that is just for you. You pledge only $20 during the campaign. When we are ready to ship the games, after the campaign closes, you will use our pledge manager to finalize your order and pay the remaining balance due. If you have any question about your status, please message us, and we will confirm before pledging. All the terms and other information about this pledge level can be found in this special update.
We've blown through dozens of stretch goals, like a fireball through a rickety bridge, and unlocked tons of great additional content. Backers get the Treasure Trove expansion pack for free, and it's already full of new souvenirs, injury cards, and more.
Unlocked sleeves (optional buy, manually add $15 to your pledge).
Painted minis (optional buy, manually add $10 to your pledge).
Maker Kit (optional buy, manually add $40 to your pledge)
Not much time left to hit those stretch goals!
Given the unique design of the game, we only have one prototype and couldn't send out review copies. We wanted a fun way to let a bunch of people play the game, so we took the show on the road! J.R. Honeycutt, our Tinker-in-Chief, set off on a 30-day, 13-state road trip, including a stop in Canada! We met up with some of the most amazing game stores, cafes, conventions, and content creators to bring you a chance to play the game in person. And, of course, we got to meet our amazing fans and backers. It was truly a special happening. Below are some videos from the trip. (Note: These videos are of the hand-painted prototype board; the final version of the board will have printed art and won't be as shiny.)
One of our backers, MAJBrown22 was able to make it to the Secret Cabal Meetup at Beermongers and wrote up his impressions in this Board Game Geek forum post. 
Chris has apparently been ensorcelled by Vul-Kar.
 Check out some epic skill shots in this supercut:
PLAY

We are using key fulfillment partners within each shipping region. There are no additional customs fees, VAT, or similar charges.
There is only one shipping charge per region regardless of what reward you get -- we're subsidizing the rest.
For the US, Canada, and the EU, we are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. For Australian backers, we'll be using Aetherworks, who we used on our Stop Thief! campaign and who did a great job.
If you would like to order a second copy, just increase your pledge amount by the cost of that pledge. You do not need to add anything for additional shipping. If you want more than two copies, add the shipping charge for each additional set of one or two. For example, if you wanted to get three copies of the base game sent to Canada, you would pledge a total of $220.
We are using BackerKit, a third-party service that lets us manage ordering and shipping. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll have the chance add items to your pledge at that time. Importantly, though, there will be no additional fees due after the campaign. When you pledge, it will automatically calculate and add all shipping charges. The only additional charge is if you decide to get more stuff. Both pledge levels will be available in BackerKit. You can back the campaign now at any amount and choose your pledge later, or you can back at the Feel the Burn level and upgrade to the Full Vul-Kar.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Due to the limitations of our license, we are only able to offer the game in English and in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia. Please see the FAQ for more information.
As we head into the final hours of this campaign, every point of contact and bit of buzz can help. Send the message out far and wide on social media. Use these social media avatars to show your love for the game. And, remember, sometimes the best way is a direct, personal email to that one person you just know will get a kick out of it. Every little bit helps.
Restoration Games was founded by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We knew there were a lot of great treasures hidden beneath the sands of time. When we announced our plans, the response was overwhelming. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory, bringing the fun to those with fond memories, and publishing great games for demanding gamers.
We must acknowledge the rest of the team who put in an unblelievable effort to make this a reality. Jason Taylor is our Visual Restoration Wizard, who is the reason everything we do looks so good. Lindsay Daviau is our Production Superhero, who ensures the finished products look amazing. JR Honeycutt is our Tinker-in-Chief; he helps get a game from the idea to a finished design. Suzanne Sheldon, our Master-of-Fireworks, makes sure everyone knows what we're up to.
We had lots of talented help with the art and design of the game. George Doutsiopoulos did the fantastic cover illustrations for the base game and the three main expansions. Card art is by Victor Perez Corbella. David Kegg did the retro art that appears in various places in the game, branding, and this campaign. Jean-Louis Sirois helped with some extra foliage illustration you see on this page and on the gameboard. Additional thanks to Matijos Gebreselassie and Bill Tiller for early concept illustrations. 3D sculpting for the miniatures and island features is by Chad Hoverter. Noah Adelman of Game Trayz, LLC did the initial design work on the island trays. Design Innovation, Inc. finalized the island trays. The video work was done by Josh McDowell, and the voiceover was performed by Graham Rowat. Rulebook editing was done by the Meeple Lady. Our thanks to all of them for their unbelievable effort in bringing this project to fruition.
And, of course, we would be remiss not to mention the original masterminds behind the game, Bruce Lund and Chuck Kennedy.

Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter and fourth game overall. Our first Kickstarter, for Stop Thief! was, by all accounts, a huge success. We received many compliments on how we handled everything, making sure everyone got their games in a timely manner. We pride ourselves on our customer service. If something happens, we'll work hard to make it right.

That said, Fireball Island is a design project unlike any other, involving three-dimensional, mechanical, plastics. Rob, Jason, and Lindsay have decades of experience working at Hasbro on such products.

This is also a licensed product. However, Justin negotiated complete creative control in the licensing agreement. Therefore, no final approval is needed to move to production.

campaign.story:
What's the Goal?
I want to create the ultimate roleplaying game for fans of comics and shows like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, ThunderCats, Kung Fu Panda, Street Sharks, Captain Planet, and lesser-known classics like Silver Hawks and Tiger Sharks! I grew up loving those shows--where a cast of not-quite-human outcasts protect the world from nefarious threats and costumed maniacs. But outside of some long out of print books, no RPG has managed to capture the fun, excitement, and sheer oddity of those stories.
I want to change that.
So I'm creating KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) using the fast, fun, and furious Savage Worlds roleplaying system.
I'm a huge fan of Savage Worlds, having played it for years and even using it for my own neo-noir crime setting, Streets of Bedlam.
Award-winning Savage Worlds plus award-winning Jason L Blair equals Saturday Morning Awesomeness!
What is KFA(STW)?
KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) is a setting for the hugely-popular and immensely-fun Savage Worlds roleplaying system. It's a book that gives players the tools to create their own wild universes where semi-human characters become the world's greatest heroes. We start with your character's Origin--did they come to being by accident? Experiment? Are they an alien? A machine?--and then build from there. Each step, you get Edges, Hindrances, and Skills that help shape your unique character.
Player groups are encouraged to build groups together as the best source material revolves around groups of diverse personalities who work together. Pick the size of your group, from lone wolf to dynamic duo to a sprawling troupe of heroes. The size of the group determines the dynamic--and the roles within the group. Is your character the jokester? The leader? The rebel? Or maybe they're the mascot? Or master? You have tons of options, each granting specific bonuses that help your character stand out for their unique qualities.
As with all Savage Settings, KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) is all about getting you to the table and playing as soon as possible. Character creation is quick--and you can shortcut the process even further by selecting a pre-made archetype, adding a few points, and being ready to roll in minutes.
One night in the lab, Dr. Emil Ratzenberger experiences a life-changing accident due to blatant OSHA violations.
What's Done? What's Left?
The player rules text for KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) is done and ready for review the moment you back this project. You can find a Dropbox link in the first backers-only update.
All that's left for me to do, text-wise, is the introduction and the game moderator chapters that finalize the toolset for anyone to create and run their own series. I'm working on those concurrent to this Kickstarter. I aim to have this all wrapped up by early Summer.
In addition, I am creating the first supplement KUNG FU ANIMALS (HIT THE ROAD) which will introduce FIFTY Kung Fu Animals archetypes--one unique to each of the fifty United States!
Also! I will be creating a PDF-only setting called "Universe of Monsters." This setting will only be available through this Kickstarter as an add-on in the reward tiers to the right.
Really, this Kickstarter's main focus is on securing some amazing artwork for the final book. I've already commissioned a handful of illustrations that you can see here but I need more--a lot more! I've taken great care in finding talented folks and getting the best artwork I can for my projects. I am very happy to say I've lined up some amazing new talent and some industry vets to help bring this book to life.
Dr. Ratzenberger now faces off against his unscrupulous former employer as the vigilante called Ratzman.
What's the Final Product?
KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) will be available as a illustrated 7"x10" softcover book with a full-color cover and black and white interiors. The digital version will be a PDF export of those same printer files.
Setting Books, such as the Kickstarter-exclusive "Universe of Monsters," will be PDF-only supplements.
Physical copies will be ordered, signed, and mailed by me. PDF copies will be fulfilled via 100%-off coupons via DriveThruRPG.
Space HAWKS officers Commander Sparrow and Lieutenant Raptor pose with special recruit Golden Boy on the maiden voyage of the USS Peacekeeper. Little do they know the trouble that lies ahead.
Any Stretch Goals?
Yes! If this Kickstarter does well enough, I'll be adding Setting Books that each present a premise, a backstory, pre-made characters, and some crazed baddies that you can take right to the table and get playing immediately.
These setting books will take inspiration from some of some television classics but with their own distinctive spin.
Seaside protector Mano Lau takes a moment to center himself and contemplate just how much butt he is going to kick.
Who Are You, Jason L Blair?
I've been making tabletop roleplaying games since I released my first game, Little Fears, back in 2001. Since then, I've released over twenty books in print and PDF, including work for series such as ICONS, Cartoon Action Hour, and Dark Conspiracy Third Edition.
By day, I work as a writer and narrative designer/director in the video game field, having worked on games such as Conduit 2, Saints Row IV, and Agents of Mayhem. Unlike some of those, though, KUNG FU ANIMALS (SAVE THE WORLD) is appropriate for all ages.

A secondary risk is an artist not delivering on their promised illustrations. In that case, I will reach out to the other artists to see if they can handle the work.

campaign.story:
An old book you found in a locked safe in the hidden room underneath Arkham's library had some interesting tidbits—including a formula to grow a terrifying tentacled beast. But your friends took a peek and now they all want to grow their own god. You’ve got your trusty twelve-gauge handy to blast a tentacle here and there and make sure your creature grows to completion first. To do otherwise would be madness!
  Building An Elder God is a fast-playing card game of Lovecraftian construction for 2-5 players ages 8 and up. The rules are easy to learn and a typical game takes from 15-30 minutes, depending on the number of players. Build a Cthulhu-esque tentacled monstrosity to completion before the other players, using damage cards to blast your opponents’ creatures (and slow down their progress) in order to win! There are 115 standard cards in the set, plus 10 Necronomicon pieces. A full-color rulebook is included.
Gameplay: Draw a card, play a card. You either choose a tentacle card to grow or heal your own beast, or play a damage card to blast off the tentacle of an opponent's monster. The Necronomicon and Elder Sign pieces provide additional options to heal yourself or punish your foes!
The game is complete, and in fact sold through its first printing a few years ago! We're running this crowdfunding campaign to bring Building An Elder God back to gamer shelves and into stores while making a higher-quality product the second go-around.
What's Changed? We are making sure the stock and coating will make the cards sturdy yet easy to handle and shuffle right out of the box. The Head and Body cards now have alternate sides so that everyone's monster can look unique at the table. The Necronomicon pieces are now punch-out cardstock rather than cards the players are expected to cut themselves. And we've done a light rewrite of the rules for clarity and are printing them in full color.
  Building An Elder God got a shout-out as Best Kids Game of 2011 in episode #239 of The Dice Tower podcast by Chris of The Secret Cabal. Hear the episode by clicking here (our mention is in the last seven minutes of the episode). Check out a few more reviews:
GeekMom
Nerd Nation Magazine
OgreCave
Reviews From R'lyeh
  Anyone at the $10 level or higher will a digital print-at-home version of the game that will be made available shortly after the conclusion of this campaign. For $25 you also get the full boxed game shipped to you once it's back from the printer. Higher level rewards include access to our Lovecraftian eBooks, t-shirts, new cards with custom artwork based on your picture, and more! Just check out the list to see what's all in the works! 
  Domestic shipping to locations in the US are covered under the pledge amounts. All other countries will be billed separately for shipping before the rewards are sent out using actual costs minus a $5 credit. We know international shipping is expensive and can take a long time, but we don't want to leave anyone out who wants our game!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been a tabletop game industry professional for the better part of two decades, working with commercial printers, distributors, and game retailers. In addition I have run three Kickstarter campaigns in the past—all funded, and all shipped out the primary rewards to backers. But I discovered how easy it can be to underestimate the time and expense necessary to deliver stretch goals and secondary rewards. It's important to avoid those pitfalls, so I'm implementing the following for this campaign:

Simplicity: It's tempting to chase a high-dollar total by adding lots of stretch goals and extra rewards. Being a one-man company working with a talented-but-busy freelance artist, I'm going to keep the focus on the core game. We may add a few stretch goals but they will likely be digital rewards or improvements to the core product.

Transparency: I'm separating the funds from this crowdfunding campaign in a separate account, and will create a backer-accessible spreadsheet that shows each expenditure and explains what the funds are being used for. This will remain live until all rewards have been shipped.

The only delays to delivery I can foresee would include unexpected hold-ups from the printer, overseas shipping, or delay in customs when the product enters the United States. We've built-in some time to help account for those and give us enough resources to get things shipped to our backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

  Monster Hunter International,  the New York Times Bestselling action series is coming to the Savage Worlds roleplaying system! 
Written by Larry Correia, Monster Hunter International is an urban fantasy series about professional monster hunters who battle against the things that go bump in the night!
As the slogan goes..."Cowboy up, and get paid."
Larry is a big fan of Savage Worlds and when we approached him about doing an updated MHI roleplaying game, he immediately wanted to use one of his favorite rulesets, so that's what we did!
Gallant Knight Games has experience working in Savage Worlds, and we've enlisted the help of the lead writer on the previous MHI roleplaying game Steve S. Long!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Q: Can Gallant Knight Games handle this project? 
This is Gallant Knight Games sixth Kickstarter, and we learned a lot from the first five. We've been early or on time every time. We have two projects that's are not out to backers yet, but one is currently printing and preparing for fulfillment, and the other is exactly on track and this project will not impact that one. This is a straightforward project with few nuances, but we're prepared to handle them, and we're shooting for the same exceptional success we've already had!

Q: What if the text or art isn't finished? 
A: The draft text of all the rules is 100% done. All the art that isn't tied to stretch goals is in and done. The only text we're waiting on is the stretch goals and some of the newer adaptation of the latest books into the text, and as we depend on the backers to determine what needs to be written, those will come throughout and after the Kickstarter.

Q: What if the complexity of the project overwhelms GKG? 
A: We have straight forward pledge levels to make it easy to manage, and we've budgeted our stretch goals up to our cap. In order to keep the project manageable for our small team, we've elected to minimize our stretch goals to text increases, and we've set a finite limit of page count.

Q: What about delays in art? 
A: We've already began to contract out the art, and some of the art is already here. Isn't it great? We're really happy with our artists. If there's a delay on the art, we have back-up artists we've already done test runs and are ready to work with.

Q: Increase in shipping costs? 
A: Shipping costs constantly rise, and while we've projected them to the best of our abilities, there's not a lot we can do if they change. However, due to the limitations on the size of our product, we're confident this won't be an issue.

Q: What if something happens to the principals? 
A: If something were to happen to Alan, or another writer on the project, we've identified our backups, and our team is spread all over the world. It'd take a really big asteroid, zombie apocalypse or alien invasion to wipe us all out. The files and plans have been communicated to the whole team, and a new project lead (who has been identified) will step up.

campaign.story:
Cover made by Vargasni
 Titan Effect RPG is a licensed campaign setting for Savage Worlds. Titan Effect is set in a contemporary world where psychic spies clash with genetically enhanced soldiers in a secret war in which the future of human evolution is at stake.
Take on the role of a trained operative gifted with psychic abilities. Perform dangerous missions all over the world for the international clandestine organization known as the SPEAR, and fight against dangerous creatures and organizations. Survive long enough, and maybe you will be able to make a difference.
Titan Effect RPG requires the Savage Worlds Core Rules and the Super Powers Companion (2nd edition). 
         Softcover mockup
The world of Titan Effect is like ours but darker and stranger. Psychics and augmented humans are used as spies and soldiers on behalf of criminal organizations, private military companies, and secret societies in a secret war that has been raging for decades. Some are fighting for control and power, while others seek to shape the future of human evolution.
In the middle of this conflict, stands the worldwide clandestine organization known as the Special Executive Assault and Recon or SPEAR. Its mission: to track and neutralize eugenics and psychic threats, and to prevent the world from falling into chaos. To succeed in its mission, the SPEAR hires people with unique sets of skills and possessing powerful psychic abilities. Its agents come from different nationalities and backgrounds.
Players take on the role of psychic operatives trained in black operations, and working for the international clandestine organization known as the SPEAR. They have the task to perform dangerous missions all over the world and fight against dangerous creatures and organizations. Some are there to make a difference, others for the thrill or because they have no other place to go.
Titan Effect RPG combines biopunk, spy thriller, and superhero elements. Imagine Tom Clancy meets Metal Gear Solid meets the X-Men. Titan Effect RPG plunges you into a world filled with conspiracies, secret organizations, dangerous biotechnologies and psychic phenomena. A world where the boundary between "good" and "evil" is blurred...
Illustration made by Vargasni
What's inside?
Titan Effect RPG will be available in two versions: 
A low-resolution PDF version adapted for screens and tablets. It will also be bookmarked, searchable, printer-friendly, and DRM free.
A printed version available in Softcover and Hardcover that will be released in a 7"x10" format. 
The interior of these two versions will contain a mix of black-and-white and full-color illustrations. We estimate the final version of Titan Effect to be around 132 full-color pages.
Softcover mockup
You will find inside:  
New Edges and Hindrances; 
New Setting Rules, including fast modern hacking rules; 
New gear, gadgets, and weapons, compatible with other modern settings;
An exclusive Equipment Point System (EPS) to easily and dynamically handle the "gear-up phase" of your teams before each mission;
Background and rules to play psychics with the Super Powers Companion, including new powers; 
6 new pre-generated characters.
Information about the SPEAR;
Alternative timeline with historical events that shaped Titan Effect's universe;
6 major enemy organizations and how to use them in your campaign;  
40+ NPCs and creatures;
Campaign ideas and adventure hooks;
A Mission Generator to help you build quickly adventures;
A full introductory adventure following Operation: Sharashka (see Demo Kit). 
Other cool stuff! 
Please note: a copy of the Savage Worlds Core Rules and the Super Powers Companion are necessary to play and are not included in any reward level. You can buy both of them now at www.peginc.com or on DriveThruRPG for $9.99 each! If you aren’t familiar with Savage Worlds, you can directly download the Test Drive Rules on Pinnacle Entertainment Group’s website.
Optional Rules: For those who don't own the Super Powers Companion and who still want to get Titan Effect RPG, we will provide a short PDF with optional rules to play psychics with only Savage Worlds Core Rules. However, we highly recommend you use the Super Powers Companion if you want to capture all the flavor of Titan Effect RPG and enjoy the gameplay as it was initially designed.
You can download for FREE an alternate version of the Demo Kit with these new rules here! 
Current State
Titan Effect Beta
Titan Effect RPG is the result of a very long development and has been the subject of many avatars, including an aborted animated series project and a comic book project (still in development), before becoming a role-playing game. Today, we are proud to finally show the result. Titan Effect RPG is 75% complete, with most of the texts, the layout, and some of the illustrations.
We have been running playtests for more than a year and launched a closed beta with a dozen gamemasters. The feedback from our testers helped improve our campaign setting a great deal.
Testimony:
I had the honor of playtesting Titan Effect with my group, and we all liked it. I am a big fan of sci-fi kind of settings. This game is not your hardcore sci-fi, but it hit the right spots for me. I love the cloak and dagger feel of the game and love some of the new edges that they made for this game. I mean who doesn't want to play a gun carrying spy that can also throw something at you with his mind or make you think that there is a big baddy standing behind you? I love the system that they used for gear; it makes getting ready for the game so much easier and faster to get into the thick of things when you don't have to spend an hour buying gear. Great Game all around guys.
— Robert B. Hensley III
Demo Kit
Titan Effect Demo Kit & character sheet
You can already download and test for FREE our Demo Kit for Titan Effect at drivethrurpg.com and our form-fillable character sheet.
Inside the Demo Kit you will find:  
An introduction to Titan Effect's universe. 
An excerpt of Titan Effect setting rules.
A short adventure.
Five pre-generated characters.
The goal of this campaign is to help us complete our RPG by adding the final texts, more illustrations and to edit the book. It will allow us to pay our amazing artists and collaborators a fair wage, and to keep a small buffer for unforeseen expenses. It will also help us to launch the first part of Titan Effect transmedia universe.

All backers will get a copy of Titan Effect Beta PDF right after the end of the campaign. You can use this version to start playing while waiting for the final release. Inside this 75-pages PDF, you will find everything you need to create characters and start running adventures with details about 4 of the enemy organizations, more than 20 NPCs and a mission generator. In addition, they will receive updates throughout the campaign, and their name as a backer in the book.

The Hardboiled GMshoe's Office: [Q&A] Christian Nommay (Titan Effect)
  Knight Errant Media is a new indie role-playing game and transmedia publisher composed of a team of passionate designers and writers. Our goal is to tell epic stories and build great universes. Titan Effect RPG is our first Kickstarter.
Christian Nommay: CEO and founder at Knight Errant Media, Christian is the creator, designer, and main writer of Titan Effect. Christian also worked as a graphic designer for the French RPG publisher Black Book Editions and was hired by Feral Games to write an adventure for their upcoming RPG Ghost Ops next year.
Daniel Eymard: Titan Effect co-writer, Daniel also wrote for Green Ronin Publishing the Mutants & Masterminds Atlas of Earth-Prime: Western Europe and Central Europe sourcebooks.
Ghislain Bonnotte: Titan Effect co-writer, Ghislain worked a few years ago on the Shadowrun 3rd Edition sourcebook Shadows of Europe. Ghislain is also a writer, translator, editor, and proofreader for the French versions of Shadowrun and Savage Worlds RPG lines for Black Book Editions.
Our Artists

Vargasni (cover and interior arts)
Patrick McEvoy (interior arts)
Gergo Pocsai (interior arts)
Alientan Design (interior arts)
Leonardo Ariza (interior arts)
And a lot more!
Follow Titan Effect on:
https://www.facebook.com/TitanEffect/
https://twitter.com/TitanEffect
https://twitter.com/SpearNetwork
Titan Effect RPG is the first part of a transmedia universe which will be told across multiple media, each one moving the story further and impacting the other parts as well. So far, a graphic novel is already in development, but we also have plans for other awesome projects, including a live-action short-film.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we mentioned above, this is our first Kickstarter campaign and published RPG, which is our biggest risk and challenge. However, Daniel, Ghislain and I have gained some experience by working for other RPG publishers. What is more, we have received useful advice and guidance from other publishers like Jodi Black (Pinnacle Entertainment), James Gantry (Feral Games), and Brian Feister (Open Legend RPG).

With all the rewards fulfilled by DriveThruRPG, our biggest challenge is to make sure we will be able to meet our delivery date. There can be some delays with the art or the editing. However, most of the texts are finished, and the layout is already set. We've also tried to anticipate all the worst case scenarios, and put all the chances on our side to minimize the risks. We will do everything in our power to deliver a high-quality product on due date!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Now that the Kickstarter is officially over and that Titan Effect RPG is released, more and more people are asking us what's coming next. So, here's a short answer: we have a lot of things planned for our favorite espionage and science-fiction RPG.
First, Daniel and I are working on a big metaplot that will be spread over several sourcebooks and a campaign. I can't say much about it, but it's going to expand Titan Effect's universe and will add a lot of mystery and new dangers. We have three major books planned for the moment: a sourcebook that will focus on the SPEAR with new rules and gear for the players (including rules to create HQs and rogue bio-augmented soldiers). Another sourcebook that will focus on the shadow war and all the enemy factions. Both will have campaign ideas and thematic, with probably tons of adventure hooks and a short campaign. Finally, there will be an epic plot-point campaign (I know a lot of you are waiting for that).
