WHAT IS JOURNEYQUEST?
Premiering in 2010, JourneyQuest is a global, fan-funded phenomenon. With the support of our passionate fanbase, we bring you a feature-length third season!
As the story continues, the search for an oracle brings our heroes to a dwarven mining town in which they are pursued by an assassin, orcs, Glorion (their former fighter), and Wren, a recently-fired bardic historian.
WHO ARE WE?
We are the team at Zombie Orpheus Entertainment. Since our inception in 2010, we've released award-winning shows and films like The Gamers: Hands of Fate, Humans & Households, Natural 1, Dark Dungeons, and most recently, The Gamers: The Series. And of course, two seasons of JourneyQuest!
With thousands of happy backers from prior Kickstarter campaigns, we have a track record of quality, project completion, and kick-ass storytelling.
Plus, as with our other shows, JourneyQuest Season Three will be released under a Creative Commons license, allowing fans everywhere to remix, share, and play in the world of the show.
OUR PRODUCTION TEAM
Executive Producer/Writer: Matt Vancil (The Gamers Series, JourneyQuest)
Producers: Rennie Araucto (Hands of Fate) and Tony Becerra (JourneyQuest)
Director: Christian Doyle (Dorkness Rising, JourneyQuest)
Director of Photography: Jeremy Mackie (JourneyQuest, Hands of Fate)
WHEN WILL IT SHOOT?
Thanks to the generous support of our core fans, writers Matt Vancil and Kate Marshall have already completed the script, which means that we can begin production in April 2016. The cast and crew are scheduled, locations are getting locked down, and we're ready to begin ramping up production as soon as this campaign succeeds.
In order to continue the story, this campaign needs to raise a minimum of $420,000 before February 19th. If we reach that threshold, our backers will be charged and we'll get to make the show. If we do not, no money will exchange hands and the show will not be made.
First and foremost, we have to build an epic fantasy world: locations, sets, costumes, props, makeup, prosthetics, set dressing. This season includes a dwarven mining town and tavern, the first appearance by ogres in the series, a secret mountain hideaway, and so much more.
We also want to pay our cast and crew a living wage. Film production is their career and we want to make sure their labor is compensated fairly.
This production budget is the minimum that we need to do right by the story, the cast and crew, and the fans. With $0.77 out of every dollar going directly in the show and $0.12 going directly to creating and fulfilling the cool rewards that we've put together for you, this is going to be one of our most cost-effective productions yet.
TELL ME MORE ABOUT THESE REWARDS
EDIT: Read all about the new rewards right here.
Every reward is designed with our historical attention to quality and detail.
First, every backer will receive access to our Backerkit store, where you'll be able to find add-ons and exclusives after the campaign, including DVDs of prior seasons, digital downloads, and (if unlocked) exciting new merch at a deep discount.
Our digital downloads are always DRM-free, which means you can play, edit, and share them anywhere. And we'll deliver them in the highest-possible quality. In addition to the download of the show itself, we'll also include a PDF of the Nethadric's Pranks Adventure Path, a ten-part, 154 page JourneyQuest tabletop adventure module compatible with Pathfinder and Savage Worlds.
We've also heard fan feedback and are including our collectible embroidered patches with every physical order: no need to wait for the stretch goal on this campaign!
At $100 and up, every backer will get to work directly with series creator Matt Vancil to coin a new Orcish word. Your contribution will become an official part of the orcish language and we'll commemorate it with an exclusive etched metal card (3.5 X 2 inch) that includes your name, your backer number, your word, and its definition.
At $250, you'll attend our Season Three wrap party for a night with the cast and crew. We'll have a bag of unique memorabilia for you, photo opportunities, food, games, and a first look at raw footage from the set. And an exclusive Perf miniature. You're responsible for your own transportation to Seattle and lodging, so plan ahead on this one!
At $500, you receive a much-coveted Red Card, which allows you to flag bad puns, off-color remarks, or other violations by our cast and crew, both from set and in-person at conventions. We'll send that person to time out, sub in somebody new, and film and upload the results for you. And now you can bring your Red Card with you, with a dual-color etched metal card (2.75 x 4.5 inch) that includes your name and backer number. Plus, we'll give you an exclusive cast & crew t-shirt.
At $1000 and above, we've designed our rewards to be an incredible experience: you'll spend time with us on set or at the game table, have opportunities to appear in the series, receive exclusive art, and have your name featured in the credits and on IMDB. Plus, by popular request, at $2500 and above we're also including full size Perf Hats. As always, you will be responsible for your own lodging and transportation, as well as to arrive on set on the day we schedule you. So check your April calendars now!
WHAT IF I ALREADY CONTRIBUTED?
If you contributed to JourneyQuest via the "Support JourneyQuest" button at FanSupported.net between 2013 and 2015, that amount will make you eligible for the equivalent reward level in BackerKit.
EXAMPLE 1:
You contributed $50 already and don't want to pledge any more. We will add you to BackerKit and you will automatically receive the DVD/BLURAY reward.
EXAMPLE 2:
You contributed $35 already and want to pledge more. We will add you to BackerKit and you will automatically receive the DIGITAL DOWNLOAD reward. If you pledge for the TIP JAR level and add $15 to your pledge we will upgrade you to the $50 DVD/Bluray reward in BackerKit. Or if you pledge for the TIP JAR level and add $65 to your pledge we will upgrade you to the $100 ORCISH reward in BackerKit.
If you were a Phase II backer or are a current Patreon backer, we'll have details for you soon about special reward levels in BackerKit. Thanks for your patience!
HOW DO I KNOW HOW MUCH I CONTRIBUTED?
If you contributed at www.fansupported.net, send us a message with your name and the email address you used. We will check our master spreadsheet and provide you with a statement.
WHAT ABOUT ADD-ONS?
Add-ons will be available in Backerkit after the campaign ends. Please do not add any money to your pledge unless you A) are a prior contributor (as discussed directly above) or B) you are making an additional contribution to support the show.
*****WHAT ABOUT SHIPPING?*****
This is really important, so read carefully:
We will charge for all shipping after the campaign in BackerKit. In order for your rewards to ship, you will need to pay shipping fees at that time. Do NOT add shipping fees to your pledge now.
The Short Version—
International Backers: expect to pay less than $9.00 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
Domestic Backers: expect to pay less than $5.00 in BackerKit for base shipping on the $50 reward.
The Long Version, for people who like details—
International Backers: we are working with a third-party agency to fulfill your orders from warehouses in Europe, Canada, and Australia. This should help cut your typical U.S. shipping costs by a huge margin. However, please be aware that you may still be responsible for import duties, and that we must comply with international law and cannot mark your reward as a gift or as a zero-value item. Duties will not be included in your shipping charge.
Domestic Backers: we want to get the best-possible shipping and handling rate for you. Rather than over-estimating expenses now, we will charge actual rates when we are ready to ship.
All Backers: by handling shipping this way, we reduce unknown costs now, which means we know exactly how much we can put into the production budget, and then we can use economy of scale to make specific shipping orders with exact details.
What will shipping cost, you ask? 

International orders will average $.99 handling per item, plus local shipping costs. This should still be much less than you have paid in the past. (For example, in 2013 our cost to ship a DVD internationally began at $8.59 and went up from there as the weight increased.) Unfortunately, we cannot calculate this more precisely until we know our volume and can negotiate for the best rate possible.
Domestic orders will start at the current Media Mail rate for a five ounce parcel, plus a minimum of $.25 handling per item. You can estimate that shipping will begin around $3.99, plus more for larger or heavier packages that include more than a DVD and patch. Again, we'll use our volume to negotiate for the best-possible quote.
MORE WAYS TO HELP
Thank you for supporting JourneyQuest Season Three! We're excited to make these new episodes, with your help and encouragement!
Beyond pledging (and even a single dollar helps!) you can help spread the word in the following ways:
Share this campaign and the video on social media. Include a statement about why you love JourneyQuest.
Share the first two seasons. Encourage people to appreciate what we've already made possible and help them turn into fans.
Create and share your own fan art. We love seeing the amazing things people have made based on JourneyQuest!
Write your personal JourneyQuest story. Write a longer piece, or shoot a video, or tweet a haiku, about what JourneyQuest means to you. Share it somewhere like Medium.com. Make it compelling, interesting, and fun.
Interact with the community. Post and respond to comments here, or on Facebook, or on YouTube. Get to know other fans. Help show the world that we're not just a group of fan funders, but friends and collaborators in building a positive, inclusive, and welcoming community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign has risks and challenges. This is a big, complex machine with the potential for all kinds of things to go wrong. A cast member could have to drop out and be replaced. A location could decide not to host us. With large film projects, these kinds of issues are inevitable.

Furthermore, we could face delays, large expenses, or terrible storms on shoot days. On top of that there's fulfillment and delivery, which could also get delayed.

But there's also good news: we've overcome all of these challenges in the past. We shot through the hailstorm at Chambers Bay. We rewrote scenes to finish before losing the sun. And we've fulfilled our reward obligations through blood, tears, and long hours rolling thousands of signed posters into tubes.

Basically, we're professionals and we know how to deliver on our promises, how to communicate when we're behind, and how to email backers dozens of times to track down correct shipping addresses. Yes, we have our share of screw ups—and if you're one of the half-dozen backers from prior campaigns who never gave us shipping addresses, please help us help you receive your rewards!—but we'll make every effort to make it right when we do mess up.

If you're new to the ZOE family, we encourage you to check in with people who have backed us in the past. Watch our shows. Listen to our commentary tracks and relive the problems we've solved. Through rain or shine, we'll get the job done and deliver another awesome show.

Thanks for your support!

Against the Axis is a WW2 era superhero RPG supplement written by gaming luminary Steve Perrin for the ICONS, SUPERS! and Savage Worlds. All three systems will be funded by the primary goal!
SO - Who is Steve Perrin? Steve Perrin is a game designer who has written game materials for Chaosium and TSR. He is probably most famous for creating the role-playing game RuneQuest along with the role-playing games Stormbringer, Worlds of Wonder, Elfquest, and Superworld while also at Chaosium. He has also worked for Interplay Productions, Maxis, Spectrum Holobyte, FASA, Hero Games, West End Games, and Iron Crown Enterprises. He has done extensive work for ICONS - including writing the history section for Stark City
Dr. Comics (aka Professor Jason Tondro) has this to say about Against the Axis: "From subterranean Vril to the Man with Green Gloves, from Panzer mecha to Nazi supermen fueled by Asgardian beer, this book has everything you never knew you always needed to run a Golden Age campaign." 
Chuck Rice of Mayfar Games says: "Steve Perrin delivers a wonderful trip into the Golden Age of Comics. Along the way, he provides some WWII history, some comics history, and a lot of great villains for your heroes to fight and heroes for them to interact with or play. If you want to take a trip to WWII for the ICONS system, you should buy Against the Axis!" 
Steve Kenson, ICONS creator says : “Industry veteran Steve Perrin delivers both classic Golden Age comic book style and a wealth of useful information for Game Masters interested in World War II-era adventures or an entire series. A must-have expansion for the Stark City setting!" 
Sean Patrick Fannon (Shaintar, Savage Rifts, Modern Gods) says: "One thing my friend, Steve Perrin, knows better than almost anyone else in gaming is World War II era of the Golden Age, especially as it applies to superhero gaming. He is deservedly a legend in gaming circles that quite literally go back to the beginning of gaming, both as a GM and as a writer/designer. This book is an incredible treat - not just for Stark City fans, but for anyone wishing to run rollicking, two-fisted heroic adventures across the world of the Golden Age. One-part total expertise with the subject, one-part masterful prose for the tone, and one-part genuine love of the era you won't find in another source = the perfect book for this genre."
The ICONS version of the manuscript is complete and will be ready for download to backers on the day of launch. The Savage Worlds and SUPERS! versions are already in the process of being converted. Perrin is penning the Savage Worlds translation while Hazard Studios head Walt Robillard is doing the SUPERS! conversion. 
Additionally, Pinnacle Entertainment Group has been kind enough to let us the equipment and vehicle stats from Weird War 2 in this new superhero setting. Many Thanks to them. 
Fainting Goat Games has struck a deal with long-time fan-favorite publishing house Heroic Comics that allows us to use several of their Golden Age characters in this setting. In addition, Heroic will be publishing a special Golden Age comic written by Steve Perrin that ties in with Against the Axis. You can order it here: http://www.heroicmultiverse.com/heroicpub/previews/preview.php?ic=lx09. Any money we raise past our last stretch goal will be contributed to help defray the publication costs of this comic. 
At 3,600 - Clint Black (Savage Worlds), pens the ultimate Wild Cards of the Against the Axis Campaign:
The Voice of D.O.O.M. The world is plunged in war, but not everyone has chosen sides. The Defense and Overt Operations Mercenaries work for themselves. Commanded by the mysterious and reclusive General Bedlam, these soldiers of fortune engage in a variety of missions across the globe, often crossing paths with heroes. Led by his four lieutenants, the super-powered DoomSayers, Bedlam’s Doom Troopers sometimes stand opposed to the champions but occasionally beside them. In a game of the highest stakes, D.O.O.M. is the wild card.
 At this level we can unlock HERO System Support for Against the Axis!

A superhero setting like no other. A role-playing game campaign book that includes techniques and lessons from over 22 years of play. A tribute to one of the greatest creators in the RPG industry, created using Champions 6th Edition.
This is STRIKE FORCE.
"One of the most important overall supplements in the history of roleplaying games." -- Steven S. Long, Champions Villains
In 1988, Aaron Allston released Strike Force, a supplement detailing the first eight years of his superhero campaign. Noted for its extensive and highly-influential advice to gamemasters on how to run a long-term campaign, Strike Force was a landmark RPG publication.
We are now working to release an updated version of this classic book for the 21st Century. Aaron himself was designing this new edition of Strike Force before his untimely death, and we want to bring his work to life as a monument to Aaron's lasting influence on the RPG hobby. This  updated Strike Force sourcebook includes never-before-seen material detailing Aaron's multiversal superhero setting, compelling characters and villains, and updated and expanded advice from Superhero RPG veterans like Steve Kenson and Sean Patrick Fannon for how to run a campaign using "the Strike Force method."
WHY YOU NEED THIS BOOK: Strike Force was the first superhero campaign guide. It provided game masters with information on how to run a memorable and long-lasting campaign using all the great themes and tropes of comic book's best and most classic storylines. This new edition builds on that success, including advice from superhero RPG guru Steve Kenson! Aaron Allston's Strike Force is the resource to create unforgettable stories in your own superhero RPG campaign.
Principal writing has been completed and a WIP draft will be immediately available to backers! Preliminary artwork has been received, and we're in the process of laying out the book. However, we'd really like to be able to upgrade the artwork that is going into the project. We've got top-tier artists lined up to work with us, and we want to compensate them to the best of our ability--and that is why we need your help to reach our funding goal.
As things currently stand, High Rock Press and Evil Beagle Games cannot afford to purchase enough artwork to bring this up to the quality that we think is necessary for a historic RPG setting of this caliber. With a successful crowd funding campaign, we can use our artistic contacts to make a world-class product--worthy of Aaron Allston's talent.The initial funding goal includes the costs for artwork, graphic design, promotional materials, and assorted miscellaneous fees.
We plan to produce the core book as a PDF and as a limited print run. Aaron Allston's Strike Force is a 200-page, 8.5" x 11" book and will feature attractive page design and great illustrations. The PDF document will make use of PDF layer functionality so that graphic elements can be turned off to print more economically.
Aaron Allston's Strike Force presents the characters and villains of the setting in the Hero System, but we also have packages available to present these heroes and enemies in other rulesets such as Mutants and Masterminds, ICONS, and Savage Worlds.
"It’s a bit hard to explain to a modern audience, with the wealth of gaming knowledge and advice available today, precisely how important and vital Strike Force was when it came out in the dark days of 1988. I’ve occasionally resorted to a musical metaphor: Brian Eno once said of the seminal album, The Velvet Underground & Nico, 'only thirty thousand people bought a copy of that album in its first five years. But, every one of those thirty thousand started their own band.'” --Darren Watts, Galactic Champions
Luster, daughter of the Overlord!
We're focused on producing the best possible gaming experience that we can for our backers. Backers should please note that the May delivery date is for the Aaron Allston's Strike Force PDF. Stretch goal books are certain to require additional time for completion. The time frame on those is going to vary based upon the number of stretch goals achieved, the number of creators involved, and sundry other factors. We aim to have everything done by Summer of 2016, but in the interests of full disclosure, it is possible that things could become delayed if the workload exceeds our expectations.
ShadowWalker - $20 - At our base pledge level, backers receive immediate access to the in progress draft of Aaron Allston's Strike Force through Backers Only Update #1. When it is complete, backers receive a PDF copy of the complete Aaron Allston's Strike Force. You have the option of having your name, your characters name, or your company name included in a special thanks section of the PDF. In addition, you receive a PDF of character sheets for the heroes and villains of Strike Force for ICONS, Mutants and Masterminds, and Savage Worlds!
Luster - $50 - As ShadowWalker, plus you receive a physical copy of Aaron Allston's Strike Force. In addition, you receive an electronic copy of the Hero Lab and Hero Designer files for the Strike Force characters and villains!
Man Mountain Thunder - $50 - This level includes the PDF, the archives, both character packs, and the 1988 Strike Force PDF. It's a $10 savings over buying them all individually!

Additionally, you will receive a special Strike Force adventure written by Michael Surbrook based on one of Aaron's ideas (2,000 words), and will be given access to a special one-hour character creation seminar hosted by him over Skype. Art of the Genre is proud to partner with Pinnacle Entertainment Group in bringing our fans Folio #7!  After completing the Roslof Keep Campaign it seemed a perfect point to sidestep to Savage Worlds for an adventure in the Deadlands: Hell on Earth setting.  It is an absolutely fantastic setting with an award-winning mechanic that I hope all our fans will give a shot. 
With Folio #7, we will be blending the same OSR specs that our fans have grown accustomed to with the previous issues while also blending in some aspects of the Deadlands: Hell on Earth design.  I truly hope you'll have a much fun playing this adventure as my players did, and as always thanks for taking the time to check out our latest projects here on Kickstarter.
And as always, Instead of making gaming anvils, I’ve drilled the artistry of the game down, found the gems of a fast-paced adventure, and delivered it in such a way that both new and old gamers alike can enjoy and play without taxing their life schedules. In the end, isn’t gaming about being fun for everyone, not just the players? The Folio’s goal is to ensure that, and always give folks the very best quality ‘lean and mean’ adventures we can.
My Project: The Folio #7 is a single shrink-wrapped adventure module based on Savage Worlds: Deluxe mechanics and set in the Deadlands: Hell on Earth setting.  Each will be produced as an 8x11”, removable cover [11x17" once removed], adventure with mostly b/w interior artwork. There are two interior booklets, The Field Guide for setting specifics, and the Adventure which details the challenges facing the players. All told, the final size will be roughly 40 pages of content.
Who’s it for? ALL gamers, both new gamers and old gamers, as it is easily expandable or playable as is.The concept is to allow gamers a starting point for adventure that can be modified to their liking while providing excellent reference content and framework. Again, the base mechanic will be for Savage Worlds: Deluxe, but I’ve designed it to be readily modified to any post-apocalyptic game.
Incredible Cover Art by Keith Parkinson
What’s in it? All original content. It has been written by myself, with incredible cover art from TSR legend Keith Parkinson, and interior artwork by skilled black and white illustrators, Chet Minton, Michael Wilson, Josh Godin and Jeff Laubenstein. This Folio will contain a 3-D map, a Field Guide, a new Edge unique to the setting, GM’s notes and guides, and a full adventure.
About Deadlands:Deadlands is a Weird Western by Pinnacle Entertainment Group (www.peginc.com) where the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, known as the Reckoners, are trying to bring about a Hell on Earth so they can walk upon it in the flesh. They do this by nurturing fear to drench the earth in dark, supernatural energy that can sustain their physical manifestation.
That’s the “meta level” and the back story that ties all the various Deadlands games together—the original Weird Western, the post-apocalyptic “Wasted” West” of Hell on Earth, Deadlands Noir, and Deadlands Lost Colony—which takes place on the far fringes of space.
By defeating these terrors, the players are slowly—bit by bit—battling the Reckoners as well. Besides lightning-fast gunslingers, brave Indian warriors, and other standards in the Weird West, Deadlands also has a number of “arcane backgrounds,” characters who have developed supernatural powers to fight the good fight. Hucksters make dark bargains for power, hurling playing cards charged with energy or casting other “hexes” and spells. Mad scientists use a super fuel called “ghost rock” to power infernal gizmos and weapons. Shamans channel power from nature spirits, and the blessed draw spiritual magic directly from the distant but always present powers of good.
Most importantly, in the world of Deadlands, those with particularly strong wills can come back from the dead—hence the name "Harrowed.". The price is high though—the Harrowed crawl out of their graves by way of “manitous,” evil spirits that vie for control of their host. Those Harrowed who maintain “dominion” over their demonic rider can quickly develop additional supernatural powers as well.
When? As always, the bulk of The Folio #7 is complete, we only need to be funding so we can begin the full printing process. Delivery will be in March 2016.  WE ARE FAST!
Interior Adventure Booklet Cover
Why Savage Worlds? Because it is AWESOME!  I've been a gamemaster in countless settings, with countless mechanics over the past 35 years, but Savage Worlds is just so damn easy to play.  It is easy for players, and more importantly it is easy on those running the game.  There is a reason it won the Gamer's Choice Award at Origins! Also, I'm a child of the Cold War, so post-apocalyptic settings always have intrigued me, and Deadlands: Hell on Earth is simply one of the best to play.
I can’t do this without you! We here at Art of the Genre need your help! We've trimmed out all excess costs and have a break even amount of $5,000 per Folio.This covers the printing, shipping, design, mapping, and the incredible story telling artwork we’ll be using in these adventures. We have already devoted countless hours to seeing this product come together, but to make it ‘real’ and available to all players, we need your help. We believe in this dream, and we hope you do too!
What happens if we pass the goal? If we pass the goal, it will allow us to begin production on new stretch additions for this particular adventure, including side 'mini-adventures' as well as setting seeds and more Field Guides to help flesh out this little piece of the Wasted West. Bottom line, our goal is to make a truly fantastic and age-defying piece of gaming history, each penny we receive goes toward that. This ‘put everything into the product’ mentality is why this Kickstarter is so thin on ‘rewards’, as physical SWAG steals from the overall content of the project, the product, and the backers, as well as slowing the process of getting the module into your hands!
STRETCH GOALS:
First stretch goal mini-adventure achieved at $7500!
GOOGLE HANGOUT Q/A #1 (Sorry for the weird echo...)
BACKER LEVELS
*TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER

UPDATE: The Preview Document is live both on Google Docs and DrivethuRPG!
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B49tHg4PzaOiVGo2QXdNWlJUdFE/view?usp=sharing
http://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/172496/Olympus-Inc-Preview
Welcome to Olympus, Inc!
At this point you're probably saying to yourself, "well the artwork is cool and I like Savage Worlds, but what's the setting all about?"
I'm glad you asked! Unlike most settings that have tackled the concept of demigods in the modern world, we are a bit different. Olympus, Inc answers the question of what would happen if the Olympians were kicked out of the heavens by Gaia and the Titans ruled instead. 
After she ejected them from the heavens, Gaia was also kind enough to use the Lethe River to cause all humans to forget that the Olympians existed. This nearly killed the Olympians, who began to fade away. However, the Olympians realized that they could draw from our obsession with the almighty dollar and gain power. Therefore, the Olympians traded their stone temples for towers of glass and steel. They formed the world's largest corporations. Now the Titans and Olympians fight a battle for control of the Heavens and Earth with each wielding incredible power. In the midst of all of this are normal humans who are asleep to everything that is around them.
Gaia has put a few rules in place to ensure that the Titans and Olympians don't tear each other apart as well as the rest of the inhabitants on Earth. This is known as the Nemesis Effect. The Nemesis Effect prohibits the use of visible supernatural abilities in front of sleepers (normal mortals). It also prohibits mythical creatures from appearing in front of a sleeper in their true form. If anyone breaks the rules, the Goddess Nemesis punishes them. It can be anything from being wracked with intense pain to death. It really depends on the severity of the infraction.
Therefore, the Titans and Olympians fight a secret proxy war in a world identical to our own. However, most humans don't know that the gods exist and they certainly don't know that monsters and demigods with superhuman abilities roam the earth.
The setting has a strong cyberpunk feel with a bit of superpowers and espionage thrown in for good measure.
So who's writing this thing?
Olympus, Inc has been a labor of love for two experienced writers and avid gamers: Gilbert Gallo and Charles White.
Gilbert is an amazing Italian author whose work has been featured in tabletop gaming magazines. He has also authored "Mythos", a setting guide for Savage Worlds published by Mystic Throne Entertainment.  In addition, Gilbert wrote supplements in support of this line as well as other great stuff!
Charles White is an American author whose work has been featured in a couple of different gaming magazines. He is the author of "Ultimate Knights Templar Guide". In addition, he has authored a few modules and is co-founder of the Ennie-Nominated publishing company that is behind this product, Fabled Environments.
So, what's in the book?
In this book, we present the history of how things came to pass and where we are now. We detail character creation for decedents of 6 gods from the Olympian Pantheon: Zeus, Hermes, Ares, Aphrodite, Apollo and Dionysus.  We also provide a list of powers for each line as well as details surrounding the corporation that each god created. In addition, we have also provided two demihuman options: Satyr and Minospawn. A Minospawn is basically a 6 foot tall Minotaur with the same bad attitude as the full size version. 
If that isn't enough, we have created a ton of new edges, hindrances and weapons that are all designed to create the feel that is unique to Olympus, Inc. We have also included a plot point campaign as well as a random adventure generator that is sure to give you tons of ideas for your own game. 
Our hope is to flesh out the other gods, present more demihuman options, like cyclopes and centaurs, and offer additional powers for each divine line in future supplements. We really want Olympus, Inc to be a line and not just a single product!
Just to be clear, this setting book requires both the Savage Worlds core rulebook as well as the Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion.
Okay, that's nice, but what about stretch goals? 
I like where your head is at! We have those, too. We'll be sharing some specifics as we get closer to funding the book.
I can tell you that the stretch goals are really cool! We reached out to some of the best authors in the Savage Worlds community and they agreed to help us out. Six amazing authors have agreed to create 2000-3000 word adventures in the world of Olympus, Inc. If we reach all six of these stretch goals, we'll put them all in a single .pdf and offer them to backers in print! 
Stretch goal authors include: Sean Preston, John Dunn, Umberto Pignatelli, Sean Bircher and Curtis Lyon as well as the prolific Italian Author and Game Designer, Andrea Angiolino. We'll introduce you to all of these amazing authors as the Kickstarter progresses.
Levels:
$9000- 2000-3000 word adventure by Umberto Pignatelli AND 15 custom figure flats from Arion Games. These will be the archetypes presented in the book along with a few intelligent monsters.
$9500--Fabled Environments Floorplan: Art Gallery/Museum 
$10000- 2000-3000 word adventure by John Dunn
$10500- 2000-3000 word adventure by Sean Preston
$11000- 2000-3000 word adventure by Sean Bircher
$11500- 2000-3000 word adventure by Andrea Angiolino
$12000- 2000-3000 word adventure by Curtis Lyon
$12500-Compile all the adventures into a single document. Backers will have the option of purchasing the compilation in print as a add-on.
Why do you need the money? 
90% of the book is written, but high-quality artwork and product design isn't cheap. We want to use the money that we raise from this Kickstarter to commission more amazing artwork and create an incredible product. However, we can only do this with your support. The money that we raise will, among other things, allow this book to contain a ton of color art, like the two pieces created for the campaign.
Obtaining Hardcopies
PLEASE NOTE: ALL print pledge tiers $45 and higher are only offered at Premium Print Quality. There is no additional charge beyond the tier cost to get the book at Premium Print Quality! 
DriveThruRPG will fulfill the print orders for this Kickstarter.  Whether softcover or hardcover, the book will be 8 1/2 " x 11" and come in around 150 pages. 
DriveThruRPG explains Premium Printing this way:
"The Premium color uses a thicker paper that can hold heavier ink saturation and thus the color pages look a little brighter and the contrast is much more powerful. Premium is more expensive to produce in part because of the heavier paper and there is more ink used in the process. Both B&W and standard color books are printed on 50-lb. standard white paper. Premium color books are printed on 70-lb. white paper."
Got questions that we haven't answered? Feel free to contact us through facebook or kickstarter. If you'd rather, you can always email us at charles@fabledenvironments.com

A big thanks to everyone who has shared the project, especially our friends in Germany, Italy and Brazil. Both Gilbert and myself are very grateful for and humbled by all the support that we have received. This book is a labor of love for both of us!  
However, the journey isn't over yet. We have about 6 days left and we are still a little short on our goal. Please continue sharing the Kickstarter on social media and hit up your favorite bloggers and ask them to share the Kickstarter as well.

Hi All,
We are chugging along nicely. We are currently 85% funded with 9 days to go. Obviously, I'd like to be funded already so we could work on bring you some great stretch goals. However, I am pleased where we are. I think we should pick up a few more backers in the next couple of days and then there will be the big rush at the end. That is pretty common for Kickstarters. 
Anyone have any questions  or want to learn more about the project or any of the companies/authors providing stretch goals or backer rewards? We have already had some great questions that I have tried to answer either in the comments section or as an update.

Big thanks to the recent backers! We are just shy of 75% of our goal with 13 days to go. 
Thanks to everyone for your support. Please continue to talk about the project on blogs, social media, gaming events and anywhere else you can think of.

campaign.story:
Um... quickly explain what is High-Space?
High-Space is a science fiction setting for Savage Worlds, the tabletop RPG. You require a copy of the Savage Worlds rules in order to play, but those rules are quite cheap to buy either from your LGS, or on-line.
The setting for High-Space focuses on several novel key elements:
Stylish, science-fiction specific rules for Savage Worlds
Exciting futuristic locales
Exotic playable alien races
The best Starship combat and construction rules in any setting (in our opinion, ahem!)
Welcome back, Commander...
The original High-Space was a big success on RPGNow, and this new version will expand to cover the interstellar diaspora known as the 'PanDominion' which was previously only hinted at, including the various races, agencies and factions that compete for the control of half a galaxy.
We also want to build you a 'Control Deck' of 42(+?) printed gaming cards, that meld gorgeous artwork with the key rules and resources of the game, to make your Savage gaming even faster, more fun, and more furious!
Sample cover art & Command Deck
What are the main sections of the game?
Characters, with new playable races, cultures, backgrounds, Edges, Skills, and Hindrances, that create the beating artificial(?) hearts inside the metal...
Starships, with more Edges, revised construction rules, and more combat and spacefighting options, to explore the galaxy and be the one to make first-contact...
Alien races, a whole menagerie of civilized and not-so-civilized races for a great campaign...
The PanDominion - a galactic powerhouse administered by artificial intelligences, based on the ideal of growth by the 'contact', 'uplifting', (and if necessary 'intervention') of other cultures and races; a stylish setting that plays by a new set of rules...
Sci-Fi rules - cinematic rules/adaptations to make your Savage Worlds even more 'sci-fi'!
Tell us more about those Stretch Goals...
Digital Space
A set of desktop wallpapers in the common sizing’s, themed with HS art, backer-only versions!
The Sphere
Digital maps and icons/tokens for popular online-gaming portals, as selected from a backer survey.
Starship #1
A starship, just for you, our backers! We will send a survey of the options for your vote, and write up the winning choice. Includes background material, statblock (based on the current rules), and maps/floorplans.
BONUS Goal:  Tyaborg Quickstart Player's Pack
This new High-Space stretch goal will see an EXPANDED XENOFORM entry for the Tyaborg and a Quickstart Player’s Pack. The expanded information includes insights into the Imperial Nest, a unique Tyaborg Edge, unique Gear, one unique Transonic or regular vehicle, and one unique Starship Edge for Tyaborg ships. Everything needed to play these reptilian soldiers of the PanDomonion.
Extra Control
Once we reach this level, then for every 100 backers we have, we will add +1 card to the Control Deck, targeting the most commonly referenced rules and resources.
Agency
A PDF detailing the 3 external agencies of the U.G.P. (First-Contact, Uplift, Intervention), including the people, agendas, gear, training, successes, and (sometimes) shameful secrets of each organization.
Starship #2
One more starship, just for you our backers! We will send a survey of the options for your vote, and write up the winning choice. Includes background material, statblock (based on the current rules), and maps/floorplans.
'Espacio Profundo'
Spanish translation of the core reward (High-Space, the book) in PRINT & PDF format (NB: When it comes time to choose your Print version you will be asked to specify English OR Spanish; you still only get a reward of one book for your pledge. Additional copies in each language may be available depending on print run costs, and final funding.)
Orion’s Spur
A PDF adventure about a group of characters caught in the middle of tensions between the different UGP agencies and the 'Minds' that coordinate the PanDominion, regarding the fate of a recently discovered alien race. There are factions within the UGP that believe the aliens must be 'intervened' against, and Minds that want to see the aliens 'uplifted' into the PanDominion seemingly regardless of the cost. The characters will also have the chance to discover the truth about the aliens for themselves...
Starship #3
Yet another starship! Just for our backers! We will send a survey of the options for your vote, and write up the winning choice. Includes background material, statblock (based on the current rules), and maps/floorplans.
Milspec Tactica
A PDF source book for the three military arms of the UGP; Field, Aero, and Armada. Including official ranks and insignia, key personnel, equipment and vehicles, as well as black operations and astro-political tensions.
          Meet the team...
In case you are wondering just who and what Storyweaver is... we Joe, Patrick, Jaie, Ray, and Stuart, are an Aussie publishing group that works on a collegial model - we all produce, handle logistics, write, edit, and even occasionally do graphics and layout, and we all take care of the business. High-Space as a product line is the positronic-brain-child of Patrick 'JiaoshouX' Taylor , who has numerous publishing and contributing credits for Savage Worlds, Heavy Gear, 3.5 OGL (including the Psihammer rules), various indie titles, and even the old Warhammer Roleplay game!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have selected modest goals.
We have taken on board insightful fan-based feedback.
We have done incredibly detailed planning, and understand the cost-per-page for development, printing, and distribution.
And Storyweaver has track record of quality production.
We believe that we will deliver you a great product, on time.

That said.. this is our first Kickstarter (as hosts, not backers). Also the stretch goal to achieve a non-English translation of the core book is new to us. Si! Eso es correcto! If all goes to plan, and that stretch goal is reached, we will be bringing you High-Space in Spanish (but not in Klingon!) Storyweaver folk have employed translation services before, but this will be a first for us as publishers. (Yay!) We already have our costs worked out, and will bring all our external experience to bear to make this work!

NB: The shipping costs shown are projections only, and based on the AUD to USD exchange rate at the time of the project launch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
In a world of dark fantasy and perilous adventure, the forces of evil triumphed. Only monsters remain to fight against the darkness. Witches rule the land, but their Grand Coven has been sundered. The remnants of their massive army include captured citizens of the conquered nations who fought as the Witches’ shock troops.
These are the Accursed—Witchmarks burned into their flesh and souls transformed these men and women into monstrous forms. Unable to return to their former lives, the Accursed wander the land, giving aid to those in need in an attempt to atone for past sins.
Light has failed, darkness is ascendant. The Accursed are this world’s only hope. They must embrace their curse or fight against it, using their powers to free their world from dark tyranny.
In 2013, Melior Via successfully ran a Kickstarter to fund the creation of the Accursed RPG setting for Savage Worlds. That project completed and fulfilled successfully and in a timely fashion. In the time since then, fans of the setting have asked us to produce more material. We've been working on that, but we'd like to accelerate our process. That's our motive for this crowdfunding campaign. Our goal is to produce additional materials for the Accursed Game World.
Our primary focus is on creating a detailed World book. We already offer an ebook that details two of the world's nations (Sand and Stone, focusing on Hebron and Hyphrates). We'd like to produce more ebooks in that same style. Principal writing and editing for Fang and Frost is already complete. This is a game setting ebook that provides additional information about Valkenholm and Steppengrad, two of the major nations in the game world. A draft version of this material is immediately available to backers (see the first update).
We want to make sure that we can include top tier artwork in these materials. Beyond that, we'd also like to make similar eBooks, provided we receive enough community support. We're lucky to have top tier talent willing to work with us, and we want to be able to compensate them to the best of our ability. That's why we need funding.
The initial funding goal ($3,000.00) includes the costs for artwork, graphic design, writing, editing, and promotional work necessary to produce a single eBook.
Please note that these materials are in support of Accursed, which is an Official Savage Worlds Licensed Product. They require Accursed, the core Savage Worlds rules, and the Savage Worlds Horror Companion to play.
Reviews of Accursed:
"Amazing on every level and I cannot recommend it highly enough."
–Abstruse, Ain't it Cool News
"Melior Via made the game I've always wanted to play."
-Tommy Brownell, Most Unread Blog on the Internet. Ever.
We're pretty sure that the community is willing to help us make at least one additional eBook for Accursed, but we hope that there might be more support than that. If the community is interested, we have plans for several additional products:
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #1 - $6,000 – Science and Sea – We'll create another PDF focusing on Manreia and the Discordian Sea. Preliminary writing on this is nearing completion. If we achieve this goal, we will release a rough cut to backers when the draft is complete. This PDF will be given to all backers at the $10 level and up. It will be included in the book produced for backers at the Print Witchmarked ($25) level.
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #2 - $8,000 – Bone and Barrow – We'll create another PDF focusing on Cairn Kainen and the Outlands. Preliminary writing on this is currently in progress. The final PDF will be distributed to all backers at the $10 level and up. It will be included in the book produced for backers at the Print Witchmarked ($25) level.
This stretch goal is a bigger deal than it seems. If we can achieve this, we will have funded the creation of PDFs featuring all six of Morden's major nations, plus the Outlands and the Discordian Sea. Using these, the new print book will be a complete atlas of Morden.
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #3 - $9,000 - City Maps - Mikael Brodu will draft a set of maps for inclusion into the ebooks that offer a detailed look at the capitals of each of Morden's six nations, as well as a major location in the Discordian Sea and the Outlands. The featured locations are as follows:
Hebron – Parnath
Hyphrates – Ur-Xandria
Valkenholm – Kulidar
Steppengrad – Aziev
Manreia – Palmyria
Cairn Kainen – Shieldhaven
The Discordian Sea – Port Sorrow
The Outlands – Clachan na Tannasg
UNLOCKED! Stretch Goal #4 - $10,500 – Accursed Novella – Ross would like to see the fiction line for Accursed grow, and I think that's a more than worthy goal. If we can unlock this stretch goal, Ross will write a novella that takes place in Accursed. The ebook of  the novella will be provided (in .epub and .mobi formats) to all backers at the $10 level and up.
Stretch Goal #5 - $15,500 - Accursed Apocrypha - This falls into the category of things we said we wouldn't do, but requests keep coming up for it, so, we're putting it out there. Accursed Apocrypha is an ebook of alternative Witches and variant Witchbreeds. This ebook will be generously illustrated, with a picture of each variant Witchbreed as well as each additional Witch. We'll aim for it to be a 60 page book.
We'll include the ebook for free to all backers at the $10+ level, and we'll send everyone at the $25+ level a coupon code to purchase the print version at a discount. If we unlock this, the book will not be completed until late 2016.
Witchmarked ($10)
At our base pledge level, backers receive immediate access to the working draft of Frost and Fang through Backers Only Update #1. When it is complete, backers receive a PDF copy of Frost and Fang. (Check Update #1!) Backers will also receive a PDF copy of Science and Sea, since that stretch goal has been unlocked.
Print Witchmarked ($25)
As Witchmarked, plus receive a softcover, print compilation of the World of Morden ebooks funded by this Kickstarter. The printed book also includes the content from the Sand and Stone eBook. Because we have met our first two stretch goals, this book will be roughly 120 pages.
See Add-ons below for options to upgrade the print version of the book to hardcover or premium paper.
Accursed eBook Completist ($60)
As Witchmarked, plus you receive a PDF of every Accursed game ebook in Melior Via's library. That includes Accursed, the Player's Guide, Sand and Stone, Banshee of Loch Finnere, The Guns of Dagerov, Darkest Tides, Long Dead and Twice Slain, Absolution, Grove Point, Half-Light, Moon Valley, Fall of the Tower, Hatred's Snare, A Distant Dream, the GM Screen inserts, and the Double Poker Deck. (Retail value of more than $80!) Please note: This pledge level does not include any print products.
Personal Witchmarked ($250)
As Print Witchmarked, plus receive a piece of artwork dedicated to a character or bane you create in cooperation with the creative team. The artwork will be integrated into a custom 1-sheet. At this pledge level, the print copy of Worlds of Morden is automatically upgraded to Hardcover and Premium. Note that Melior Via retains copyright to the artwork, character, and 1-sheet.
Rent-a-Ross ($2000)
As Print Witchmarked, plus Ross Watson will travel to you to run a weekend of Accursed games for you and your friends in your home. Ross's airfare and hotel stay are included. You'll need to provide the place to play and the other members of the game group. At this pledge level, the print copy of Worlds of Morden is automatically upgraded to Hardcover and Premium.
If you would like additional items added to your pledge rewards, simply increase the value of your pledge by the amounts shown below. After the Kickstarter ends we will contact you to determine how you want to spend any extra amount pledged.
For example, if you had already selected the Witchmarked ($10) pledge level, but you also wanted a copy of Sand and Stone ($6), keep the $10 reward selected, but increase the value of your pledge to $16. (Use the "Manage" button near the video at the top of the page if you choose to change the total pledge.)
Electronic Add-Ons
Accursed Player's Guide PDF - $10
Accursed Setting PDF - $20
Sand and Stone PDF - $6
The Banshee of Loch Finnere PDF - $6
The Guns of Dagerov PDF - $6
Darkest Tides PDF - $6
Short Adventure Pack - $6 (Includes PDFs of Absolution, A Distant Dream, Fall of the Tower, Grove Point, Half-Light, Hatred's Snare, Long Dead and Twice Slain, and Moon Valley)
Print Add-Ons
Accursed Setting Standard Hardcover - $40*
Ill Omens Standard Softcover - $20*
Accursed: World of Morden Standard Softcover - $25*
Upgrade World of Morden to Standard Hardcover - $8 ($33* total)
Upgrade World of Morden to Premium Hardcover - $18 ($43* total)
Print book add-ons include US shipping costs. If shipping to the EU (including UK), Singapore, New Zealand, or Australia, please add $4 per book. If shipping to Canada, please add $5 per book.
For more information on the differences between Standard and Premium versions, please see update #11.
We are using DriveThruRPG to fulfill all electronic and print products in this project. Books will be printed at the production facility that can most economically deliver them to the backer. (For example, Canadian backers will receive books printed in the UK, while US backers will receive books printed in the US.) DriveThruRPG will handle all printing and shipping, using addresses that Melior Via receives in a survey collected after the project funds.
Pledge levels that include physical rewards have the US shipping cost included for those rewards. Add on books also include US shipping. However, add-ons for non-US backers do require an additional shipping fee. If we don't have shipping rates set up for your country, please send a PM via Kickstarter messaging, and we'll get that addressed for you.

Melior Via successfully ran and fulfilled a Kickstarter for Accursed in 2013 and one for The Thin Blue Line in 2015. We learned a great deal from those projects, and we are using the lessons learned in undertaking this one.
Ross Watson is an award-winning game designer with more than 50 RPG books under his belt, many as Lead Developer for the Warhammer 40,000 Roleplay line. He was a core developer on the Dust Warfare and Shadowrun: Sprawl Gangers miniature game teams, and the lead writer for the Darksiders II console and PC game. He has written or contributed to books for 3rd Edition Dungeons & Dragons, Star Wars: Edge of the Empire, and Malifaux: Through the Breach. Ross consults with companies on narrative, design, development, and IP management issues.
Jason Marker has been writing for the traditional games industry since 1999. In that time he’s worked for Palladium Books, both as a freelancer and a full-time staff writer, Fantasy Flight Games, Wyrd Games, Melior Via, and Catalyst Game Labs. When not writing about spaceships or the vagaries of the games industry, Jason keeps house, raises his daughters, plays in a guerrilla brass band, shoots pictures, shoots guns, shoots bourbon, shoots his mouth off, rides motorcycles, and plays a hell of a lot of games.
John Dunn's been active in the RPG community since the early '90s as an author for RPGA convention scenarios and later as the coordinator for the Shadowrun Missions ongoing campaign. In more recent years, his focus has shifted to work as a freelance game developer. He's worked with Fantasy Flight Games, Pinnacle Entertainment Group, Modiphius Games, Catalyst Game Labs, and Wyrd Games. He is also owner and lead developer for Melior Via, LLC, publisher of Accursed, The Thin Blue Line – A Detroit Police Story, and Hope Preparatory School.
The team members have designed role-playing games for many properties, including Star Wars, Shadowrun, Warhammer 40,000 Roleplay, Robotech, and Malifaux: Through the Breach. Collectively, we have decades of experience working in the hobby gaming industry and we’re very excited about expanding the products for the Accursed game setting. All of us are bringing our combined creativity, experience, and passion to the project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge with getting any RPG completed is getting the actual work done. We have already completed the primary writing on the first two books. Using the resources of our core creatives, the writing should be completed in conjunction with playtesting shortly after the completion of this Kickstarter. The other requirement is the interior artwork for the remainder of the book. We have some of that in-hand, but we do need funding from this project to secure the remainder. Several artists have already given us verbal agreements, but we need funding before either side can commit to the contracts. Once those contracts are done, we expect the work to flow smoothly.

If either writers or artists encounter problems with deadlines, we have enough contacts (and resources from this Kickstarter) to reach out to other freelancers to finish the job. If something catastrophic were to happen to one of the core creatives, the other would be more than capable of wrapping the project.

Printing can be a challenge, for those seeking hard copies of our products. To overcome this challenge, we are working with a world class organization in DriveThruRPG. We have used them in the past to produce and distribute PDFs as well as print books and cards. We are confident that their expertise will be sufficient to produce great products once more. We know that we can obtain proofs from them in a timely fashion that will be up to the high expectations of our backers. Once those are approved, production is just a matter of flipping a switch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Nutshell
Retribution is a supernatural fantasy setting for Savage Worlds, requiring a copy of any edition of the Savage Worlds rulebook. With some patience and creativity, it can be converted to other systems.
Key Points of Interest
PCs can be any of the six primary races (human, elf, dwarf, orc, gnome, half-folk) or hybrids of them.
If a PC dies, there is a chance she will be transformed into a playable ghost (spirit).
Besides the general fighter, cleric, magic-user, and other, familiar character types, Retribution offers Edges and Hindrances to create specialized characters such as unjailers who work to free entities who have been bound to this plane unwillingly, necromancers who study mastery of the dead, exomancers who have the power to work with extraplaner beings, and others that add to the Retribution experience.
Necromancy is more than just animating skeletons or raising the dead as zombies, covering also medium arts, binding spirits, and working with other aspects of death.
Exomancy is much like necromancy, but applies only to those who come from beyond the mortal realm. 
Play Possibilities 
Venture across the sea from the original homelands to Agador to escape a troubled past; seek to restore your ancestral village, leading to any number of options; portray a group of ghost hunters who want to banish any who don’t belong; assemble a group to search for relics of bygone days; work the trade routes, protecting merchants and finding adventure; be part of the burgeoning Agador Guard, who keep out pirates, or at least keep them under control; quest to release trapped spirits or try extra-planer entities who mean harm; or become part of the new political structure satisfying your own interest in power.
Retribution Character Sheet
Retribution Setting Summary
The Great Betrayal – the civil war of Agador – led to the sundering of the veil between the physical realm and many others. Play in a world where the planes of existence have leaked into Agador, introducing ghosts set upon retribution for their deaths, allowing entry of previously unknown entities, and upsetting the natural order of the land. 
Many are dead-set on wreaking havoc or have other mysterious agendas. However, not all are hostile. Some seek unjailers who can send them back to the planes from which the magical attacks and malicious intent pulled them. Others wish to explore what is here. There are those who are trapped by necromancy or exomancy. A few see themselves as new guardians of Agador. 
This is a land of opportunity and peril. A place where the natural and supernatural collide. The Great Betrayal nearly destroyed all who inhabited it, but survivors and questors choose not to let it die. Join the ranks of descendants who are determined to restore order and bring renewed prominence to the island nation. Come to Agador to prove your strength and test your mettle. Break the cycle of Retribution.
Backstory
More than a hundred years ago, elvish explorers discovered an undeveloped island. They set up camps and cataloged their discoveries. Word spread across the other lands. Intrigued, many sailed to new lives. For decades, the fledgling island nation grew in peace, with small settlements taking hold near the shores and in the wilds in between.
Side by side, all manner of people worked the land: its fields, stones, and trees. Some sought more than they had. Whispered half-truths spread from small town to port city and all assemblies in between, sparking unrest. One by one, allies turned upon each other, seeing foes where friends had stood. 
Fighting broke out. Families were divided. Civil war consumed the nation. Just as the violence reached its apex, some who’d been searching for answers – suspecting Agador had been sucked into a manufactured crisis – found proof of their hypothesis. It was too late.
Each side had ramped up all manner of fighting, engaging the deadliest of magical attacks and counterattacks that any had ever seen. Alas, in a fearsome display of power, the fighters of Agador did something none knew was possible and was not at all intended: they tore into the veil between the physical world and that of the dead. The recently departed flooded back into the mortal realm. The chaos did not stop there. The act reverberated across planes, allowing creatures beyond their imaginations to cross into their world. 
In the span of just a few minutes, the civil war – The Great Betrayal – ended and a new, much more desperate one began. 
And Now
It’s been 50 years since the war ended and Agador united to defend itself against those who don’t belong. While many of the unearthly beings have been dispelled, banished, or otherwise stopped from occupying the physical world, the fabric holding the planes apart has never completely healed. 
Several leaders are attempting to rebuild Agador, returning it to the splendor and purpose it achieved before The Great Betrayal. They’ve reached out to the faraway homelands inviting adventurers, merchants, and anyone else who will come in peace. They’ve rallied descendants of the first settlers, as well, hoping to harness their ambition as heirs of lost settlements. It is up to those who accept the challenge to quell the ongoing quest for retribution while aiding in the reformation of the once-proud nation. 
Designers
Retribution is the product of Vickey A. and Robert (Bob) L. Beaver, longtime roleplayers and Obatron Productions co-owners.
Bob co-wrote Tunse'al Setting Guide and related products, has contributed to Savage Insider, and has playtested for various companies, including Savage Mojo and Greymalkin Designs. He GMs on a regular basis.
Vickey is the other writer on all Tunse'al products, the Editor-in-Chief for Savage Insider, co-writer on Caladon Falls (Savage Worlds, published by Savage Mojo), writer of "Swords of Catthulhu" (found in Worlds of Catthulhu), and writer of the Mimicling and Treant Sapling entries in Baby Bestiary, which sold out promptly after Wil Wheaton mentioned it at Gen Con 2015. 
She has also edited, proofread, or playtested for Savage Mojo, Cumberland Games, and Greymalkin Designs. She GMs at conventions, stores, and special events, hosts RPG-related seminars, and is a G*M*S Magazine co-host for the RPG podcast.
How We'll Use Funding
Funding pays writers, editors, layout designers, illustrators, and external vendors such as printers, Kickstarter, and USPS. Although shipping is listed separately, it counts toward the funding goal, so what you see raised includes that and any add-ons.
Map of Agador, work in progress
Add-Ons
To allow for some customization of your perks and to prevent having even more reward tiers to read through, we've got some add-ons. More will be added if we hit certain stretch goals. If you see add-ons you want, simply increase your pledge by that amount. Additional shipping may be required, which we'll determine before the end of the Kickstarter so you know how much to adjust your pledge. Hopefully, we'll have an automated tool in place by then, but just in case, you should keep track of what you want so when the time comes, you'll know what you had in mind. Please note, many add-ons are included in our upper-level rewards.
DIY Minis PDF (minis of all six primary races, plus characters to match) - $4
Diaries of Agador PDF (fiction from the point of view of canon characters across time) - $5
GM Screen PDF (inserts for 8 1/2" x 11" screens) - $5
GM Screen Print (9 x 18 game board bi-fold) - $15
Agador Map Board (10 x 10) - $12
Extra Copy of Retribution Quick Starts and Side Treks Print (20-page volume excerpting key parts of setting guide to get world flavor and jump-start playing via quick start segments and adventure seeds for side treks) - $8
Extra Copy of Retribution Setting Guide Soft Cover Print (MSRP $25) - $20
Autumn Online Game (4 hrs via Roll20, max five players), Limit 4 (verify availability before pledging) - $40
Winter Online Game (4 hrs via Roll20, max five players), Limit 6 (verify availability before pledging) - $40
Legacy Playtest Kit (See Adventurer Legacy pledge tier for Legacy Playtest Kit description) - $25
Upgrade to Hard Cover (Inheritance or above, charge per upgraded book) - $35
Upgrade to Faux Leather (Inheritance or above, charge per upgraded book) - $50
Shipping for Stretch Goals/Add-ons - Varies depending upon exact selections, but ranges from moderate for US to it's-not-our-fault-crazy-expensive-are-you-sure-you-really-want-print for outside US. To minimize shipping headaches on our end, all shipping will be via flat rate post. Those outside the US are responsible for whatever customs charges are applicable upon receipt.
Stretch Goals
We have them! Do you want them? Alrighty! We'll at least give you some ideas. As the project gets underway, we'll add some snazzy graphics to relay them, but we'll start here. We have stretch goals for amounts of money raised, Legacy rewards being claimed, and social media buzz.
Money Raised - Unlocked goals result in add-ons available for purchase, more illustrations, additional pages, and more.
Legacy Rewards- When enough Legacy rewards are claimed, characters created through the Legacy Playtest will be gathered into Retribution: Legacy, a compendium of characters for use as NPCs and PCs. The more that are claimed, the more that happens.
Social Media Buzz - Campaigns are fueled by word of mouth. The more people who see it, the better the chance it has of success. The more we see this campaign talked about in forums, shared via Facebook, tweeted about, and otherwise tagged, the more we will throw in goodies for all backers, regardless of pledge level. Privacy settings may prevent us from knowing all Facebook shares and posts, but links posted in Comments and tagging Obatron Productions can help! One-shots, adventure seeds, fiction, and even issues of Savage Insider can be unlocked here. Back the project and spread the word with the hashtag #RetributionRPG to help unlock our Social Media Buzz stretch goals.
Special Thanks
Thanks to the many people who played Retribution games over the last two years! Your feedback helped us get to where we are.
It is with great appreciation we acknowledge Edward Douglas of Midnight Syndicate for allowing us the use of "Dark Legacy" from The Dead Matter: Cemetery Gates. Follow the link for more information about that and other CDs, many of which would work extremely well as background music as you play Retribution.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Obatron Productions has previously produced its debut RPG setting, Tunse’al (funded via Kickstarter), and multiple issues of Savage Insider, which is like an RPG book in many ways. We already have established writers, editors, illustrators, layout designers, and playtesters at our disposal. 

The single biggest risk to the project is a personal tragedy, which is unlikely, but – in the real world – possible. If something horrible should befall one or both co-owners, the project could fail to come to fruition. 

The next biggest and much less tragic risk is delay. Sometimes, despite our most valiant efforts to the contrary, circumstances beyond our control disrupt our schedules. We have estimated delivery times in good faith, but a delay in any part of the production chain can create a domino effect that pushes out other parts of the schedule. Something being one day late, can easily mean something else will then be four days late. 

In the event that there is a delay, we will keep this project updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you for your past support. We are delighted to announce that we have relaunched Retribution! We have introduced lower pricing, expanded stretch goals, additional add-ons, and have a great line-up of Savage Worlds licensees and freelancers for unlocked rewards.
Please visit our new project at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/939440728/retribution-rpg-setting-for-savage-worlds.

Visit our Facebook page at  and spread the word with #RetributionRPG, which goes toward social media goals.

Thanks once more for your support of Retribution. Unfortunately, we didn't get the traction we needed to get funded. As they say, if at first you don't succeed, try, try again. 
And so we will. After the holidays, we'll relaunch the project. The new plan is to offer Retribution again in February and run through March 11, which happens to be my (Vickey's) birthday. (Hmm...wonder how that date got in the mix! ;) )
In the meantime, we hope you will download the copy of Retribution: Wraith in the Wind that we sent a link for via Kickstarter messages and review it at DriveThruRPG, as well as comment at this project site about it and wherever else you may feel it's appropriate.

We've got just about a week left to raise what we need to get Retribution out sooner rather than later, and particularly as well-illustrated and supported as we'd like it to be. It won't be a small feat to pull that off, and we'd like to thank those who have backed us already as well as those who are coming in during these last days.
Starting tonight, we're sending out complimentary copies of an adventure we wrote for the season of strange that is autumn. Look out for for your DriveThruRPG code for Retribution: Wraith on the Wind for all current backers. New backers at Visage and higher will also get a comp code.

We've got a nice start to our project and are looking forward to the next 30 days. Thanks for being the first to back Retribution!
We're delighted to have some Legacy awards already pledged as characters produced via those levels will become canon to the world. With enough of them, we'll release Retribution: Legacy, which will be a stand-alone volume of pre-generated characters, allies, and extras including the submissions from those who are Legacy backers.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Rippers, a roleplaying game of gothic supernatural horror, where Victorian era monster hunters—the Rippers—fight the fearsome creatures of the night.
Battle not with monsters, lest ye become a monster, and if you gaze into the abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.
--Friedrich Nietzsche
Rippers fight the terrors of the night: werewolves, vampires, and other horrors that stalk the earth preying on humanity. These foul monsters boast superhuman strength and supernatural powers. The Rippers must use everything at their disposal to resist them. 
Some invest in the latest technology—incredible devices of iron and steel powered either by steam or, more recently, by electricity. Others practice ancient magic or perform holy miracles. A rare few bravely (or foolishly) wield arcane biotechnology “ripped” from the very creatures they hunt.
Whatever the methods, all are united in their dedication to protect mankind from the monsters that stalk the night. The Rippers’ struggle against evil rages on largely unknown to the wider world.
Rippers Then and Now
Pinnacle Entertainment Group first released Rippers in 2005, a setting book for the relatively new Savage Worlds game system. 
The first Plot Point Campaign saw the Rippers take on their archnemesis of old, Jack the Ripper, along with his Cabal cohorts, Dracula, Frankenstein, Prometheus, and more. At the end of that campaign, the Cabal was crushed, its leaders dead, and the Rippers triumphant. It is not necessary for your players to have completed that campaign (though if they have, great!). 
When the Rippers start their adventures in Rippers Resurrected, the Cabal will be the hunted and chased; hounded and hiding in the dark places of the world. The Return of Evil Plot Point Campaign also sets the Rippers against a new enemy: a small cult bent on restoring to power an ancient evil.
Books  
The Rippers Resurrected Kickstarter project funds an unholy host of new products, starting with two core books: the Player's Guide and the Game Master's Handbook. This game requires a copy of Savage Worlds core rules to play.
Rippers Resurrected Player's Guide has everything the player needs to create a hero: 
Rippers Factions 
New Hindrances and Edges 
New Derived Statistics: Reason and Status 
Gear, including rippertech! 
Setting Rules on Ripper Lodges, Reason, Status, and more 
Setting information on the Victorian era, and the hidden world of the Rippers
The Rippers Resurrected Game Master's Handbook contains:
Expanded world information, including secrets of the Cabal and threats facing the Rippers
Adventure Generator
Plot Point Campaign: Return of Evil
Savage Tales
Stat blocks for the forces of the Cabal and Return of Evil
Rippers Resurrected GM Screen with Lord of the Underworld adventure
When a famous explorer is found murdered by Cabal assassins, the Rippers must follow in his footsteps...deep into the terrifying and labyrinthine Underworld. In lightless deeps they struggle against the Cabal, and a greater terror than the world has ever known!
Matthew Cutter, known for his work with Deadlands and The Last Parsec, wrote this 32 page adventure for use with Rippers Resurrected.
The GM Screen is a tri-fold, landscape screen featuring gorgeous full-color artwork from Johnny Morrow on one side and all the important charts and tables for the game on the other.
Frightful Expeditions
Savage Tales and setting material for Rippers adventures in North America, Europe, Antarctica, South America, Asia, Australia, and Africa incorporating the adventures unlocked at earlier stretch goals...AND we'll send every print GM backer a free softcover copy! (Add on $5 to your pledge to upgrade to hardcover) To be clear, all backers of Digital Player level and higher will get the book in PDF as previously promised.
Art not final: a Draft Cover for Frightful Expeditions!
Maps
Savage Worlds doesn't require the use of combat maps—but most GMs love having them! The gothic horror of Rippers is ripe with settings for the imagination like Castle Dracula or Jack the Ripper's alleys.
These deluxe maps have a 1" grid just like all our other maps and are printed on both sides of high-quality, wet and dry erase (even permanent erase!) laminated stock.
Rippers Combat Map 1: Castle Dracula's Courtyard + Country House
Every Ripper hero wants a showdown at Castle Dracula! Begin—or end—your epic with this gothic courtyard! On the other side of the map is a quiet country gentleman's house...quiet, that is, until the howls over the moor grow steadily closer!
Rippers Combat Map 2: Urban Alleys + Ancient Tomb
Most every day a Ripper walks the streets tracking down the Cabal, cornering their threat in the alleys like Jack the Ripper! On the other side of the map is an ancient tomb, for most things who love the dark creep under the earth.
Check out these gorgeous maps from Deadlands Noir as an example of quality. Click on the image for a look at all our maps!
Rippers Map 3: The World of the Rippers!  
A new poster map of the globe suitable for hanging in your own lodge! Track your group's progress across the vast world, figure the distance between Kathmandu and Singapore, and plot the insidious rise of the Cabal!
All backers receive a PDF of this map for free, and the map is available as a print Add On for $15.
On the flip side is a Combat Map of a typical small lodge, with a parlor, library, small lab, and kitchen the team can use as their starter base. 
Each sturdy double-sided combat map (24” x 30”) is for Rippers Resurrected, Savage Worlds, or any roleplaying or miniatures game. It has a coating that is wet, dry, and permanent marker erasable. PDF maps of each side are included with each purchase of a map set from Pinnacle or this Kickstarter.
Dice
You asked for specialty dice, and we are your humble servants! This set of Rippers BLOOD DICE features black and red swirled dice with gold numbering on a d20, d12, d10, d8, d6, and d4.
A special d6—the Wild Die—has Mina's skull mask on the 6th side! 
Bennies 
Savage Worlds lets you play with destiny by using Bennies. These custom Rippers Resurrected Bennies let you play with destiny in style! 
This pack of twenty custom, high-quality, ceramic poker chips features five iconic designs from Rippers Resurrected. The reverse of each chip shows the Rippers Resurrected logo. 
Designed for use as Bennies for Savage Worlds, these custom poker chips could be used as counters or tokens for nearly any game. 
Twenty chips, 5 styles, 11.5 gram ABS composite casino-style poker chips.
Card design featuring the art of three-time Hugo award-winning artist Cheyenne Wright! (Work in Progress)
Two decks of 54 high-quality playing cards, featuring Rippers art on two different cardbacks.
 In each Kickstarter campaign, we are asked: which is the best deal? There it is, the $100 Everything Rippers Resurrected GM. This reward level gives you one of everything in the Rippers Resurrected Kickstarter except for the combat maps. (You may Add On to your pledge for the maps, see below.)
The PDFs of Rippers Resurrected Player's Guide, Rippers Resurrected GM's Handbook, GM Screen inserts, and the Lord of the Underworld adventure are far along in the development process and we anticipate delivering them as soon as the Kickstarter closes. The printed book will be here in April.
We deliver PDF materials through the Pinnacle website first and later through DriveThruRPG and RPGNow.
