To see some articles that we've been featured in, go to sensel.com/press.
The Sensel Morph offers a new generation of multi-touch interaction, powered by our patented Pressure Grid technology, in the form of an input device that allows people to interact with computers and programs in a whole new way.
With its high dynamic range of force sensitivity, The Morph can detect not just your fingers but any object, from a paintbrush to a drumstick.
The Morph works out of the box with many applications, and it’s also hackable for those more technically-inclined. You can connect it to your computer via USB, to your iPad via Bluetooth, or to your Arduino via developer cables.
Our mission from the start was to address the mismatch between the expressive capabilities of our hands and the restrictive interfaces of today’s devices. We want to enable new ways of interaction with digital devices and allow Morph users to unleash new possibilities in the worlds of music, art, gaming (cue Buzz Lightyear), and beyond!
Best of all, you can use the same device in each of these areas. People today have many hobbies and interests- isn't it time you have a device that literally "Morphs" with your activities?
You can use various Overlays, all which are automatically detected, for each supported use case. The Overlays are optional "physical apps" made of a thin, flexible layer that you can place over the device to provide a visual "map" and tactile feedback for each mode’s unique functionality. Imagine having your art tablet, music production controller, QWERTY keyboard, piano, video game controller (and anything else your mind can fathom) all in one device. If you can imagine something so limitless without your brain imploding, you've imagined the Sensel Morph.
Unlike your typical single-use input device, the Morph is an extremely versatile product. Here are some use cases that we’ll be supporting out of the box:
As time passes we’ll continue to add support for all of your favorite software. Don’t forget to let us know if you’d like the Morph to support a specific program.
Check out some video footage of people using the Morph! Watch Josh Ellingson digitally paint with real brushes, Adriano Clemente, the director of Dubspot Labs, create an original track, Ray Kampmeier control a robot arm, and Joshua Davis create responsive art!
The Sensel Morph comes to life through the use of various overlays - thin, magnetic, flexible, and fully customizable surfaces that turn the device into virtually any tool or instrument imaginable. As you may have already guessed, the name “Morph” came from the realization that each overlay allows the device to morph into a new physical, tactile interface. Using unique magnetic identification codes, the sensor automatically detects each overlay and makes switching modes completely seamless.
With each device that we ship, you’ll be able to choose three overlays out of eight options including: (1) a QWERTY keyboard, (2) music production controller, (3) piano, (4) drum-pad, (5) art overlay, (6) gaming overlay, (7) the innovator’s kit, and (8) one additional overlay which will be chosen by our Kickstarter backers via the Overlay Contest.
We’re developing a simple web-based drag-and-drop interface that will go live when the first batch of devices ship. With this interface, you will be able to design your own overlay without having to do any coding. You will then be able to print them on paper (for use with the Innovators Overlay), or 3D print the overlays yourself. Pretty cool, huh?
One of the most exciting things about Sensel - maybe even more exciting than the Morph itself - is the community we plan to build. Users will not only be able to create new, custom interfaces for themselves using the simple drag-and-drop interface, but they will be able to easily share these interfaces with the entire community of Sensel Morph owners and talk to one another about what they’re creating with the Morph.
After developing early prototypes, we partnered with frog, a world-class design firm, to turn our early concepts into a device that’s ready for consumers. We worked with frog to refine and test core use cases for the Morph. We ended up with a design that is both sleek and functional.
The size of the device is similar to an iPad, which was purposefully done to make the Morph and the overlays easily portable. We found that these dimensions are ideal for two-handed interactions with the device, as well as for many art and music applications. The size is also convenient if you want to use the Morph alongside a tablet.
One of our favorite things about the Morph is that you can combine multiple devices. Below is an example of how we extended our piano -- you can even put four Morphs together to create an instrument with 96 keys -- more than a grand piano!
Beneath the smooth outer surface of the device are approximately 20,000 individual sensor elements at a spacing of 1.25mm (that’s less than 1/16”). We call them “sensels” for short, hence the name of our company.
Unlike other touch technologies, which can only sense conductive objects, each of the sensor elements in our device senses pressure with a high dynamic range. These sensors allow us to capture a high-resolution image of the pressure applied to the device. Highly tuned algorithms on the device take these pressure images and turn them into a list of touch locations, each with their own force and shape information. This touch location data is then used to enable all the applications we’ve described above and is also accessible to developers through our API. Here is what the sensor sees when you interact with a finger, hand or paintbrush:

You may be asking yourself: How can Sensel possibly fit 20,000 individual sensors into a device this compact and why has this never been done before? The reason is that it required three major innovations and a whole lot of elbow grease to make this technology possible - innovations in materials, manufacturing, and electronics. Our team worked closely with a material scientist to custom-formulate a highly-tuned polymer layer which gives each individual sensor element the ability to sense force. This material enables the product to have high sensitivity and a high dynamic range. In other words, it can detect anything from a feather-light tap to a hard push and everything in between (with over 4,000 detectable voltage levels).
Next, we created a new structure that allowed us to take advantage of advanced lithographic manufacturing processes (similar to how circuit-boards and semiconductors are built). In contrast, most force-sensing arrays available on the market today are screen printed (typically on a Mylar™ film), and thus cannot achieve high resolution or consistency, in comparison to Sensel’s process. This process allows us to create a very high resolution array of sensor elements on the same circuit board as the rest of our electronics, hence the 20,000 individual sensor elements.

Every sensor needs electronics to power it, read out signals and interpret those signals. The third major innovation is a new, patented electrical drive scheme and electrical circuitry that allows us to read this high-resolution sensor with commonly available electronic components, quickly and efficiently. This allows us to drive an exceptionally high-resolution sensor at high speed (>125 Hz), low latency (< 8 ms), and low power consumption at an affordable price point. We’ve also thrown in some extras like an accelerometer, LEDs, and Bluetooth LE support (along with a rechargeable battery) for those of you who can’t stand wires.
We also worked with expert mechanical engineers at Hive Design to design an aluminum housing for the Morph which is thin and lightweight, yet provides rigidity (necessary for when you’re really jamming on your device). It also holds the magnets which are used for overlay attachment and looks beautiful alongside your other devices.
We've received questions from our backers about things like compatibility with various art software (such as Photoshop), what it's like to perform music on the morph (in terms of sensitivity and ability to pitch-bend), and about what kind of objects the Morph can pick up. Here are a couple of video responses we've put together to answer some of these questions:
Kickstarter is a place where we know we’ll find people who are always on the lookout for the next big thing, and we think we just might have it. We're excited to see what you do with the Morph with the use-cases we've developed so far, but we're even more excited to see what you come up with on your own. The moment of inexplicable excitement we experience when we see someone create a new tune, new piece of art, new game, new controller, or (best of all) something we'd never have imagined with our technology -- that's why we chose the Kickstarter Community.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are many risks associated with bringing a brand new technology to market, and we understand the challenges that lie ahead of us. The Sensel founders have nearly 20 years combined experience in developing various force-sensing solutions/products, and we’ve designed our Pressure Grid technology with manufacturing in mind from day one. We use all standard manufacturing processes to make sure that production goes as smoothly as possible, and we’ve already completed several builds of the device to fine-tune the design and manufacturing process.

However, when building any hardware device, unexpected issues may pop up (manufacturing, sourcing, shipping, etc). We’ve had experience dealing with these types of challenges in our past work. In addition, we have an amazing group of advisors supporting us, many of whom have shipped Kickstarter projects before.

We believe in being completely transparent, and promise to keep backers updated on our progress every step of the way. We’ll alert backers if we run into unexpected hurdles, and likewise announce when we’ve achieved any major development milestones. As a backer, you’ll get a full behind-the-scenes view into how we’re progressing here at Sensel as we start production of the Morph.

campaign.story:
A holy warrior fighting back infernal beasts on the precipice of a fiery pit. Cloaked figures chanting an incantation to bring forth a nameless beast. A man standing at a crossroads bartering with a demonic temptress for fame and fortune; the price of which is his very soul.
Advisers to kings and queens, dictators and presidents, whispering lies at the behest of their demon lords with the fate of nations resting on whether or not the advice is heeded. A scientist examining a strange artifact found on a distant planet that, unbeknownst to him, opens a mysterious gate to a nightmarish dimension when a button is pushed.
These are just a sampling of the myriad images which come to mind when we think of Hell. Codex Infernus: The Savage Guide to Hell, brings those images to life and shows you how to plug them into your games, regardless of what genre you love to play!
The goal of Codex Infernus is to produce a combination setting book and Toolkit. The fantasy campaign setting (Covenant) is written to highlight all of the new rules, magic items, and character concepts you'll find in this tome! While we think this is a killer setting in it's own right, Covenant is a model which gives you examples of how you can use everything in this book in your game!

The meat of the book, however, are the rules. They are modular so you can "drag and drop" what you wish into your own campaign, and leave the rest out!  Codex Infernus gives you everything you need to design a Hell that caters to your specific group, because the concepts and rules we introduce in this book transcend genre, encouraging you to explore new possibilities for your Savage Worlds game.
But let's get into specifics.
In this book you'll find:
Ready-to-play character archetypes for a variety of genres.
New Fantasy races
New Demonic races
New Edges and Arcane Backgrounds
New magic items and relics of power
An immersive Fantasy campaign setting
Guidelines for using the book in a variety of genres
Rules for demonic pacts, demonic possession, and an optional corruption system
Rules for playing immortal characters!
Oh, didn't we mention demons? Yeah, we have you covered there as well. Some of You will even get to make your own!
 Check out a few of the stretch goals we have planned! If you want to see something for a stretch goal let us know!
 Sample Bennie and Card Images
Check out these awesome samples of our Bennies, and Cards!
Add-Ons! 
The following Add-Ons are currently available. as this kickstarter progresses, we'll be adding more, so keep checking!
Bennies: You can get a pack of 10 bennies for an extra 10.00, or a pack of 20 for a discounted price of 15.00! Please add the extra funds to your kickstarter pledge!
Cards: You can get an extra deck of cards for 15.00! Please add the extra funds to your kickstarter pledge!
Soft Cover book: You can get an additional soft cover book for 20.00. Please add the extra funds to your kickstarter pledge!
Hard Cover book: You can grab an extra copy of the hard cover book for 25.00! Please add the extra funds to your kickstarter pledge!
We're excited to be partnering with DriveThruRPG to deliver all of the electronic files for this Kickstarter! DriveThruRPG makes it easy for us to set up mailing lists and get you all of your digital content with absolutely zero problems.
Be sure that you have an account on DriveThruRPG and use the correct email in the survey after this project funds to ensure we'll be sending your download links to your account!
Shipping Costs
As things currently stand, shipping costs can kill a Kickstarter campaign. Kickstarter has not yet found a way to separate the funds that actually go towards the money we need to raise, and the shipping costs needed to send out the finished product.
The result from this oversight, is an artificially inflated “total” amount of money raised. So with all that in mind, for this campaign we'll be billing for the shipping costs after the campaign is over, via the BackerKit pledge management service. This charge is in addition to whatever you pledge here. See below for our estimates of costs.
EXPECTED SHIPPING COSTS (Based on estimated 3lb package) These estimates reflect the maximum we'll charge for shipping. We will not hit you with a surprise increase beyond these amounts; setting expectations here is key!
In the USA: +$6. No additional charge for additional items in the same shipment.
Canada & Mexico: +$25. +$10 per additional copy beyond the first. (This is a few dollars lower than actual cost for an International Priority shipment, or right at the mark for First Class International if the package falls within the weight limits that allow that rate.)
UK: +$15. +$10 per additional copy beyond the first.
Europe: +$25. +$10 per additional copy beyond the first.
Anywhere else in the world: +$30. +$10 per additional copy beyond the first. (This is a few dollars lower than the actual cost of International Priority Mail as quoted to us. Much depends on the actual shipping weight calculations, once we can make them.)
For international shipments, our shippers will do what they can to mark the customs forms in the most favorable, legal way, although, this is subject to human error and other constraints.
While we will do our best to figure out ways to reduce shipping costs, there's no guarantee we'll manage it — so please include these shipping estimates in your budget! Thanks!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As someone who has been publishing role-playing game supplements since 2005, I can attest to the fact that things don't always go as planned. Writers and artists pull out of projects, or turn in manuscripts and illustrations late. Editing and revisions sometimes take longer than anticipated. The proofs for books come back from the printer with errors that need to be fixed.
These things can happen. It's a part of the publishing business. But I've been around the block, and I know that a large part of dealing with issues like the ones I mentioned above is communication.
I have regular conversations with everyone involved in this process to ensure that I know things are progressing the way they should be, and if they aren't, I roll up my sleeves and work with my team to find the best solution to a problem before it gets out of hand.
As a backer, you'll receive regular status reports from me about this project. If I do happen to run into issues that might delay this project, you'll be the first to know it.

My last kickstarter, Interface Zero 2.0, was a great success. I’ve delivered the core book, bennies, dice, the card deck, four adventures, figure flats, a map, two source books (in PDF format), and am working steadily on everything else.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Because of the demand, we are making custom tokens for other games and roles in Werewolf, Mafia and One Night Werewolf.
Examples include: Troublemaker, Insomniac, Mason, Vampire, Detective, Sheriff, Doctor, Ghost, Little girl, Cupid, etc.

If you can't use Kickstarter and want to purchase the game, you can order them directly through paypal!
Werewolf the game
Mafia was created by Dimitry Davidoff in 1986.  Andrew Plotkin made a Werewolf adaptation in the 1990's which has since turned into the #1 party game.
Werewolf is a game of deduction, lies and bluffing, which there are two teams: Villagers and Werewolves. The Villagers don’t know who the Werewolves are, and the Werewolves are trying to remain hidden while they slowly eliminate the Villagers one at a time.
The game is incredibly simple, I've taught 5 year olds and 90 year olds (both of which you should not underestimate!).  Each player gets a token which shows their role, while one of the players acts as a moderator to keep the game running smoothly. Each day and night, the number of players gets smaller and smaller until either all the werewolves are voted out, giving the victory to the village team, or the werewolves equal (or exceed) the number of villagers, allowing the werewolf team to win.
It is very customizable and allows you to add different roles into the game to change it up, and because you are playing with people, no two games are ever the same!
Why Werewolf Tokens?
I've been playing werewolf for 6 years and played many versions.  I'm a true aficionado, but one thing that I didn't like about other versions was quality and versatility.  Playing cards get damaged, wonky art and not easy to play with outside.  One day I used a wood-burning tool and made a set of chips.  We put them in a bag and took them camping.  They were a hit.  People asked me where to get a copy, and that's where it all started.
 We went through 10 iterations until we got what we like.  What's great is that this is a very simple game to learn, you can never truly master it and it's customizable with many different roles!
Now you can play Werewolf Tokens (I play them at all these places)
Family get-togethers
Holidays
Birthday parties
BBQs
Camping
Comic conventions
team-building at work
school
weekly game meetings
anytime there's more than 5 people!
All American Made.  Local businesses used for production. No overseas manufacturers.  I'm making each set myself with love!
Standard tokens
 I wanted to use solid pieces of wood, not plywood and at 1/4 inch.  We found that 1.5 inches was the perfect size, not to small, has good weight and you can put it in your pocket.  Each token is treated with Danish Oil that acts as a sealer and gives some water resistance.
 Premium tokens
 I wanted to make something special for those who wanted a higher quality token with a more refined look.  These tokens are stained and filled with wood filler that gives a higher contrast and semi-smooth feel.  Each token are treated with Danish Oil and Polyurethane sealer to give a satin finish. 
This is where you can get crazy and customize your game set.  In addition to the standard 20 tokens that the game comes with you can ask to receive additional tokens of the kind we make, blank tokens or even have a new token custom-made, (For instance if your werewolf group loves to play with the Sorcerer)
 You can come up with whatever Custom-ed piece you want to make.  Anything your heart desires, from Little Girl, Vampire, Ghost, Mason, etc.

Risks and challenges
I have run many iterations and prototypes of the Werewolf Tokens. I believe we have it down to a science now. If our production numbers become too great, I am poised to enlist the aid of other manufacturers to help with production times. 

I am committed to bringing quality and making sure all the backers are pleased with their products.

campaign.story:
The Super Villain Handbook is a resource for the ICONS Assembled Role Playing Game to help GMs craft super villains that feel larger than life and which threaten your heroes. Written by Dr. Jason Tondro and produced by Fainting Goat Games, this book is a treasure trove of knowledge for anyone looking to delve deep into the world of super evil.
Artists for the Project include:
Joe Singleton [http://joe-singleton.deviantart.com/] Artist, writer, plotter (evil and general), Defender of Liberty, Holder of Secrets, and Keeper of the Eraser of Doom!
Dionysia Jones [http://dionysiajones.deviantart.com/] I have done interior art and cover illustrations for published RPG books such as Earthdawn, various Mutants & Masterminds supplements, and was the lead artist for Tianxia.
Jacob Blackmon [http://prodigyduck.deviantart.com/]  I draw and I play role-playing games.
Joe Arnold - Has worked for Jeff Dee on Cave Master
It's true, super villains are a secretive lot. Other than the occasional slip of megalomania during world domination broadcasts, most super villains keep the essence of who they are and what they do under tight wraps. Dr. Comics (That would be Dr Tondro... Shh. It's a secret) has tapped every informant, minion, and ex-villainous love interest he could get his hooks into to divulge the secrets of what makes a super villain tick. For matters of security, we cannot reveal his sources. The only verifiable source is his comics dealer (who has since gone missing).
The Super Villain Handbook covers forty archetypes for various super villains that one might encounter throughout comics. While the book was created with ICONS in mind, there are many reasons that this is an essential resource for GMs of any superhero game. 
The book classifies super villains not by what they can do (for example, "control magnetism") but by their role in the story ("I must make the world safe for my people!"). In such roles, we see everything from the lowly Crime Boss to the Cosmic Menace. This allows villains of all types and power sets to fill different roles at the table without coming across as poorly re-skinned clones.
Each of the 40 roles also includes game stats for a sample villain in the ICONS rpg. For powerful villains with roles that are more plot device than punching bag, Jason... Er, I mean, Dr. Comics... has added cosmic power levels to the ICONS experience. These levels let the aspiring GM have a benchmark so his heroes can try and punch the hurricane (or other “unstoppable force” ) into submission.
Each role is a study in evil that gives a GM the tools to construct the villains their heroes were meant to fight. Archetypes start with a quote from a famous character in comics that has filled that role. As you dig deeper into the villain, you discover what makes them tick. This includes classic examples of the role, which roles are related, and even story and plot ideas that the villain usually operates in. From the Assassin to the Wolf in Sheep's Clothing, the archetypes in this book constitute an essential reference to new and old GM's alike.  
Kickstarter is an excellent way to connect with potential fans as well as to distribute coded subliminal messages which activate Sleeper Minions. The basic book is complete. It contains the 40 illustrated archetypes as well as useful tools to expand your evil. Unfortunately, our original minions rage quit after being beaten up one too many times and took our cover.  
With your help, we can push the book into lofty new heights of evil. The basic Goal is to fund the book for both an ICONS Assembled and SUPERS! Revised edition. At 3,200, Jason will turn his mind control probe on Ross Payton (Base Raiders RPG), to publish a FATE Core version of the game. 3,800 dollars will see a deluxe version of the book for ICONS where we will see 40 unique villains added to the book, doubling its size. At 4,500, Jason will once again turn on the probe and, if he doesn't fry Walt's brain, we will see a deluxe version for the SUPERS! Rpg as well.  5,000 sees the Deluxe Book get the FATE Core Treatment.
Pledge tiers have been carefully constructed by our team of (kidnapped) scientists to maximize your kickstarter and project experience. Pledges of even a single dollar, immediately get the un-illustrated version of the book. At ten dollars, you get immediate access to the illustrated document as well as any stretch goals that are greenlit. Higher tiers can grab custom characters, games run by Dr. Comics, Jason Tondro, as well as even having a character of your design appear in the book. Please check the side for all tier info. 
One of the greatest things about this project (aside from the fact that super villains everywhere haven't trained their destruct-o-rays on us yet) is that Jason is crafting a YOUniverse instead of a Universe. A comic book universe usually consists of characters and a world owned by a single company. Dr. Comics is looking to move away from that. The YOUniverse is crafted so that all of the characters funded through the Kickstarter will be released to the public domain, side by side with characters that are already there. In short, the YOUniverse belongs to you!
 From Steve Kenson (of Green Ronin and Ad Infinitum Adventures): Villains are a mainstay of superhero games: Who is going to challenge the heroes from week-to-week if not a reliable rogues gallery of villains? The Supervillain Handbook gives you enough ideas and archetypes for endless game-play and its discussion of classic villain archetypes is useful for all superhero games, beyond just Icons Superpowered Roleplaying. If superhero roleplaying games are your thing, then you want this book!
From Chuck Rice of Mayfair Games (and previously of Vigilance Press and RPGObjects) Jason Tondro continues his amazing work of mixing a scholar's look at comics with great, ready-made NPCs for your ICONs games. This is his best work to date, focusing on the villains that oppose your plucky heroes. Every page is full of plot hooks and character ideas. This book will serve as a tremendous Game Master's reference through countless campaigns.
The BAMF Podcast hosts Jason and a round table of Villainous experts as we talk up things like the Super Villain Handbook

campaign.story:
Kickstarter Campaign
Ever wanted to run a old west campaign? Do you love the grit of the wild west and the pioneering spirit of those folks that left everything behind and went west to seek their fortune?
Maybe your campaign is a straightforward historic adventure with outlaws, Native Americans and simple townsfolk all struggling for survival. Maybe you've opted for a world where the creatures of nightmares exist and magic isn't just a thing of legend. Perhaps you've moved away from both of these settings into the present and the lure of a haunted old west ghost town.
Just like a good play or movie, a story needs a great set to make it come alive. That is where we come in. This Kickstarter will give you what you need to help make your vision come alive on the tabletop. The Kickstarter is for floor plans of several iconic old west structures: Settler's Cabin, Hotel/Saloon, General Store, Church W/Cemetery, Sheriff's Office and a Livery Stable.
In addition, several great game companies/authors are providing product to anyone that pledges $25 or more:
Warning Label is providing .PDFs of two decks of their Casts of Cards (Wild West Archetypes and Boomtown-not yet released). This will provide you with over two dozen pregenerated characters for Savage Worlds complete with stats and backgrounds.
Sometimes finding high quality western minis can be a challenge for GMs, so Arion Games is providing .PDFs containing over 100 old west figure flats!
Ambient Environments is providing 4 amazing soundtracks (Wild West Showdown, Old Western Town, Old Western Saloon and Reckoning). These add another amazing dimension to the game when played at the table.
Darren Miller (Author-Canned Food) will create an adventure using the wild west floor plans from the campaign.
For more info on any of these products or companies, please click on the image.
Stretch Goals
Instead of providing additional products from outside sources, we have decided to focus the stretch goals on expanding the number of building floor plans that we create for the campaign. In essence, the more support that we get, the bigger the town grows.
For every $250 above our funding goal, we will add one new building:
$3250-School House
$3500-Undertaker's Office
$3750-Bank
$4000-Doctor's Office /Home
$4250-Train Station/Telegraph Office
$4500-Streetscape
$4750-Barber
$5000-Court House
$5250-Mayor's House
$5500-Old West Train
I have some ideas for things beyond these as well. If you see a pledge tier that needs to be added or have suggestions for structures that need to be created as a part of the campaign, we are always open to suggestions.
About Our Maps
These maps will have all of the features that you have come to know and love from all Fabled Environments products:
-Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5" x 11" map as a guide.
-Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use the 24" x 36"/ 36" x 48"  full scale maps (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper using the functionality of Adobe X or higher and assemble it yourself in a matter of minutes.
-In addition, multiple layers, such as labels and furniture,  can be turned on or off using the layers feature. Separate layers containing  a 5' square and 5" hex grid will also be provided with every floor plan produced by the campaign.
All of our floorplans are rendered in black and white and are created by a professional architectural drafter/interior designer using AutoCAD. This gives all of our maps the realistic feel that your players crave.
For some examples of our previous maps, feel free to watch the YouTube video above, go to our store on DriveThruRPG.com, check out our previous successful Kickstarter campaign or take a look at our web page.

Heroes, villains, legends … the folklore of America features all of this and more. In this volume you will find pirates and soldiers, lumberjacks and steel drivers, mountain men and lawmen, cowboys, Indians, inventors, and eccentrics. All of whom are just waiting to be included in your roleplaying game campaign! And don’t let the time period fool you, just because these characters existed in the 18th and 19th Centuries, doesn't mean you can’t use them in your pulp, superhero, fantasy, or even science fiction campaigns! After all, these characters are Larger Than Life!
"So, Paul Bunyan, John Henry, Pecos Bill, Davy Crockett, and Annie Oakley walk into a bar..."
"Sure, that's impressive, but let me tell you about that time that I..."
Larger Than Life features 20 archetypes, ranging from Blackbeard the Pirate to the man who invented the 20th Century: Nikola Tesla. In addition, there are a total of 24 full character sheets, each with a detailed history and description of the character in question. But that’s not all! You also get over 124 biographies of other people related to each archetype, as well as six famous ocean-going ships, famous outlaw gangs, Paul Bunyan’s entire logging gang, and innumerable other historical tidbits. Each archetype also comes with at least one template, allowing you to build your own version of that archetype. So what are you waiting for? Dive in and start discovering those tidbits of American history you never new existed. But watch your step, because after all, these characters are… Larger Than Life!
This groundbreaking 240 page, black-and-white paperback book was previously printed in an extremely limited ashcan edition of two dozen copies at GenCon 2014 for the Hero System. Due to popular demand, Blackwyrm Publishing is dedicated to releasing three new editions: one for Savage Worlds (book dimensions 9.61 x 6.69), one for Mutants & Masterminds (9.69 x 7.44), and another new edition for Hero System (11 x 8.5). With new artwork, new layout, and new systems, your campaign can be larger than ever!
We encourage you to support this project at whatever level is comfortable for you. You can also pledge more than the tier requires if you're extra-excited and would like to help out more. All reward levels include our thanks in the credits of the book. And if money's tight, spreading news of the Kickstarter is also a way to help, and much appreciated. 
Our estimated delivery date is: July 15th, 2015.
Our staff will be as follows:
Author: Michael Surbrook

Layout: Ruben Smith-Zempel
System Conversions: Greg Elkins

campaign.story:
Geek Out Games will be a world class gaming destination that caters to geeks. While we have a generous start up budget, it is being stretched to its limits building out the massive 3,520 square foot slice of geeky paradise we are leasing.
We want to build amazing, durable, easy to play on wargaming tables. Sure, we could just slap a piece of plywood on top of a rickety fold out table, but that’s not what we’re about. A wargaming table built to satisfy the needs of the avid wargamer requires a lot of thought and a lot of lumber. Each table will cost at least $100 in wood alone, but it’s worth it. Extra storage space built in to the table will keep people from tripping over their army storage cases. A 2’ deployment section for Games Workshop games will make deploying (and burying) little dudes much more convenient. An 8’ long table also makes it perfect for running two Warmachine / Hordes battles on the same table. Don’t worry; there will still be plenty of storage space on three different shelves for Warma-Hordes players.
We want our players to be comfortable during their board game, role playing, and collectible card game (CCG) sessions. We could buy a fleet of solid metal folding chairs and pack everyone in like sardines, but again, that’s not what we’re about. Our restaurant style booths will allow our tabletop and wargaming customers a luxurious space to play for hours. We’re going to buy steel chairs for our CCG players, but they’re going to have thick padding on the seat and back of the chairs. No one wants to sit on cold steel for hours.
At Geek Out Games we view these luxuries as essential to the store, not something we will trickle in over the next five years. When we first open our doors in April, we want the jaw to drop on the very first geek that walks into our store. They will understand that this store understands them, appreciates them, and adores them; because we do.
Thank you for your support and contribution. Together we can make an amazing space for geeks to get their game on!
Announcing 3 new reward tiers!
$30 - Solid metal d20!
The BEAST next to its baby bro.
$40 - 5 pack of solid metal d6's!
5 solid metal d6

Stretch Goal: $1,500 - Achieved!
First, a huge thank you to all of our supporters! We reached our initial modest goal in near record time. It’s amazing. You’re amazing. Thank you. We at Geek Out Games were concerned that $1,000 was unobtainable and that our campaign would fail after 30 brutal days of begging and groveling. You proved us wrong. We’re incredibly grateful. Thank you.
The optimist in us (that was beaten down by dread when we started and is now dancing for joy) had planned on unlocking a spinning dice pen if we reached $1,500 in total money pledged. This pen is crazy good and we’ve only found it through one supplier. That means that it’s also pretty rare, as far as promotional items go. If we’re going to order pens, there is nothing more geeky than having a six-sided dice spinning on the top of the pen. Of course we’ll have our logo on it as humongous as possible, and we want to share that geeky glory with all of our supporters.
If we hit our stretch goal of $1,500 we will order a heap of these pens and include them in every tier that has stuff mailed out to the backer. That’s pretty much every tier since even our adopt-a-booth and adopt-a-table tiers come with a SWAG Pack.
Thank you again for all of your support and we cannot wait to open up our store so that we can show it off to our amazing supporters! Stay tuned for more information as we get the build-out rolling full steam in the next couple of weeks! The transformation from vacant cave into a boutique style gaming store will be incredible.
Stretch Goal 2: $2,500 - Achieved!
First, let me just say that you guys are amazing. You've blown away my expectations and humbled me beyond words; and that's hard to do. I usually have a ton to say but all I can find myself doing recently is blubbering about the best supporters in the world.
It took me a while to find another SWAG item worthy of you guys, but I finally found it. Wargammers need a good tape measure that is small enough to carry around but long enough to measure across the table. Heck, we could all use another tape measure around the house too.
If we hit our SECOND stretch goal (amazing!) we'll throw in a carabiner tape measure with our beloved logo to everyone that gets a piece of SWAG already. This is in addition to the spinning dice pen y'all have already unlocked!
Carabiner Tape Measure
Stretch Goal 3: $4,000
We’ve already achieved 250% of our initial goal and we’re only half-way done with the Kickstarter! So what can I possibly want another fifteen hundred smackers for? 
Here is what what the stretch goal cash will go towards: Inventory.
Stocking a new store from scratch is blasphemously expensive. While the additional funds raised will go to increasing inventory in general, here is an idea of how those costs can skyrocket. We'll look at just stocking 16 different t-shirts as en example
I want to build a rotating t-shirt display that will hold 16 different t-shirts, 4 per side. You’ve probably seen them. There is a t-shirt on display and then next to it is a little cubby that holds the product you can pick up and take to the register. The display cabinet is not very expensive (my contractor is awesome and will build it for me). But the product inside of it adds up very quickly. 
In order to have enough sizes to fit the variously shaped geeks that may want a shirt, and to meet minimum order requirements from suppliers, I will need to carry about 30 of each shirt. At $10 a pop, that’s $300 per shirt. To fill my awesome, custom built t-shirt display rack, I need to buy $4,800 worth of t-shirts. 
That’s four thousand eight hundred dollars in t-shirts alone. Now, that’s nearly $10,000 worth of product at retail value and will greatly help our store break even and maybe even turn a profit way before I expect to. You can’t make money without having inventory. But that is an awful lot of money up front for a start up on a budget. That also doesn’t take into account the “core” products I need to buy; you know, the games that our game store needs to live up to its moniker. 
Hence the new stretch goal at $4,000 in hopes of off-setting the cost of the initial inventory purchase. I have no idea if we can reach that goal or not, but I’m going to shamelessly squeeze you guys in the attempt. 
We’ll be offering a blue baseball hat with GEEK OUT GAMES proudly emblazoned on it and the word Supporter across the back (right above the little pony-tail hole) at $50 donation. This will be the only way to get the hat (hence the squeezing part). I could put it in the SWAG pack contribution level, but then I wouldn’t be squeezing you guys very hard, would I?
What is a stretch goal without offering a big juicy carrot for those that shell out their hard earned cash to make it happen? A lame one, that's what. Geek Out Games isn't lame so here's what we'll offer everyone that contributed at any level once the stretch goal is met:
PICK ANY SWAG ITEM in addition to what you're already getting and we'll throw it in your care package. Want an extra mug? Done! have a thing for hats and want two? Done! Want an extra logo dice bag with matching dice to give to a fellow geek as a present? Done! Seriously, you can pick anything that we're offering and we'll gladly add it to your SWAG shipment. 
For those of you that have generously offered a donation without selecting a reward, please let us send you something. Just pick it and we'll ship it. We'll send you an email when the KS ends asking what you want and we'll be honored to send it to you.
It's the least we can do for turning our modest $1,000 goal into an amazing $4,000 triumph!

campaign.story:
Stone stalks the High Plains seeking heroes to kill. The Cackler hunts the Weird West in search of a mysterious girl called Rachel. Both of these killers are stone-cold dead...Harrowed...and what they're about to do kicks off the next era in the story of Deadlands!
Join us for a walk on the DEAD SIDE as we create two very different but linked projects that start us on the road for the 20th anniversary of Deadlands coming in 2016.
This page is for the Cackler Graphic Novel ... for more information on the Stone and a Hard Place Plot Point Campaign Kickstarter, click here!
Check out our loco SIMULTANEOUS Dead Men Walking Kickstarters!
The Wicked West
The Cackler is an ancient Harrowed in search of a very particular blood relative for a nefarious and mysterious ritual that could change the world of Deadlands forever!
A sample panel from the opening pages...somewhere in the arid Southwest.
The Texas Rangers and Agency have invoked the "Twilight Protocol" to unite against the Cackler and are doing everything they can to stop him. They're joined by Morgan Lash—a former Wichita Witch who's shed her dark past to protect the girl the Cackler searches for—her sister!
The Cackler and his lieutenants doing the devil's business...
Think you can figure out the Cackler's secret identity before you get to the end of the tale? We've been putting the clues out there for 20 years, amigo! (The most concise clues are in The Black Circle book for the original Deadlands Classic, by the way, but everything is retold right here in the graphic novel as well.)
What You're Funding & Delivery Dates
We're making both the print and digital versions of The Cackler. Each digital issue of the 4-issue series will be released as it's finished and should be out by May, and the hardback, full-color, collected print version should be in your hands by September.
The print version also includes the bonus game information and the illustrated story Dead Men Talking as well. We'll eventually release those as digital downloads, but they'll appear in the print version of the hardback first.
Digital Fulfilllment
You'll get your digital files through the Pinnacle site, Comics+ / iVerse, and DriveThruComics.com :)
The Twisted Team
Shane Hensley wrote the Cackler's long-awaited tale, and it was edited and kicked in the rear by C. Edward Sellner of Visionary Comics and Deadlands Brand Manager Matthew Cutter.
Art for this tale of Weird Western woe is by the legendary Bart Sears, one of the true masters of the medium. He's worked for EVERY major comic publisher, from Marvel to DC, Valiant to Crossgen. Colors are by the amazing Michael Atiyeh, who includes DC, Dark Horse, and Star Wars credits to his name!
Check out Bart's site HERE, and Michael's DeviantArt Page HERE.
If you haven't read the original one-shots, you can check out a preview of the issue these two hombres collaborated on before, Death Was Silent, one of our most popular initial stories. You can also check out previews of other Deadlands comics on Visionary's Deadlands Page! And get a gander at the initial pages for Cackler below!
A collection of Visionary's Deadlands Comics!
New to Deadlands? No problemo, amigo! The Cackler is the perfect way to jump into the Weird West!
Sneak Peeks!
We'll be showing you previews of the pages as they're turned in by the art team, including notes and other adjustments so you can see "behind the curtain" into the creative process!
The sinister cover and collector's print...by Bad Bart Sears!
Bart "Story Tellin'" Sears sets the mood right from the opening page!
For Deadlands RPG Fans
Besides setting up key events that affect the 20th anniversary of the Weird West, the Cackler graphic novel also includes Deadlands Reloaded statistics for the Cackler and his creepy lieutenants you can use in YOUR game!
Don't bother trying to read the fine print, friend. The Cackler's secrets are locked up inside the graphic novel. Nice try though! ;)
Want to Be Part of the Story?
The Cackler graphic novel also includes the illustrated short story of the day the Cackler met Stone, the town that suffered their wrath, and the deaths of those stubborn few who tried to save it!
This terrible tale of High Plains horror is called Dead Men Talking, and YOUR CHARACTER can be a part of it! Check out the Deader, Harrowed, and Aces Reward levels if you'd like your character to be one of the undead things who accompany Stone or the mysterious Cackler, or one of those unfortunate souls they blast into oblivion for getting in their way! Check it fast though—coffins are limited!
You can model a character after yourself, a loved one (with their permission), or a character from your own Deadlands campaign! Just realize they aren't likely to survive. ;)
(Obligatory Disclaimer: If we can't come up with something that makes sense in the context of the story, we'll give you the Cackler (Print) Reward level and refund you the difference.)
Stretch Goals
$23,000 — The Cackler Wallpapers (UNLOCKED!): Everyone gets a selection of gorgeous digital wallpapers created from The Cackler graphic novel, for your desktop, phone, and tablet!
$25,000 — The Cackler Doomtown Card (UNLOCKED!): A special, EXCLUSIVE card for Alderac Entertainment's amazing Doomtown card game featuring THE CACKLER! Every PRINT order receives TWO of these cards--one for keepin' and one for playin'!
We're making an EXCLUSIVE Cackler card for the Doomtown Living Card Game, created by the Doomtown designers themselves!
$30,000 — The Cackler Print (UNLOCKED!): Every physical order gets an exclusive PRINT of the Cackler cover, suitable for framing! 
$35,000 — The Art of the Weird West (UNLOCKED!): An additional 16-page section featuring a few of the original defining pieces of Deadlands art with the stories behind them, as well as brand new visions by top artists such as Bart Sears, Cheyenne Wright, Bien Flores, and more!
Add Ons
We'll set up the Add Ons after the Kickstarter via an external pledge manager. We'll include the Raven graphic novel and anything else from the Visionary store they have left in stock (inventory is getting a bit low on quite a few of their Deadlands offerings!). That keeps things nice and simple here since Kickstarter doesn't offer an easy way to track Add Ons, and still allows you to add items to your order to save on postage once we're about to ship.
For other Deadlands comics, if you go RIGHT NOW you might still be able to pre-order our first Deadlands comics collection, Dead Man's Hand, coming from IDW. Just download our pre-order form here, then print and take it to your local comic shop. If you want the Raven graphic novel, just select the $75 Visionary reward level, which includes a full digital and print version of the Servitor of War's five issue series by Matthew Cutter, C. Edward Sellner, and Greg LaRocque collected in one volume.
Dead Man's Hand Cover from IDW and Raven Cover
And if you want the digital versions right now, just head over to the Visionary website!
The Visionary Playing Card Decks
Visionary's Dead Man's Hand and Raven Custom Playing Cards!
Visionary also created high-quality, custom playing cards for both Dead Man's Hand and Raven, featuring art on the decks from the respective comics, which have proven to be immensely popular. The Dead Man's Hand deck features cover art on face cards, and Raven features the various characters of the series. You'll get one set of each when you pledge at the $75 reward level or above.
Original Art and a True One-of-a-Kind
We've also added two reward levels for the art collectors in the crowd. Pledge at the Art Collector $400 level and get all the graphic novel goodies, including a page of original Bart Sears art, chosen from the interior of the book (earliest backers choose first). 
One quick-on-the-draw soul can also back the Aces level, which gets you in the Dead Men Talking story, a full-color print of the cover, AND the original cover art itself, all signed by the creators!
Why Kickstarter?
Pinnacle is known for some great games and we're very proud of that. Our partnership with Visionary Comics to produce the comics has resulted in some great titles to date. But we want to take things to the next level with this effort and produce a title that has sweeping and major changes for the world of Deadlands.
Our efforts here are not only vital to producing more fantastic comics, but help pave the way for other opportunities, such as the excellent upcoming novel series from Tor Books, spearheaded by Visionary. It also helps our continued efforts to make Deadlands a great computer or video game, live action show, and/or feature film.
Producing a graphic novel—especially with the kind of top talent and high production values we hold ourselves to—is expensive and very risky in a field dominated by such power players as Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, IDW, and others we're huge fans of. We've got the story, Visionary has the skills to make it happen, and now we need YOUR HELP to bring it together!

Risks and challenges
Both Pinnacle Entertainment Group and Visionary Comics are old hands at fulfilling Kickstarter projects—check our previous Kickstarters to see for yourself. Pinnacle's award-winning Deadlands line includes more than 100 products over its almost-20-year history, and Visionary has produced multiple titles, including previous Deadlands comics Raven, One Shot originals, and Dead Man's Hand. The artists attached, Bart Sears and Michael Atiyeh, are top professionals in the graphic novel industry who frequently work for the likes of Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Dark Horse, and others. Like any creative project, something could happen to the principles that could slow or halt production for a while, but we've hit worse obstacles and still delivered so we think your risks are as minimal as they come. Thanks greatly for your constant support and enthusiasm for our books, comics, and games!

Stone stalks the High Plains seeking heroes to kill. The Cackler hunts the Weird West in search of a mysterious girl called Rachel. Both of these killers are stone-cold dead...Harrowed...and what they're about to do kicks off the next era in the story of Deadlands!
Join us for a walk on the DEAD SIDE as we create two very different but linked projects that start us on the road for the 20th anniversary of Deadlands coming in 2016.
This page is for the Stone and a Hard Place Plot Point Campaign...for more information on the Cackler Graphic Novel Kickstarter, click here!
Check out our loco SIMULTANEOUS Dead Men Walkin' Kickstarters!
Caught Between a...
This is you...caught between Stone and a Hard Place!
So what's in this terrifying tome of twisted tales? Glad you asked, partner, because it's far more than a Plot Point Campaign—it's a sourcebook on the Southwest, new rules for the Harrowed, and a look at the Weird West's most deadly hero killer!
Stone and a Hard Place is presented in the same 8.5 by 11 format as the other Deadlands Plot Point Campaigns "The Flood" and "Last Sons."
***
Death rules this land. From the sun-scorched earth to the empty noose swaying in the skeletal branches of the hangman’s tree to the bloodstained buzzards circling overhead ... the Wild Southwest thirsts for souls. Make sure it don't get yours, partner.
Matthew Cutter's Stone and a Hard Place details the strange locales and odd characters of the American Southwest, provides new Edges and abilities to gussy up your Harrowed or hexslinger, new Setting Rules to emulate Death's grip on the land, Savage Tales galore, a passel o' terrifying abominations, and an epic Plot Point Campaign that pits a posse against Death's red right hand—the one and only Stone!
Stone and a Hard Place is a GREAT book to jump into the Weird West--whether you're new to Deadlands, a veteran, or haven't haunted the High Plains in a few years!
Stone and a Hard Place uses the multiple-award winning Savage Worlds rules and requires the core rules and Deadlands Reloaded to play. If you're new to Deadlands, here's what you need:
The core rule books for Deadlands, powered by Savage Worlds!
Digital Fulfilllment
You'll get your digital files both through the Pinnacle site AND DriveThruRPG.com. :)
YOU Can Be Part of This Twisted Tale!
Want to be part of the story? If you check out our Cackler Graphic Novel Kickstarter you'll see it includes the illustrated short story Dead Men Talking. It's a tale of the day the Cackler met Stone, the town that suffered their wrath, and the deaths of those stubborn few who tried to save it!
If you want to create a character for this twisted tale of High Plains horror, head over there FAST and take a gander at the Deader, Harrowed, and Aces Reward levels! Hurry—only a few slots are available for each!
The Cackler Graphic Novel, by Shane Hensley and Bart Sears!
Quick as Death!
The PDF of Stone and a Hard Place will be delivered as soon as the Kickstarter closes and the payments process. The printed book will be here just a few short months later!
Stone and a Hard Place is a 160-page, 8.5 by 11, full-color hardback!
Why Kickstarter?
We use Kickstarter to help us plan our print run on special books and projects like this, to give you some cool extras we're excited about, and to reach those fans who don't check our website regularly.
Stretch Goals
$8,000 — Stone and a Hard Place Map Pack (UNLOCKED!): Everyone gets the maps from the book in an easy-to-print PDF, along with enlarged maps of Tombstone, Tucson, and Cochise County suitable for printing!
All the maps from the book in an easy-to-print PDF, including poster-sized versions of the towns and Cochise County!
$10,000 — A Tale of Two Killers PDF (UNLOCKED!): Matt Cutter has a deadly adventure planned that features BOTH Stone and the Cackler.
$12,000 — Figure Flats PDF (UNLOCKED!): Print and play miniatures in our usual style for all the important characters, critters, and villains in both Stone and a Hard Place and A Tale of Two Killers, by three-time Hugo Award-winning colorist Cheyenne Wright!
These are the Figure Flats for East Texas University, also by the amazing Cheyenne Wright!
$14,000 — Stone Print (UNLOCKED!): Every physical order gets an exclusive PRINT of the Stone and a Hard Place cover, suitable for framing! This is a physical (print) reward for everyone who orders Stone and a Hard Place in hardback.
This is a working draft of the print featuring Stone, by Daniel Rudnicki. We'll reveal the final version during the Kickstarter!
$16,000 — Promo Cards (UNLOCKED!): Every physical order gets a complete set of our Adventure Deck Promo cards! That's 20 different Adventure Cards we've handed out at conventions over the last few years. These are VERY hard to come by normally, and a GREAT deal for any Savage Worlds fan. They include cards for any game, as well as those designed expressly for Deadlands Reloaded, Deadlands Hell on Earth Reloaded, and Deadlands Noir! This is a physical (print) reward for everyone who orders Stone and a Hard Place in hardback.
Two of the TWENTY promo cards you get as a backer!
$20,000 — Stone and The Cackler Miniatures (UNLOCKED!): Here's the concept art by Cheyenne Wright. The figures will be sculpted and cast by Bronze Age, who did our ETU and Last Parsec minis! These will be available as Add Ons when the book is about to ship.
Concept art for the Dead Men Walking miniatures set!
$30,000 — Scaled Combat Maps (UNLOCKED!): We're creating scale "print and play" combat maps of Western buildings plus several key locations from all three current Plot Point Campaigns. These will be sold separately after the Kickstarter, but Stone and a Hard Place get the PDF absolutely free!
$33,000 — Print Map of the Weird West (UNLOCKED!): We'll create a poster map of the Weird West on one side and the Cochise County and Tombstone maps on the flip side (that part's still pending). All of these will be made available as free PDFs to all backers, and PRINT versions will be available via the Add Ons AFTER the Kickstarter ends.
500 Backers — The Cackler's Challenge (UNLOCKED!): If we get 500 backers for The Cackler graphic novel, all backers receive brand new digital inserts for our Customizable GM's Screen, The Lone Killers of the Southwest PDF featuring Black Bart, Clay Allison, and more, AND the digital version of Shane Hensley's original killer adventure, Dead Men Walkin'.
$50,000 — The Art of the Weird West: A 16-page PDF featuring a few of the original defining pieces of Deadlands art with the stories behind them, as well as brand new visions by top artists such as Bart Sears, Cheyenne Wright, Bien Flores, and more!
Add Ons  
We'll set up the Add Ons after the Kickstarter via an external pledge manager—allowing you to add core books and certain accessories. That keeps things nice and simple here since Kickstarter doesn't offer an easy way to track Add Ons, and still allows you to add items to your order to save on postage once we're about to ship.
Merchant Reward Level
This Reward level is for "Brick and Mortar" stores only and can be purchased as many times as you like. For each $100 pledged, it includes:
4 x Stone and a Hard Place (Retail $120)
2 x Deadlands Player's Guide Explorer's Edition (Retail $40)
2 x Deadlands Marshal's Handbook Explorer's Edition (Retail $40)
All this will be shipped freight free to the continental US *BEFORE* general release. International customers may also pledge—we'll work out the freight charges with you separately.
Please note that if we cannot verify your brick and mortar store, you will receive the Dead Fan Walking package and a prorated refund instead.

campaign.story:
All books of the game are compatible with the Savage Worlds rules system and the Fudge RPG!
The Ratlair is an obscure, labyrinthine place. Abandoned by the enigmatic Builders for reasons unknown, it holds countless secrets and mortal dangers – if you’re a rat. Between devilish traps and wild creatures roaming the old department store (that’s what it is), your life might very well end prematurely, and violently, if it wasn’t for your pack.
Nine hordes – extensive rat families – populate the Ratlair, each with their own specialties, values and quirks. And of course, each horde knows songs about heroes and martyrs, who earned their unforgettable (and usually somewhat excessive) names through their deeds alone. The hordes might disagree and fight about almost everything, but they know that in the end, they are social creatures, and they can only survive together.
Seven of nine hordes ... would like to learn more? Just click the pic!
You can learn more about the hordes on our blog.
Packs! is a small, fast-paced role-playing game of rodent adventure, horror and obscurity, offering a completely new perspective on a world well-known. Packs! originates in Germany and has fascinated a devout fan base for years. Now, it will enter the English-speaking world ... if you want it to!
Choose a horde and earn your name!
As soon as we achieve our funding goal the core book will contain all necessary mechanisms for two different systems: The original rules and the Savage Worlds rules.
Update: Steffan O'Sullivan, the author of the Fudge RPG, will write an appendix with a Fudge conversion of Packs! as a part of the core book. So you can decide to play the game with the original rules, Savage Worlds or Fudge.
You can learn more about the Fudge RPG here.
It's a little unclear in the video so please note: In any case the core book will include the original rules and the SW conversion!
The original Packs! was pretty rules-light and easy to learn; it focussed on atmosphere and character. Savage Worlds presents a fast-paced gameplay as well, but just a little bit crunchier than the original rules.
You can learn more about the original rules and Savage Worlds on our blog.
With the funding goal the core book contains the SW conversion.
Digital copy of Packs! (PDF): After backing the project at Fledgling level ($10) or higher, we will send you a message with a work in progress version of the core book; this can take up to 24 hours. The PDF file already contains 60% of the planned contents including some illustrations and a preliminary layout, missing only the Savage Worlds rules (which we are working on right now), some adventures and additional contents. If we reach our first goal, you will get the final PDF as soon as it’s done!
Digital expansions (PDF): If you back at First Blood level ($20) or higher, you will get access to a digital expansion package that starts out with ready-to-print inlays for the customizable GM screen of Savage Worlds, containing rule overviews and art, as soon as we reach the first stretch goal ($4000). Throughout the campaign we will add more digital expansions at no extra cost for backers of this level. A more successful campaign means a bigger package for you! Take a look at our stretch goals to get a first glimpse.
Digital Fulfillment
You will get your final digital files both, through the Prometheus website and DriveThroughRPG.com!
Printed copy of Packs! (Softcover and Hardcover): Our goal is to print the translated core book of Packs! as an extended edition in English. The book will be released in a 5.5" x 8.5" format, with roughly 130 pages in full color. You can choose between a softcover copy and a sturdy hardcover copy with a book ribbon.
Kickstarter exclusive Art Edition: This edition will be available in this Kickstarter campaign only, not in stores or at conventions. It includes a hardcover copy of the book, with a new cover illustration by Melanie Philippi, and five high-quality paper art prints depicting gorgeous (and scary) scenes encountered in the game. Please note: The actual contents of the book are identical to the retail version.
Kickstarter exclusive Leather-bound Edition: This edition, bound in real leather, will be available in this Kickstarter campaign only, not in stores or at conventions. It will be dedicated to you personally and numbered, with a heat brand of the Packs! logo and the shadows of a rat swarm. The books aren’t finished yet, of course, but we can show you a sample picture of the German Savage Worlds Leather-bound Edition. Every Leather-bound Edition also comes with the art prints of the Art Edition. Please note: The actual contents of the book are identical to the retail version.
We have two Add Ons for everyone who pledges at the Ratlair Defender Reward level or higher. Throughout the campaign we will reveal more Add Ons, so make sure you follow the project.
After the campaign has finished, we will send out a backer survey in which you can tell us what we should get you for your money.
Addon #1:
Additional Books: Some of you have asked if it is possible to get more than one book. Our answer is yes! If you want to saddle up (to a maximum of 5 additional copies), please raise your pledge by the following amount. There are no additional shipping costs, of course.
additional softcover copy – $15
additional hardcover copy – $25
additional Art Edition – $45
additional Leather-bound Edition (English or German) – $85  
Addon #2:
Game Master's Screen: Another Add-on available in this campaign is the Packs! GM's screen, a tri-fold, landscape screen featuring awesome full-color artwork on one side and all the important charts and tables for the Savage Worlds game on the other. The GM Screen also includes the printed 32-page adventure Days of Screeching Thunder. Just raise your physical pledge by the following amount. There are no additional shipping costs, of course.
Packs! GM-Screen (Savage Worlds) - $20 
 Addon #3
The Packs! Companion: You asked if there is a chance to get the Packs! Companion as hard copy?! For sure there is! And it is not just a book, it's a full-colored hardcover! Just add $20 to your physical pledge. We will send you a survey after the campaign ends, so you can tell us that you want the book.
Please note: The Packs! Companion will be shipped separetly by the end of the year (November or early in December). If you would like to have a splitted shipping we have to estimate additional shipping cost. But you will just pay the real shipping cost. We don't charge any handling fees etc.
We expect to finish and publish the PDF of the core book in May 2015. The printed books will follow in September 2015. There is a good chance that both will be released earlier, but we want to play it safe, including a window for some delays. The other products will follow in 2015 and 2016. All products will be available to backers first and only be available in stores after they have reached the backers, of course.
As we are located in Europe and cooperate with Studio 2 Publishing in the US on this Kickstarter, we are able to ship physical pledges free of charge within the US, the EU and Switzerland.
So, this are the shipping cost:
USA: free shipping
EU + Switzerland: free shipping
Rest of Europe: add $20 to your pledge
Canada: add $25 to your pledge
Rest of the world: add $40 to your pledge 
We have a long list of stretch goals in our heads, including digital add-ons, useful tools, merchandise and some cool surprises. As the campaign progresses, we will reveal more of these goals. Make sure to take a look from time to time!
Please note that many stretch goals are digital products that you will get at no additional cost as a backer of the First Blood level ($20) or higher! We will keep you updated on the contents of this expansion package.
$3,000: The English edition of Packs! is funded, including a new rule set to explore the Ratlair with Savage Worlds. - FUNDED!
$3,500: The Dark Secret of the Pied Builders – digital 32-page and full colored super hero adventure. (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED!
$4,000: Packs! will get some ready-to-print inlays for the customizable GM Screen, including new artwork. (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED
$5,000: 10 Super Hero Rats Archetypes - digital, full color -full page, ready to play (Expansion Package) - UNLOCKED
$6,000: We will translate the adventure collection Biting Tales as PDF – Yes, this is a whole new book with about 100 pages! (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED
$7,000: Figure-Flats-I Heroes of the Lair - Two full color, full pages of 28mm scaled ready to print miniatures as PDF. (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED
$8,000: Figure-Flats-II Villains of the Lair - Two full color, full pages of 28mm scaled ready to print miniatures as PDF, including all the monsters of the Lair (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED
$9.000: A sixth 32-page adventure to expand the Biting Tales collection. (Expansion Package!) - UNLOCKED
$10.000: We will publish the Packs!! - Companion as a full color, 96-page PDF including the expansion “Packs! in Space”! (Expansion Package!) - LOCKED
$12.000: We will publish Biting Tales as a b/w softcover edition and every Backer with level Ratlair Defender or higher will get it for free! - LOCKED
… more to come later!
Packs! in Space - stretch goal stuff
Visuals are a very important aspect of the game. A lot of impressive illustrations bring the world of Packs! to life and give you a feeling of your existence as a tiny rat. Over the course of the next weeks we will show you a bunch of samples. So let's have a look ...
work in progress
If you want to support us, please spread the word about our Kickstarter. You can also use the following avatars and banners, and you will find even more of those on our home page.
If you would like to know more about the company Prometheus Games and the people behind it, why not pay a visit to our English website? We'd be happy to introduce ourselves!
Questions, feedback and suggestions are welcome – please don’t hesitate! The easiest way to do so is to use the comment section. We will do our best to answer as fast as possible. You can also reach us via Facebook, G+ or Twitter, or pay a visit to our English message board.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been publishing roleplaying games for seven years now. There can always be obstacles or delays when developing a game and getting it into print: Authors or illustrators can get sick, prices for printing or delivery can change. Sometimes the printer doesn’t deliver a book as agreed upon, or it needs to be printed one more time as the quality is disappointing. And to be totally honest with you, everything and anything on that list has happened to us in one way or another over the course of the last seven years.

campaign.story:
Faster-than-light travel has finally allowed humanity to spread beyond its lonely corner of the Milky Way. In the depths of space these explorers found millions of star systems, strange planets, and exotic alien races. Centuries later, they form the Known Worlds, a vital region of trade and technology where empires grow and business thrives.
It is an unparalleled age. Cutting edge science has opened limitless frontiers of space and consciousness, and has even begun to hint at the mysteries of the universe itself. But to find them, one must travel beyond the familiar, to the last parsecs of reality. 
The Last Parsec is a science fiction roleplaying game of exploration and adventure. It requires the Savage Worlds core rules and the Savage Worlds Science Fiction Companion to play.
Characters cross the cosmos under the auspices of JumpCorp, an intergalactic megacorp that contracts exploration, security, bounty hunting, transportation, and everything in between. Adventures take explorers from system to system and planet to planet, finding strange new civilizations, discovering terrifying creatures, and battling pirates, hostile aliens, rival corporations, and stranger things!
Your hero might be a cynical human, a gregarious yeti, a hot-tempered rakashan, or one of 11 total core races--or you can create your own using the Science Fiction Companion.
Rewards
A graphic of all the reward levels listed at right can be found at the bottom of this page, but here's what people usually ask us about first--the level that includes "one of everything." That would be the Jump Chief, and it's everything at a discount over adding everything on to a base level separately.
NOTE: The Jump Captain and Jump Chief backer levels include a set of die-cut Savage Worlds Status Counters on thick cardboard (also available as an Add On). We accidentally left these out of the Pledge levels and can't edit the Reward text to reflect this change, so we're doing it here and on the graphic below. Sorry for the inconvenience!
Wendigo Tales
If you'd like to jump into the setting at hyperspeed, check out our short fiction line, Wendigo Tales: Season Three features The Last Parsec, and the first two tales are already out (with four more coming soon).
The Searchers, by Shane Hensley, and Scrapped, by Cameron Dayton. Available now!
Books
We're taking a "starbox" approach to the overall setting this time. Races, technology, ships, creatures, and more are all covered in the required Science Fiction Companion, so instead of creating a core book first, we're going to do something a little different.
The Last Parsec blasts off with three setting books and several adventures featuring exciting planets, systems, and fantastic events at the edge of the Known Worlds. We'll produce a second wave of books and other material along with an expanded setting book tying more of the background and events together sometime in 2015.
Get the FREE Last Parsec Primer here!
In the meantime, you can get the essential setting information in The Last Parsec Primer, completely free and available now!
Here are the first three settings for The Last Parsec, written and illustrated by Pinnacle's best. We're only going to sell the books in sets during the Kickstarter--which also gets you the unlocked digital rewards. After the Kickstarter, each book will be available separately as usual.
Each book contains detailed background on a system, planet, or other location, any new Edges, Hindrances, Gear, Ships, or Setting Rules important to the area, a Plot Point Campaign, Savage Tales, and a Bestiary covering the strange xenos and shady characters one might meet in the distant reaches.
Each book is full-color, 96 pages, in our standard graphic novel format so everything lines up nice and neat on your shelf. All three settings are available in softback and Limited Edition hardback.
Eris Beta-V: A JumpCorp-employed team of explorers investigates a magnificent ringed gas giant with its numerous moons. Ancient artifacts of enormous power can be found among the rings and asteroids. Every moon is a unique world to be explored. When the system’s valuable commerce is threatened by unscrupulous agencies, the team must root them out and put themselves at great risk on the icy fringes of interstellar space. Written by Matt Cutter (Deadlands Brand Manager).
Scientorium: Hidden away by sheer distance and forever shrouded from the minds of the curious lies a mammoth artifact from the previous galactic age, the library of Scientorium. Its strange experience chambers offer passage to a million histories on a million worlds, secrets and technologies undreamed of. Now abandoned by all but its automated security systems and enigmatic caretakers, its workings are oddly twisted and jealous, meting out reward and punishment in equal measure. This is a classic science fiction saga, an epic journey across space and time in the vein of Niven or Heinlein! Written by Timothy Brian Brown (Dragon Kings, Dark Sun, Traveller).
Leviathan: Hunt the most dangerous game in the Known Worlds! The jungle planet Leviathan teems with mammoth lacerauns, savage beasts of enormous size and cunning, potential trophies unmatched in any other star system. Intentionally undeveloped beyond a few tourist-oriented settlements, Leviathan nonetheless draws more than just adventure-seeking hunters though, including researchers and those who would see the world left completely untouched. Both are more than willing to turn the tables on any would-be hunters. Written by John Goff (Night Train, Deadlands Noir).
Poster Maps
Just like the poster maps we did for Deadlands Noir, Weird Wars Rome, and East Texas University, we're creating two double-sided, dry-erase maps on heavy paper stock. This time out the maps feature four different ships (dropship, freighter, pirate vessel, and research ship) you can use for your JumpCorp team or the treacherous foes who cross their path.
Here's a peek at the map work in progress--we'll update this with more detailed pics as they near completion.
Game Master's Screen
The Last Parsec GM's screen is a tri-fold, landscape screen featuring gorgeous full-color artwork on one side and all the important charts and tables for the game on the other.
The GM's screen also includes The Last Parsec Primer in printed form and an original adventure (that sets up one of our future settings) by Ross Watson called The Enigma Equation.
Miniatures
Our friends at Bronze Age Miniatures have created nine exclusive miniatures representing some of the most popular archetypes from the Savage Worlds Science Fiction Companion and The Last Parsec.
The set contains the aurax, construct, deader, male and female human, insectoid, kalian, Serran, and yeti.
Best of all, if you pledge for the minis during the Kickstarter and the bonus figures listed under Stretch Goals are unlocked (the Floran, Saurian, and Rakashan), we'll include them in your set free!
Figures sculpted by Bronze Age Miniatures.
Add-Ons
Everyone who pledges for physical shipments can add additional items to their shipment at no additional shipping cost. (After the KS you can always order these from our store at standard shipping rates.)
Simply increase your pledge by the amount shown. When we send out the Final Survey, your credit will apply.
Stretch Goals
Here are the additional digital or physical unlocks we plan on releasing if we exceed our original funding goal:
Rogue Traders (Merchant Level)
Kickstarter's Reward boxes don't allow formatting, so we decided to put the list of items and terms here where it's easier to understand:
This Reward level is for "Brick and Mortar" stores only and can be purchased as many times as you like. It includes:
3 x Leviathan in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x Scientorium in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x Eris Beta-V in Limited Edition Hardback ($75 retail value)
3 x GM's Screen + Adventure ($60 retail value)
2 x Dropship and Freighter dry-erase, poster-size ship maps ($30 retail value)
2 x Pirate and Research Vessel dry-erase poster-size ship maps ($30 retail value)
2 x Double Action Deck ($60 retail value)
All this will be shipped freight free to the continental US *BEFORE* general release.
Please note that if we cannot verify your brick and mortar store, you will receive the Jump Captain package and a prorated refund instead.
The Kickstarter
The books and adventures are already in layout, the first wave of miniatures are done, and we're ready to go. We're using Kickstarter so that we can make some of the extras listed in the Stretch Goals above.
Our last Kickstarter for East Texas University is at the printer and the last of the digital rewards are coming out fast and furious by the 12 to Midnight Crew.
Reward Summary
