Mythos Arcanum Kickstarter

Mythos Arcanum: Open your mind and game.
Mythos Arcanum is a role-playing product that is both familiar and like no other. Combining the best part of Dungeons and Dragons and the heady, mind-blowing ideas behind perception and philosophy, Mythos Arcanum delivers not just a game, but an experience!
Created by Joe Aragon, Mythos Arcanum features art from classic artist Darlene, Rowena Aitken, Vaggelis Ntousakis along with artist Laura Siadak. Contributing game writers include author of Conan the role-playing game, Ian Sturrock, Hackmaster writer Tony DiGerolamo and game writer, Uri Kurlianchik.
Based in the world of Rochuron, Mythos Arcanum includes all the iconic fantasy characters including knights, wizards, clerics and thieves.They face off against classic monsters like skeletons, orcs, wraiths and dragons.
Then we take the game to the next level, as your players must deal with moral and ethical dilemmas. Is it right to slay baby monsters? Is looting a castle ethical?Is the law right or moral or both or neither? These philosophical choices directly impact play and the ultimate powers that rule Rochuron. In Mythos Arcanum, your characters aren't just embarking on a quest, but also searching for something deeper inside that may lead to mind-bending, reality-altering powers!
Open your mind. Experience the next level of role-playing. Experience Mythos Arcanum!
Mythos Arcanum changes the way players and GMs think about role playing.
Our 1st tier is $15,000.This will allow us to print the Mythos Arcanum Core Rulebook.
2nd tier is $18,800: We will create a Special Introductory Adventure and distribute it via PDF to all pledges $15 and above.
3rd tier is $24,000: Art Upgrade: If we reach this tier, we will include artwork from legendary World of Greyhawk artist, Darlene. "That's where and how I have decided to place my intention, my energy, my focus in the time I have left." Darlene said, "This experiment is my opportunity to contribute towards something that has the possibility of creating more positive life choices for young players. Bringing fantasy into reality may be the future stage of role playing. Isn't that a possibility worth pursuing?"
Example of Darlene's artwork for the upcoming Campaign Guide (Book II of the Mythos Arcanum Line of Gamebooks)
4th tier is $30,000: We will create a second adventure and distribute via PDF.
5th tier is $35,000: Darlene will do a full color campaign map, which will be included with the core rulebook.
6th tier is $40,000: We will create a third adventure and distribute via PDF.
7th tier is $45,000: Art Upgrade II: Darlene will add a special piece of full color artwork in the rulebook.
8th tier is $50,000: We will create a fourth adventure and distribute it via PDF.
9th tier is $55,000: Art Upgrade III: Darlene will design the character sheet and the entire graphic design and layout for the core rule book.
BACKER REWARDS
$1: All backers get a thank you on our website, plus a Mythos Arcanum Wallpaper download.
$15: A PDF copy of the Mythos Arcanum core rulebook.This includes everything you need to create characters and adventure in the world of Rochuron. Backers of this level and above also get mentioned in the Hall of Fame section of our website.
$25: PDF copies of all PDF's from all tiers funded via Kickstarter.
$50: A print copy of the Mythos Arcanum core rulebook, plus copies of all PDF's from all tiers funded via Kickstarter. Please add $25 for anyone outside the US for shipping and handling. Add an extra $20 and it will be signed by creator, Joe Aragon!
$75: Creature Creator! In addition to your print copy of the book, you will get to help design and name a creature that will become part of the Mythos Arcanum world! You will also get a copy of the art for that creature!
$100: Develop Access! In addition to your print copy of the book, you will be invited to a private forum on the MAGI website. You'll be first in line to beta test product and be invited to developer level online discussions with the Mythos Arcanum development team! All backers at this level and above get their book signed!
$250: Setting Designer! In addition to your print copy of the book, you will help design a new setting in the Mythos Arcanum world! This non-city location will appear in a future Mythos Arcanum project!
$400: Arcanum Legend! In addition to your print copy of the book, your image (or your design) will become an important NPC in the world of Mythos Arcanum! You will also receive a copy of the artwork!
If we reach our funding goal: Anyone that pledges $100 or more will receive a print copy of the Maiden with Unicorn full color artwork.
Darlene will personally sign each one!
Who is this artist Darlene who worked on the original World of Greyhawk?
Example of Darlene's color artwork
The once and future "Darlene" is mostly known as the creator of the classic World of Greyhawk 2-map set in the early 1980s. Darlene  (aka "Our Lady of Gaming") was also the first female freelance artist for TSR. She contributed much to the look and medieval feel of the RPG genre such as devising TSR's wizard head logo. Her art appears in the DMG, B1, early issues of The Dragon, in Calendars, and in the first RPGA module and within various other early projects and game books.
"I embrace new adventures and new possibilities," Darlene says of her association with Mythos Arcanum, "and can get behind the idea of engendering a better world of possibility via RPGs. In 2012 and 2013, Joe Aragon inspired Darlene for her to create a score of fantasy RPG illustrations." 
What if we introduce young users to some different concepts through their game play? At the moment, violence and greed gets rewarded. Can a different world be imagined in which the power of greed does not ultimately rule or perhaps a world where the concept of chivalry is not dead? What would it mean to be in this world? How would it feel? If, in their gameplay, outmoded models of power becomes antiquated and obsolete, can a new relationship to power make an impact upon a young player's choices in life?
Darlene's challenge as an artist visionary is to consciously use her art to help foster a world modeling integrity. Art and intention can come together to introduce new resonant pathways in the brain. Art engenders a new synthesis. Patterns and shapes produce unique effects. Patterns of black and white, Dark and light, Vibrational frequencies, Cadence, Visual poetry--All come together to create a transcendent effect on the brain.
Who is Mythos Arcanum Games Imagined?
We are a community working tirelessly, composed of veteran artists from the original days with TSR to relative newcomers in the field. Together we are participating in a collective creative experience known as Mythos Arcanum. We hope that you as fellow gamers and explorers of the imagination will join us in a living, breathing experience not borne from a mass market corporate scheme but rather from the imagination and minds of gamers like yourself!

This is just the beginning folks! We already have follow up products, at we plan to publish if this project is a success. We have adventures, settings, unique locations, . We even have a post-apocalypse game set in the far, far past written by James Ward, the author of the famous Gamma World! We may even be able to convince him to contribute an adventure offered here as one of the tier goals. 
This is intended to be a community based project.
Designed by gaming community, supported by the community, and ultimately, the fate of the game will be driven and determined by the community.
It will require the community to support this game in order to make it a real manifestation.
This is no company driven thing where we bombard you with sales pitches, got to get them all while they last, nor will we change on you after a couple years just to drum up sales.
This will not be a game that gets changed in a couple years when a company decides it has sold to most of the consuming public and wants to drum up sales again. This game will last and only be built upon.

Mythos Arcanum Games Imagined is not like any game company you have ever dealt with before. The game will befully compatible with the first three versions of the most popular role playing game in history. All your old game material should be able to plug and play with little to no modifications. The book itself will be chock full of classic art from classic artists. It will be laid out by Darlene herself, with an eye to the subtle spiritual that only she can deliver. It will be a piece of symbolic symbolism with pieces of the collaborator’s soul within its very pages.
It will be a work of art in itself!
This will be YOUR game!
Please commit your pledge and join the Mythos Arcanum community!

In addition: The cat is out of the bag! YES, the mystery artist you see here is none other than the great Jim Holloway himself! He is not only the cover artist but the main artist featured throughout the book!

Anyone that pledges $5,000 or more will receive an original Jim Holloway artwork!
Anyone that pledges 10,000 will receive multiple Jim Holloway originals, at least 2 full color paintings, as well as signed print from Darlene and numerous signed Weird Art of Vaggelis Ntousakis!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges

Mythos Arcanum comes with an original setting with its own gods, mythos, history, monsters and magic, but the rules are flexible enough that they can be adapted to any fantasy role-playing setting. 

The rule book, a number of adventures and much of the artwork is complete. We are looking for funding to print and publish the Core Rule book, adventures and potential art upgrades.

The main challenges seem to be general cynicism, unethical Kickstarter campaigns launched in the past that have increased the cynicism, larger established game companies with existing production budgets taking advantage of Kickstarter services and existing loyal droves of fans in order to drive up profit margins that are dominating public attention. 
This increases the challenge to legitimate small indie efforts and the upstart small guys trying to bring something truly special to the public.
Support guerrilla gaming!

Please support the little guy and pledge to Mythos Arcanum!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It’s all true. The myths, the folklore, the campfire stories, and urban legends. Every terrifying tale of things that go bump in the night…they’re all true. These soul-sucking, flesh-devouring, shadow-haunting fiends want nothing more than to eat you and everyone you love. That’s where we come in. The Brotherhood of the Celestial Torch. Most just call us Demon Hunters. If you haven’t heard of us, we’re doing a good job. In the name of all that is Good, we fight the forces of Evil. And we’re hiring!
Dead Gentlemen Productions, creators of the worldwide cult hit films The Gamers, The Gamers: Dorkness Rising,and The Gamers: Hands of Fate,are once again teaming up with RPG professionals to bring you the new Demon Hunters RPG: A Comedy of Terrors corebook. 
Our world is a dangerous and ridiculous place. If you love the TV shows Supernatural, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Angel, and The A-Team, along with movies like Army of Darkness, Evil Dead 2, Hansel & Gretel: Witch Hunters, Ghostbusters, and James Bond, we do too and it's all here. The truth is, as mentioned above, it's ALL real. Like the show, Supernatural, the Demon Hunters setting relies on existing lore, urban legends, etc., because we have found that the truth really is stranger than fiction. 
The Brotherhood of the Celestial Torch is the worldwide organization that operates behind the screen of the mainstream. We are what stands in the way of you and what wants to eat your heart while you watch, you know, because it's Tuesday.
Because the forces of evil in our world are SO evil and powerful and prevalent, we use comedy to help fight it back. This game is a training tool to help you face what's out there. So grab your friends, generate scenarios, tell your collaborative story, and laugh. Laugh hard. It steels your soul for the horror that awaits you.
Before The Gamers, The Gamers: Dorkness Rising, JourneyQuest, or The Gamers: Hands of Fate, there was Demon Hunters. The group that would become The Dead Gentlemen created 2 feature length digital films between 1999 and 2001. The movies were enjoyed by college audiences, and the world we created has inspired us ever since. In 2008 we partnered with Margaret Weis Productions and released the Demon Hunters Roleplaying Game. In April 2014 we relaunched our Demon Hunters story in the form of a webcomic, rebooting the canon, and now we'd like to create a new Demon Hunters RPG using rules inspired by the Fate Core system. Additionally we have developed an adventure generation system based on our experience and tools as screenwriters and storytellers. That's where this Kickstarter Campaign comes in.
Demon Hunters RPG: A Comedy of Terrors Corebook
This is a mockup. Actual book may look different.
Within the 248 pages of this deluxe-yet-surprisingly-portable Bible-sized (6" x 9") roleplaying game book are all the rules and guidelines you need to create your Demon Hunter, seek out and thwart the minions of evil, and survive long enough to keep the mundanes from hearing about it. From character generation to gameplay, it is designed to get you fully into the story quickly. Our system is building on Fate Accelerated & Steve Kenson's Icons Assembled, so if you love those games you're going to love the Demon Hunters RPG: A Comedy of Terrors. 
For the Gamemaster, an adventure generation system utilizing our storytelling structures that provides tables, charts, clever advice, and a host of useful story elements keeps you from going crazy while spinning grand and epic tales of infernal nastiness. 
It's a gorgeous black and white tome with a foil-stamped leather-like softcover, and makes a great bludgeoning weapon in case of emergency.

This adventure is designed in the style of mad libs so that you can use the elements in the corebook mission generation system, or the Gamemaster's Apprentice cards (Chill! Cam Banks, Writer, Lead Game Designer: Cam is an award-winning game designer & developer who left New Zealand in 1996 to marry his sweetheart and forge a new life in the USA. His published work includes almost every Dragonlance product from Sovereign Press as well as numerous licensed games from Margaret Weis Productions, including Leverage, Smallville, and Marvel Heroic Roleplaying. Currently he is gainfully employed in Minnesota as brand manager at Atlas Games, publisher of Feng Shui, Over the Edge, and Ars Magica.
Thomas Deeny, Layout Designer: Thomas is a graphic designer who specializes in book layout and game design. His layout and design work can be found in Margaret Weis Productions’ Firefly RPG line, Magpie Games’ The Fate Codex, and AEG’s Nightfall and Tempest game lines. Thomas is an evangelist for hobby gaming, and helped to organize the gaming community in southern Arizona, working with manufacturers, retailers, and gamers to develop community awareness of the hobby. 
Ben Dobyns, Kickstarter Consultant: Ben is a producer and director of quality film and web entertainment. He directed the original Demon Hunters film, photographed the second, co-directed the Brotherhood Orientation Video, and does not yet have a BCT tattoo. Ben has managed several successfully Kickstarter campaigns, including the Kickstarter record breaking The Gamers: Hands of Fate movie. You can see his face and hear his words in the video above.
Don Early, Project Manager, Writer: Don is the President of Dead Gentlemen Productions, and is an actor, director, producer, and recently a writer. He began spearheading this project after ZOECon 1 in 2012, after he ran a Demon Hunters RPG session, co-designed with Jimmy McMichael. Don plays Silent Jim, in the Demon Hunters series, and appears as Mort Agrippa in The Gamers: Dorkness Rising.
Jason Engle, artist: Jason is a renowned artist and illustrator, creating art for the publishing and entertainment markets for the past 14 years. He created the cover art of the 2008 release of the Demon Hunters Roleplaying Game, published by Margaret Weis Productions. Jason has been included in the art collections Spectrum and Expose series, D’Artiste, and Fantasy Art Now, as well as many magazines and publications from all over the globe. He has published numerous art books and collections of his work, including "Infernum", “Eidolon”, “Fragments”, “Relentless”, “Sovereign”, and most recently “Archon”.
Ben Honeycutt, artist: Ben is a digital illustrator and sculptor. After working in clothing design and the short lived Ethos trading card game, Ben turned his sights to comics. After a cross promotion involving Ethos and Dead Gentlemen’s Luster character (from The Gamers: Dorkness Rising), Ben was invited to join the Demon Hunters webcomic project, where he masterfully brought to life all the crazy concepts bouncing around Jimmy McMichael’s head. He’s also incredibly humble. Masterfully so.
Jimmy McMichael, Writer: Jimmy writes the Demon Hunters webcomic. It is the culmination of a 15-year scheme that has involved playing Herr Doktor in Demon Hunters: Dead Camper Lake, creating and running the Dead Gentlemen website for far longer than he had any interest in doing so, co-writing the original Demon Hunters RPG and accompanying Orientation Video for Margaret Weis Productions, and working on RPGs based on the shows Supernatural and Leverage. This Kickstarter is the final phase of his master plan. All of the pieces have fallen into place. Let the Ragnarok Protocol commence!
Jen Page, Artist, Graphic Designer: If there was such thing as real life ‘Experience Points’, Jen would be racking up the geek stats. She’s ambitiously pursuing her own art contributions to role playing games and has 15+ years of graphic design experiencing having worked for such brands as D&D, Magic: The Gathering, Forgotten Realms and Avalon Hill. She's contributed plenty of work to Dead Gentlemen including the JourneyQuest logo, the Luster artwork on the Dorkness Rising cover as well as designed Dead Gentlemen's own company logo. 
Nathan Rockwood, Writer, Game Designer: Believing firmly that 'story trumps rules' has led Nathan down many strange paths over the years--medieval reenacting, teaching both English and Game Design, teaching video games IN English class--and one of those paths crossed with the Dead Gentlemen's when he worked as an author and designer on the first Demon Hunters RPG in 2008. Nathan has written for many other games before and since, including the award-winning Serenity RPG, and has recently begun publishing independently, but he's looking forward to reactivating his Brotherhood Chapter... and may even get a real tattoo this time.
Emilie Rommel Shimkus, Copyeditor: Emilie is an actor, singer, and writer from the Pacific Northwest. She has spent the last decade wrangling documentation of all stripes for tech companies, start-ups, and non-profits. The rest of the time, she keeps making things up on paper, onstage and on film. Emilie plays Wren the Bard, in Seasons 1 & 2 of the DG/ZOE web-series JourneyQuest and is the vocalist for RockLab, a high-energy party cover band. 
Amanda Valentine, Editor:  Amanda is a freelance RPG editor and developer. Her work includes the Dresden Files RPG, Marvel Heroic Roleplaying, Fate Accelerated Edition, Little Wizards, and many others. She also edits fiction, including several of the Spirit of the Century novels. She blogs sporadically at ayvalentine.com about editing, parenting, and gaming. At reads4tweens.com she writes spoilerific book reviews for adults who care about what the kids in their lives are reading.

If you've already backed the project, go HERE to download Designers & Dragons: The ’70s right now!
What Is Designers & Dragons?
Designers & Dragons is a four volume book series of RPG industry awesomeness, meticulously researched and prettily packaged. Author Shannon Appelcline guides you company by company through the history of tabletop starting in the 1970s all the way up to present day. This series is chock full of fascinating insider tidbits, company profiles, and yes—enough drama to fuel a hundred campaigns.
Evil Hat Productions is incredibly proud to produce this updated edition of Designers & Dragons. You may remember the first edition that came out from the lovely people at Mongoose Publishing—we'd wanted to publish it then, but missed the chance! So we leapt at the opportunity to take it on once their one-volume version went out of print. 
Even if you own the big black book (aka, the first edition), there’s still plenty of new material in this second edition—over 50,000 new words in the first volume alone. Our edition is fully expanded and extensively updated, a multi-volume set that won’t break your back, illustrated with pretty pictures of the games you remember fondly. RPG WIN! Bathroom reading victory! 
Why a History of Roleplaying Games?
This sort of thing is important! But don't take our word for it — here are some thoughts from folks throughout the industry:

Jason Morningstar:
Emily Care Boss: 
Chris Pramas:
Quinn Murphy:
Lilian Cohen Moore:
Peter Adkison:
Adam Koebel:
 Miranda Horner: 
Thor Olavsrud:
Mark Diaz Truman:
Jenn Brozek:
Ryan Macklin:
Marissa Kelly: 
Kenneth Hite:
And we've just been reviewed by GeekDad! Check out the GeekDad review here.

Why Are We Kickstarting Designers & Dragons?
Pre-press production on Designers & Dragons: The ’70s is already complete, and it’s so gorgeous that it got us all riled up. We’re really excited about this project, and we want this first volume to have company. In short, we want to be able to print and release all four volumes at the same time. But...
... production and printing on each volume costs $10k or more, and the idea of producing all four volumes at once gives our financial people a case of nervous twitches. We want to make this happen responsibly so we can continue to produce the high quality products you’ve come to expect from Evil Hat Productions. 
This Kickstarter will enable our goal of printing more than just the 1970s volume at the same time. It will help cover the print runs and some of the costs for Volumes 2-4 so that we can do this right—and with full knowledge of how many of you out there are interested! Plus, if we hit our initial funding goal and our first two stretches, we'll be able to release the full set all at once. 
This Kickstarter gives us an opportunity to spread our excitement in more productive ways than running through the neighborhood whilst festooned with streamers and blaring horns. (And with less of a chance of getting arrested, which is a double win.) If you’re as thrilled as we are about the chance to dig into the history of our hobby, we hope you’ll help spread the word to people who feel the same. Seriously, these books are addictively awesome. They nearly drove us to festooning and horn-tootery, which we think says a lot.
Project Rewards & Goals
Each volume in the Designers & Dragons series will be a 6"x9" softcover, several hundred pages long, with black and white interior. Each decade's volume of Designers & Dragons covers dozens of companies founded in that decade and follows them through to their end, or the present day for those still with us.

Please note: Companies are generally listed by their best-known, or at least most-recent, name. So you might see something like Margaret Weis Productions listed above where it was originally known as Sovereign Press, and so on.

Designers & Dragons: The ’70s: Immediately available in multiple digital formats to our backers. Are you a backer? Go HERE to download your copy! 
Everything you’ve wanted to know about the origins of roleplaying games…
Designers & Dragons: The ’70s is a comprehensive picture of the beginnings of the RPG industry. The first in a four volume series, this book has more interesting tidbits than a hundred pop up videos. Learn about the colorful history of TSR and the wave of D&D inspired games (and gaming companies) to follow, and dip your toes into wargaming trivia. Whether you’re a long-time gamer who greets each mention of a ’70s title with “I remember that!” or a new-to-the-hobby sort who wants to know how we got here in the first place, Shannon Appelcline’s meticulously researched history won’t disappoint.
Meet the characters behind the characters and the gamers behind the games in Designers & Dragons: The ’70s!
Foreword by: Greg Stafford!
Companies covered include: TSR, Flying Buffalo, Games Workshop, GDW, Judges Guild, Metagaming Concepts, Fantasy Games Unlimited, Chaosium, Gamescience, Heritage Models, Grimoire Games, DayStar West Media, and Midkemia Press. PLUS, Ten Things You Might Not Know About Roleplaying in the ’70s, and an extensive bilbiography and index. All in all, over 50,000 new words over the previous edition!
Designers & Dragons: The ’80s: UNLOCKED! This project has funded at $7,500, so we'll be able to print the ’80s volume at the same time as the ’70s!
In this volume you'll get all the general awesomeness as described above, plus a free set of downloadable Ginsu knives (we're kidding, but we wish we weren't)! But this volume DOES have an in-depth look at ’80s style gaming courtesy of companies like Steve Jackson Games and West End Games, plus an intro to the small (but mighty!) presses of the decade.
Foreword by: Mike Pondsmith!
Companies covered include:  SPI, Task Force Games, Steve Jackson Games, FASA, Gamelords, ICE, Hero Games, Palladium Books, Leading Edge Games, Bard Games, Yaquinto Publications, Mayfair Games, Avalon Hill, Columbia Games, West End Games, SkyRealms Publishing, DGP, R. Talsorian, Lion Rampant, Pacesetter, New Infinities, Creations Unlimited, and Different Worlds Publications. PLUS, Ten Things You Might Not Know About Roleplaying in the ’80s, and an extensive bilbiography and index. This volume has about 10,000 new words added vs. the previous edition.

Designers & Dragons: The ’90s: UNLOCKED! We've reached $15,000, so we'll be able to print the ’90s volume at the same time as the ’70s and ’80s!
Just like the earlier volumes, plus a free Baywatch-themed gaming session with David Hasselhoff. No, not really. We’re kidding about that part, but hopefully we didn’t have to tell you that. But this volume does profile an RPG titan—Wizards of the Coast—not to mention cover the rise of storytelling RPG settings like White Wolf’s World of Darkness.
Foreword by: Peter Adkison!
Companies covered include: White Wolf, Atlas Games, Pagan Publishing, AEG, Phage Press, Dream Pod 9, Wizards of the Coast, Metropolis, Hogshead Publishing, Last Unicorn Games, Kenzer & Company, Grey Ghost Games, Imperium Games, Holistic Design, Pinnacle Entertainment Group, Fantasy Flight Games, Guardians of Order, Eden Studios, Margaret Weis Productions, Green Knight Publishing, and Hekaforge. PLUS, Ten Things You Might Not Know About Roleplaying in the ’90s, and an extensive bilbiography and index. This volume has about 10,000 new words added vs. the previous edition.

Designers & Dragons: The ’00s: UNLOCKED! This project has reached $22,500 so we'll be able to print the ’00s volume at the same time as the ’70s, ’80s, and ’90s!
In this most-updated volume of the series featuring thirteen new articles and dozens of revisions, you'll find all the awesomeness you’ve come to know and love by reading the summaries of the last three volumes, plus bonus kung fu action! Also an inside look at d20 companies like Green Ronin and Mongoose Publishing and at indie presses like those weirdos at Evil Hat Productions.
Foreword by: Lisa Stevens!
Companies covered include: Necromancer Games, Green Ronin Publishing, Troll Lord Games, Issaries, Pelgrane Press, Goodman Games, Privateer Press, Mongoose Publishing, Adept Press, Memento Mori Theatricks, Lumpley Games, Burning Wheel Headquarters, Paizo Publishing, Galileo Games, Atomic Sock Monkey, John Wick Presents, Bully Pulpit Games, Evil Hat Productions, Kobold Press, Cubicle 7 Entertainment, Post Human Studios, Fan Pro, Arc Dream Publishing, RedBrick, and Catalyst Game Labs. PLUS, Ten Things You Might Not Know About Roleplaying in the ’00s, and an extensive bilbiography and index. Hugely expanded from the prior edition — tens of thousands of additional words and a number of new companies.
UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS: 
All four volumes, printed simultaneously!
Bookmark set!

Shannon will write a short history on the gaming group that released the first third-party supplement for Dungeons & Dragons, forever changing the game with the introduction of a thief player class. We'll add this to the Platinum Appendix. Details in this update!
How will I select my rewards?
First, pledge your reward level!
Soon after the campaign concludes, we'll send out surveys to folks getting the physical books. When the time comes, we will ask you to fully configure your rewards package over on backerkit.com—a well known third party pledge configuration service. (If using a third-party pledge configuration service is a problem for you, it's probably best to wait and buy our books when they reach distribution.) 
Backerkit will also make it possible for folks to add on additional books in case you forgot to pledge for them while the campaign was active. Bonus!
What Are My International Options?
Shipping kills, friends. Shipping kills. So be ready for that!
We've added a number of "BILL MY SHIPPING LATER" reward tiers for our international backers. Please make sure to read the relevant section in Update #3 so you can understand exactly how this will work and how high that later shipping charge will be!
The books will be made available for sale to the international market once they're in print, so if you'd rather wait, that's totally fine. There are also some other options to consider besides the BILL MY SHIPPING LATER reward tiers.
If you want to stay apprised of developments on this project, consider backing us at one of the digital levels—even for $1, a low-cost way to "subscribe" to this project's updates. 
Another good option is to contact a retailer closer to you and arrange for them to order the books you want! Evil Hat's books are distributed and sold to and by game retailers in multiple international markets, including Canada (served by Lion Rampant distribution), Australia (dependent on individual retailers placing orders with us), the United Kingdom (distributed by Esdevium to many stores in the UK and Europe, including Leisure Games), and Germany (often carried by Sphärenmeisters Spiele), for starters. 
Or you can find a way to effectively "pretend" to be a domestic backer by finding a person or organization in the US that can receive a package for you, then get it to you in a way you're willing to afford. (We've heard mention of Ship It To as one option, tho we have no experience with them ourselves.)
International retailers without a reliable distribution source for our books may pledge for the MASTER OF RETAIL reward tier—so long as you have a US-based address for us to ship to. Freight forwarders are your friend!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Evil Hat is an experienced RPG publisher. We've produced multiple printed role-playing games in a variety of physical formats over the past six-plus years. This is a non-fiction book series, which is markedly *less* challenging to produce than a RPG book.

Evil Hat's experience puts us in a fine position to take on the risks and challenges that arise—as with any project, experience tells us a few problems and bugaboos *will* arise.

Here's what we can anticipate as potential problems.

THE TEXT: While the editing and layout of several volumes is largely done, it's possible that we will identify some glaring issue that we need to address before we take this fully to publication. That can add time, for sure. Luckily we've got an editor, a proofreader, and a historian going over every sentence in close detail, so we feel we have this under control. 

PRINTING: Our company has grown up alongside the big boom in digital short-run printing technology. Thanks to the advances made there, we'll be able to print the book in any quantity we need. But printers can run into problems all the same: supply shortages, unexpected delays due to company holidays or industry events, or simply goofing up the manufacture or shipping of the books in some way. With a number of potential domestic printers to use, we'll always have a back-up we can go to in the event that our first choice printer has to be set aside. In the event of defective product, we will send a replacement at no cost to you.

SHIPPING: Packages get lost. We'll work with you to send replacements. Our shipper may take longer than expected. We won't put the book on sale until they've shipped out all backer copies. Shipping costs can end up higher than expected. We'll absorb the overage.

FINANCES: Thanks to the success of the Dresden Files RPG and Fate Core, Evil Hat is—for the game industry—a perhaps atypically solvent RPG company. We've already spent thousands on getting Designers & Dragons to this point, and our bank account continues to look plenty healthy. If an unexpected cost arises, we've got the cushion to take the hit.

If there's any risk or challenge YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible. We intend to impress you.

12 years ago, we decided to enter the emerging reality TV market, but with our own devious twist: using hidden cameras to observe the methods the PRODUCERS use to make great unscripted television. The production team, however, was overly zealous, and some...things...occurred.
Happily, the statute of limitations has finally expired and we're ready to release the hilarious/appalling/potentially-criminal results to you! During the film's enforced convalescence, we have managed to put together most of the footage and all we need is a few finishing touches to make the ending really...explode off the screen...you might say.

Stretch Goals!
ACHIEVED!!! $16,000 - Expanded Professional Sound Library. If we hit this goal we will be able to acquire an expanded sound library that has been used on actual professional reality television. The quality of our show will be enormously improved with this addition.
ACHIEVED!!! $17,000 - House Rulez Backer Patch! Everyone at the $50 level and higher will receive an exclusive House Rulez Backer Patch. If you have ever gotten a patch from a previous ZOE Kickstarter you know how cool these are.

House Rulez is Dead Gentlemen's first foray into the world of reality television. DG hilariously exposes not only the quirks and foibles of the cast, but also uses hidden cameras to covertly spy on the show's production team--and their increasingly frantic attempts to create a watchable show!
A four-hour reality television miniseries, House Rulez will be released on the Dead Gentlemen and Zombie Orpheus YouTube channels.
We are Dead Gentlemen Productions and our friends over at Zombie Orpheus Entertainment. We created House Rulez twelve years ago with an all volunteer cast and crew and almost have it finished! We are just asking for your help to complete the final sizzling touches! 
Absolutely! Old favorites like:
Nathan Rice (Lodge from The Gamers movies, Roderick from JourneyQuest, Gabriel from the Demon Hunters series) 
Matt Vancil (finally on camera without facial prosthetics!)
Steve Wolbrecht (Nodwick from Dorkness Rising, Chris from the Demon Hunters series)
Ed Gibbs (the Hierophant from Dorkness Rising)
Don Early (Mort Agrippa from Dorkness Rising, Silent Jim from the Demon Hunters series)

The project was the brainchild of Dead Gentlemen Productions' own DG Improv: all of the original members of DG Improv are involved in this wholly unscripted adventure.

Story editor Sarah Sanders-Ode not only appears in House Rulez, but cataloged every dramatic moment and spent several years finding and editing the ideal shape and form to tell this epic story. This project would not exist without her passion and dedication.
For post-production, Alex Perrault brings the benefit of 20 years of expertise as an Emmy-nominated editor who worked in film, broadcast, DRTV, and web. His long experience in documentary and reality film making, and past with networks like PBS, Discovery, A&E, TLC, and National Geographic, allow him to bring a very modern sensibility to all his projects.
Graphics, sound, and sweetening will be by Jaya Productions. They started in 2001, working on DRTV campaigns, and eventually grew into the Reality TV space, working on many hit shows that aired on networks like A&E and History. In recent years they've grown into web and corporate video with work for Amazon, Real Networks, US Dept of Energy, King County, Microsoft, and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. They specialize in creative storytelling through effective editing and motion graphics.
And finally, Zombie Orpheus Entertainment is on board to help shepherd House Rulez across the finish line. They will bring their Kickstarter and distribution expertise to the task of manufacturing and delivering rewards and putting the show in front of your eyeballs.
This will be a FAST turnaround: you'll get to see the fruits of your generosity within a few months of the Kickstarter's completion. We will release House Rulez for FREE online under Creative Commons Non-commercial license so that the whole world can see the conflagration of emotion and hilarity—as well as being able to play with the released version all you like.
Can't afford to pledge? That’s okay! You can help us just by letting anyone who might like our show know that we’re out here. Tweet us, share us, like us on Facebook—any extra exposure we get helps people who can contribute find our project.
Yes. And no. An opportunity to bring the project to the masses presented itself briefly in 2009, but...things...scuttled the attempt. They say ETU is a great place to earn a quality education without the big city distractions and dangers. This is the 21st century and no one wants to admit they’ve helplessly watched a classmate get sucked into the pages of a library book, come face-to-face with an angry ghost, or glimpsed a creature prowling the campus by the light of the full moon.
College is where you make your own choices and find out who you really are. You can keep your head down, hoping to avoid the twisted horrors you sometimes catch out of the corner of your eye, or you can face your fears, fight the darkness, and protect your campus. Everyone starts out as a wide-eyed freshman, but if you survive four years at ETU you’ll be a hero.
The Books
The ETU line debuts with two, 96-page, full-color books in our graphic novel format. We expect to deliver the PDFs in July. Assuming the Kickstarter is successful, the physical products should ship no later than November.
The core book, East Texas University, offers a well-rounded syllabus of character creation, new Edges & Hindrances, gear, Setting Rules, and tours of campus and nearby Pinebox, Texas. For advanced credit, read the section on rituals and talismans. Finally, the Adventure Generator and encyclopedia of miscreants is sure to light a creative spark in even the most humorless campus parking enforcement officer.
Welcome to ETU. Classes start this Fall. Register now.
The second book, Degrees of Horror, includes a full-length Plot Point Campaign designed to take your class from Freshmen to graduation—if they survive! We can't say much about the plot, but suffice to say it's a Big Deal for Pinebox...and maybe beyond. Degrees of Horror also features a full course-load of Savage Tales that work equally well with the Plot Point Campaign or your own epic saga.
A Plot Point Campaign and additional Savage Tales for ETU!
The Game Master's Screen
This tri-fold screen features a scene of chaos on campus on the player's side, and all the important charts and tables for the game on the GM's side. It also includes a full-length 32-page adventure by Ed Wetterman—we'll give you details and show you the cover in one of our first updates.
When students at East Texas University talk about surviving college, they mean it…literally!
All pledge levels include unlocked digital rewards and free domestic shipping!
Add Ons!
We have four Add Ons for everyone who pledges at the Junior level Reward or higher (if you order an Add On and only pledged for PDFs we'll refund your Add On pledge since this doesn't cover the shipping).
These items will be available as Add Ons after the Kickstarter closes, but at a higher retail price. To get the lower prices reflected below, include them in your pledge (you can tell us exactly what the extra funds are for when we mail out the Final Survey).
Note that you must pledge at the Junior level or higher to order any of these items as Add Ons. International customers must add an additional $20 if you add one or more sets of Bennies, miniatures, or Go Ravens! dice. There is no extra cost for shipping the maps.
All the Add Ons for East Texas University, all visual like. :)
Add On Details
Bennies (Pack of 20 high-quality ceramic poker chips): Please add +$15 to your pledge
All TEN ETU 28mm Miniatures: Please add +$50 to your pledge
GO RAVENS! Dice set: Please add + $10 to your pledge
Two double-sided dry-erase poster maps (ETU classrooms, the library, off-campus housing, and Pinebox businesses): Please add $25 (Sorry, we aren't selling the two packs separately during the Kickstarter)
Closer view of the Gals of ETU!
Closer view of the Guys of ETU!
Unlockable Digital Rewards
We're going with the number of *backers* for this Kickstarter rather than funding levels, so *you* can help us get the word out and unlock more and more cool stuff for everyone.
Please note that all unlockable rewards are downloadable PDFs or other digital files.
Here's the schedule of rewards and the number of backers (in parentheses) which unlocks them. Note that our funding must be successful before any rewards are unlocked.
Soundtrack (200 Backers): The ETU original soundtrack, "Trouble in Texas." UNLOCKED
Archetypes (300 Backers): Ten full-color, full-page, ready-to-play archetypes, with Figure Flats. UNLOCKED
Creature Feature — La Bruja (400 Backers ): Art, background, statistics, Figure Flats, and several adventure seeds featuring the terrifying Mexican witches known as la bruja! UNLOCKED
Figure Flats I - Heroes of ETU (500 Backers): Two full pages of "printable miniatures" including students, faculty, and civilians. UNLOCKED
A Body Was Found…: (600 Backers ): A 12-page ETU storytelling adventure using the Protocol system. (Find out more at the Postworld Games site) NEW! We're also adding the classic 12tM adventure, Last Rites, to this stretch goal! UNLOCKED
University Press (700 Backers): Electronic templates to print your own customized handouts including a welcome letter, Dean's List, academic probation, ETU diploma, and blank ETU letterhead. UNLOCKED
Figure Flats II - Horrors of East Texas (800 Backers): All the critters from the book, including chupacabras, ghosts, an assortment of wicked demons, and more.
Return of the Chickens in the Mist—Murder Most Fowl! (900 Backers): Follow-up to the original hit adventure, Chickens in the Mist! (Available now at the Pinnacle store.)
Online Adventure Generator (1,000 Backers): An ETU adventure generator for SWToolset.com, building on—and expanding—the results found in East Texas University.
The 12 to Midnight Legacy Collection (1200 Backers): Digital copies of ALL the previous Pinebox adventures, including: Last Rites, Chickens in the Mist, Bloodlines, Ed's Midnight Tales, Jerry's Midnight Tales, Skinwalker, Brainwashed, The Beast Within, PLUS the short stories in Buried Tales of Pinebox, Texas.
Merchant Reward Level
Kickstarter's Reward boxes don't allow formatting, so we decided to put the list of items and terms here where it's easier to understand:
This Reward level is for "Brick and Mortar" stores only and can be purchased as many times as you like. It includes:

Please note that if we cannot verify your brick and mortar store, you will receive the Master's Student package and a prorated refund instead.
Add Ons After the Kickstarter
We'll ask for Add Ons before we ship should you wish to add anything, but the prices may be higher, and may require additional shipping charges. We *highly* recommend pledging now if you think you'll want any of the Add Ons (you can always reduce your pledge if you change your mind up until the Kickstarter closes). Thanks!

I'm Joel Sparks, author of the game and a long time writer and game designer. It's been a privilege to encounter such a swell of support for what started out as a funny little idea. There's so much more to tell in the Catthulhu story, and so much fun to be had! Together with my team of artists and editors, we want to take Catthulhu to the next level for all the hungry fans. But we can't do it alone.
This Kickstarter project will let us complete and produce the all-new, greatly expanded and improved game with the working title CALL OF CATTHULHU DELUXE. We aim to keep the mechanics simple, the cost low, and the appeal universal. To do all this in a high-quality project, we need your help.
Check out the rewards on offer, read a little more about what we're working on, and then pick your pledge. Join us, and save human civilization! Do it for the cats.

You'll get more about the cult of Mutt'thra, the relationship between domestic dogs and wild canines, Dog Roles and how they differ from Cat Roles, and a lot more.
Now a human follower of Mutt-Thra has agreed to put his uniquely doggy insights and visions into print for the edification of felines everywhere. JOHN KENNEDY of THIRD EYE GAMES is author of a whole raft of RPG works, including the Terrifying Tomb of Ankhatton adventure for the DAWG roleplaying game (Knights of the Dinner Table). Woof!
KATTHULHU LEBT!
Pledge total needed for this Stretch Goal cut from $10,000 to $8,500! That means we're already past it, so the German language Deluxe rules translation will happen. Excited around here!
Four colors!
When we hit $10000 pledge, we decided to add a new color of Cat Dice for people to choose from -- and another one every $2500. Now we have four colors!
NOW JUST $4 EACH INCLUDING SHIPPING!
A book about to catkind's devoted servants, the humans. Did you know that children between roughly 3 months and 18 months old can talk to cats? Obvii! Newborns are Beacons, visible in the Dream World and protecting nearby cats from Chaotic influence. Some humans grow up to be Cat Ladies, mother figures to countless kits and heroes, while others become Kickers or worse: cat-haters who can potentially turn violent. Find Twofootologist and Tiger Dreamer wisdom on how to deal with all these types of human, and a lot more, in the complete Book of the Two-Foots!
The Book of Dogs and the Book of the Two-Foots will now be in the printed Catthulhu Deluxe book! Tell your friends!

campaign.story:
Æthermancy 
...is the quintessential book for all-things-magical for the critically-acclaimed Æther Role Playing System. The point of this Kickstarter is to get it off the ground. The bulk of the book was written at the same time as the Æther Core Book, but it has evolved and changed with the system. Now we are ready to give it the finishing touches that it deserves along with the polish and shine that we have so badly wanted for it.
Æthermancy is a complete magic book that builds on the skill system that is at the heart of Æther. It allows for an incredible degree of creativity and flexibility with your spell caster, whether you are using the system for typical wizards, clerics, or psychic users; all of them are treated the same in the Æthermancy book, at least mechanically. The book contains ways to incorporate magic into your existing campaign, it contains 30 adventure hooks, a fully fleshed out adventure, and over 200 spells. (FINAL COUNT 257 unless someone else pledges in the next 2 minutes, then it's more!)  It blends seamlessly with the Æther system; making it feel like a continuous inclusion rather than something clunky and bolted on.
What is Æther?
From Kevin Rohan, the system creator
Æther is a critically acclaimed universal role playing system that allows you to do anything. The Core Book is geared for modern games, but it is easily and readily adaptable for any time or technology level, from the Stone Age to the very far future. It is a skill-driven system that has amazing character creation flexibility and the possibilities for advancement are virtually limitless. But, you don't have to take our word for it, see what some of our customers have said!
From Amazon:
Find those at Amazon.com.  For a few more, click the link to see our reviews at DriveThru RPG! Want to know more about the system itself, visit the Silver Gryphon Games website!
Why are we Kickstarting this?
We need additional funding for art. We want the presentation of this book to be our best ever, and that means more polish than we've ever done before on the various print editions. Virtually all of the Kickstarter funds are going for art, with a very small portion of them going to establish other features of the book such as the ISBN codes and identifiers.
In the spirit of Kickstarter, we have several stretch goals, all of them revolve around more content for Æthermancy and more choices for you at your gaming table. More spells, more caster types, more archetypes, and more creatures are made available at the individual stretch goals. As we approach those new goals, we will tell you more about them, but we can say that we have a lot planned for this project! Without being Kickstarted, these other goals may never see the light of day, so this is a rare opportunity to actually drive content and tell a publisher exactly what you want!
We do have some art already, provided by Dennis Darmody, and for a taste of what's due to be inside, we present you with the Explode spell and an illustration for it!
Fast breakdown of what you can get!
Want to see this larger?
Funding and Stretch Goals
We will be updating this section as this project grows, and we have a number of stretch goals that are designed specifically for Æthermancy and supporting information for using more magic in your game world. Ranging from more Æthermancer archetypes, spells and adventure hooks, all the way up to fantasy bestiaries and beyond, this will be a keystone project for Silver Gryphon Games and will help guide our production for many months to come!
Daily Expansion Goals:  We really want this to succeed and we're willing to put our mouth where your support and money are!  Starting on September 17th, we decided to add 5 new spells to the main book every time we have more than 5 backers in a day.  Additionally, every $1,000 dollars in pledges we receive will generate another 5 spells for the main book!  Considering there is (at the time I'm writing this) already 210 spells in the book, that could end up being a huge spell selection!
$4750: Æthermancy is Funded! We will contact the prospective artists immediately and we will get art going. If all goes right, we may be able to update you with concept sketches or even full art, depending on when the goal has been hit!
Adding spells until the last minutes!
$6500: The first stretch goal of the Tome of the Unknown Æthermancers is unlocked! Each of the smaller stretch goals for this companion volume will add another main Æthermancer archetype with three variants, spells, adventure hooks, and pre-generated Æthermancers, ready to use in your campaigns! Our expected date of delivery on these is April of 2014 due to the art concerns, but we may be able to get these out sooner!
The spell casting mechanic of Æthermancy works by the player choosing which of the eight attributes their character uses as a Casting Attribute, and each of these eight Æthermancers pivots off a different attribute, adding a wide range of possibilities to your gaming table! The first of the Unknown Æthermancers is the Sorcerer, and others unlock as stated below! If all eight Æthermancers are funded, the book will be completed with its own fully fleshed out adventure!
$11,750: The second major stretch goal is the Grimoire of Forgotten Lore! Each small goal unlocks another type of magic, adding para-elements to the five core elements of fire, earth, water, air, and energy included in the core book, and it also adds life magic, death magic, and summoning to the mix! Every small goal unlocked gives you another 30 spells, three Æthermancer variants that deal specifically with the type of magic unveiled, and it also gives three adventure hooks per caster type! Our expected date of delivery on these is June of 2014, again, due mostly to art concerns.
If all eight sections of the Forgotten Lore are unlocked, there will be an adventure added to the Grimoire of Forgotten Lore to complete the book!
We have many further goals in mind for this project and as we get closer and closer to unlocking them, we will reveal more information about them, but here's a taste:
$19,500: Catalog of Mythical Beasts - Contains up to 295 creatures of an Æthermantic nature, each of them is fully illustrated! One of the mini-stretch goals of this volume also contains a new type of Æthermancer, the artificer!
$49,250: Reliquary of Forsaken Relics - Contains up to 210 relics from many places, origins, and times, all for use in your Æthermancy adventures!
That is just a taste of our goals, we do have further goals in mind, and we will release more on them as we approach the appropriate funding levels!
Pixie Dust Miniatures
Caroline at Pixie Dust Miniatures has agreed to do miniature Æthermancy books for us, and they make perfect charms for necklaces, bracelets, zippers, Christmas ornaments, or just to have for a keepsake! There is only one pledge level that you get a small Æthermancy book for backing us, and that is the $25 pledge level. We did this for those who wish to support the project, but may not be interested in purchasing the physical copies of the book. We thank you for that, and we want to know that we appreciate your support!
All others who wish to have one of these items, simply add $20 to your pledge when you determine a level of support. The books are made of real leather (sorry, no material substitutions for those who prefer a non-animal based material) and other non-toxic materials and measure approximately 1 inch by 0.75 inches by 0.2 inches.
Caroline is also providing a special award for those of you who pledge to our top two levels; a miniature wizard's desk complete with scrolls, books, and bottles! As with the spell books, everything is hand-crafted from leather and glass and a few other secret materials! The table measures 5.25 inches wide by 1.5 inches deep by approximately 4 inches tall.
Questions and Answers!
We here at Silver Gryphon Games have never had a "fire-and-forget" mentality when it comes to a product, and a Kickstarter project is no exception. Last summer with our dice, we were answering questions and met quite a few of our fans. With this Kickstarter, we plan on having on-line game nights revolving around Æthermancy, Q&A sessions with Silver Gryphon online, and we will of course be available via emails and the Kickstarter message system to provide any answers you may need!
These events will be scheduled via our Facebook page and announced at the Silver Gryphon Games home page. We invite you to check with us regularly, but we will try to keep everyone updated via the Kickstarter as well.
Delivery of Product
We will be waiting for art before we can do the final layout. After that we will deliver the backer awards and then we will wait a short time to put the standard editions of the PDFs and books into circulation. Additional supplements unlocked via the stretch goals may have differing delivery dates, and those will be updated as we are able to firm those dates up.
As of now, we are confident we can begin delivering Æthermancy in February of 2014, and every two months, we expect to be able to deliver the next expansion book (Tome of Unknown Æthermancers, Grimoire of Forgotten Lore, Catalog of Mythical Beasts, etc) every two months thereafter. All backers will have their products sent to them in the mail before we release Æthermancy to the public, and we're expecting about two weeks later, we will release the book through our normal sales channels.
For the expanded material, we will be releasing those in a similar manner. All backers will have their PDFs and physical copies sent out to them at least two weeks in advance of Silver Gryphon Games making them publicly available.

Special Thanks
We'd like to be sure to thank Caroline at Pixie Dust Miniatures for providing the spell books and the wizard table!  To see what else Caroline loves to create, visit her Etsy shop at: https://www.etsy.com/shop/PixieDustMiniatures
We would also like to thank Paul Shapera for use of his music for our video.  If you'd like to hear the full version of "The Steampunk Opera Overture" and all of Paul's other outstanding work, visit his site at: http://mochalab.bandcamp.com/track/the-steampunk-opera-overture

Risks and challenges
If funded, our greatest risk and challenge lies in working with the artists involved with this project. Silver Gryphon Games is a three-time Ennie nominated publisher for Fans' Favorite Publisher and we have many critically acclaimed projects. We have been producing RPGs for almost 6 solid years and we have a passion for this hobby that we hope is reflected by every publisher in the industry.

We have also started a Kickstarter group on Facebook which has become one of the largest Kickstarter support groups on any social media platform, which gives us a huge network to tap if there are any unexpected hiccups.
As a group and individuals, we are dedicated to helping others meet their goals as well, so we will participate in Kicking it Forward, and continue to invest a portion of our profits made possible by this project into Kickstarter in the future. 
http://kickingitforward.org/

This is not our first Kickstarter and we have learned that when the unexpected happens, we will communicate those issues with our backers and we will keep you as informed as we can. It is backers such as yourself that allows companies all over the world to see their products and dreams to completion, and we're not going to risk violating that trust or respect!

updates.update_content:
The adventure included in the Æthermancy book is framed to take place in Wellstone City, giving enough information to run it in any time period that Wellstone has existed, but it's not so specific that it can't be placed in other settings if need be. It features Goblins, a forsaken temple, and a few other surprises along the way. I don't want to give too much away in case one of you will be playing in it instead of running it, but I will give you this little teaser piece of art here to accompany the temple map that was previously shown...
I present to you, our Goblins.

Well, it's been another week and we're still going forward hard and fast on this project. It has grown to proportions larger than anticipated, so I am announcing that we are probably doing something with the book that we had anticipated as a possibility but had hoped that we wouldn't have to do.
It was stated in the Kickstarter that there would be a section on creating your own spells. That will be included, however, it very well may be included as a separate book. The backers will not have any additional charges to bear because of this, but the book would have swelled to something over 300 pages and books at that point can become unstable with the binding and other considerations.

Good day!
I meant to get this to you last week, but with the preparations for KantCon, I didn't make the deadline. I think I'll have to do some tweaking to the various layers yet, but this is what the spell cards will look like, as long as the spells have artwork. As soon as I have the card backs to a point that I'm happy with them, I'll post the back, and then I'll give you a peek at the non-art version for the spells I won't have artwork for. The completed version will be the size of playing cards.

Let me know what you think! Like I said, this isn't necessarily a 100% complete version, I have some tweaks to do. But, in the mean time, enjoy!

Greetings!

One of the things we promised in the Kickstarter were Spell Cards. Originally these were intended to be basically book marks that were made out of playing card stock. However, in the past few months I have become acquainted with the spell cards from Gale Force 9 that they produced for Wizards of the Coast.
They're pretty amazing. I have recommended them not only as a shop owner but also as a gamer, particularly for new gamers.

So...life happens. Sometimes it happens with some vengeance and on every level of the process, and when that happens, it can be catastrophic for small companies.
Let me preface this by saying that this project is not dead, and you will be getting an awesome book, and it will be as soon as we can get it out, which we have a target date of October 15th for release to our backers.
You deserve to know what's going on here at Silver Gryphon, not only with the project, but in general as well. If you want the TL:DR version, we screwed up, our support and contractors screwed up, and we've hit massive delays in things, but we are getting back on track and we will get this thing done.

Hey everybody!
We've got a lot going on, as you're very well aware! The art is rolling in at a good pace, though a little slower than the artist and I had originally discussed.  It's looking really awesome so far, and we're very happy to be working on this project with such a talented group of people!
The writing on the book is rapidly nearing completion.  After that it's going to be another swing through on a mechanics check and off we go to the editor (for what hasn't been edited already) and then it's on to layout!

Click to go to our homepage, we'll be selling Clipless there, after we ship to our backers first!
As Seen On...
Trend Hunter - "Storing your phone in your pocket/purse may become a thing of the past."
Technology Tell - “Armbands, holsters, car mounts; you won’t need any of those anymore.”
Hack Things - “Clever use of NFC."
Android Police - “Launching Navigation automatically when you get in the car… Rad.”

Secure your phone in new ways...
We kept hearing complaints from people who had nowhere to put their phones and wanted a more versatile alternative to the traditional belt clip holsters. So we started talking to people and brainstorming. Some of the features people wanted to secure their phone, included:
Working with multiple phones or devices
More flexibility for clothing
Seamless connection with walls and car dashboards too
Two years ago we started working on the initial proof of concepts, all involving magnets. There were 3 fundamental design criteria:
Strong enough to run with
Easy to remove
Shielded to protect your phone, credit cards, and other devices

Countless prototypes later...
3D printing made the early stages possible! Like proud new parents, we didn't care how ugly our baby was.
We started with 3D printing, but plastic didn't cut it. So we set up our own CNC machine and started producing robust aluminum prototypes, all in Jeff's basement.
Pro tip: Before you buy a CNC machine, ensure basement is soundproof. Turns out, they can be a little bit noisy.
At first, it was a side project, but then it grew legs. People were getting excited and volunteering to be beta testers. After they used it for a couple of months, this is what some people said:
“I really dislike having a bulky phone in my pocket, and I think the traditional belt clip holsters are ugly. What I like about Clipless is that I can have my phone on me, but can hide it in new ways.” 
“I used to always miss calls because my phone was lost in my purse! Now, I know exactly where my phone is all the time.”
 “I don’t like the normal holsters, they always jab me when I sit down, or get in the way of my seat belt. I love how I can attach Clipless pretty much anywhere.”
We received lots of great feedback, including suggestions for improvements. To help with industrial design we worked with three designers from Cortex Design in Toronto. They helped us get it to where it is today, a high quality product that feels great in your hands.
More than just a magnet
Photo of the latest prototype, made with high-quality metal alloys. Any other photos seen in this campaign, are of older prototypes.
Secure Phones and Devices
Clipless works with any kind of phone, GPS or tablet, that has a flat area to adhere the connector. The unique adhesive we use, allows you to stick the connector to your phone or tablet directly, or to a case! The adhesive works on almost every kind of material, and can be removed without residue. Basically, if it’s not squishy (very flexible) silicone rubber or genuine leather, then it should work just fine. Fake Leather? Plastic? Aluminum? They all work great. 
A flat phone or device, HALF the size of a credit card, is all you need.
Secure to Clothing
Clipless works with any normal clothing or fabric. That means denim, skirts, shirts, purse-liners, golf-bags, jogging pants, sportswear – the list goes on. Basically, any average single layer material, works perfect! Two layers of something thin, works too. Use caution on delicate clothing, such as lace or silk.
Secure to Surfaces 
You can stick the NFC-enabled mount to any surface, meaning plastic, your car dashboard, any metal, wood, tile, glass or mirror. As long as it’s flat, the mount will work. The mount works with a really strong semi-permanent adhesive. It is designed to be single-use, but it can be removed, without residue. Use caution on delicate surfaces, such as painted walls. 
Mounts are NFC-enabled
The Clipless mounts are enabled with near field communication (NFC). This allows a phone to intelligently run common tasks, based on the physical object it's mounted to.
We’ve partnered with the creators of “NFC Task Launcher” to enable our Clipless mounts to launch specific apps automatically when the phone is mounted. Click the embedded video to learn more about NFC.
Be one of the first to get Clipless...
We've spent two years refining Clipless to make sure that it works well and that it can be sold for a price that people want. We're almost there! With your support, you will help us fund:
Production tooling
Minimum quantity orders
Economies of scale to achieve a reasonable price

Rewards
There are three different pledge levels, however the only difference between two of them, is the amount.  We're giving away the first 1000 at $17 + shipping, to the early birds. After those are gone, it's $35 + shipping.
$35 for either rewards package, and add increments of $6 to either for extra discs, connectors, or mounts. (Maximum of 5 Add-Ons)
Sorry about the confusion! We do need people to add $5 for shipping to North America or $15 for International, to either pledge level. Thanks for the support!
Stretch Goal #1: Colour!
If we reach $50k, we’ll be able to support a second colour option! See the video below for more info.  Update #3 has some explanations as well!
Connect with Us
We want to connect with the backers.  To do that, we're going to use Reddit, Google Hangout, and are open to suggestions for other channels.  
So far, we've done an AMA on r/CasualIAmA,  on June 10th.  We will check back in on that thread every once in a while.  
Those curious, might be interested in the first reddit post from before kickstarter.
We are on facebook at http://www.facebook.com/GetClipless and twitter @GetClipless

I’m officially back from China now and it’s good to be home. Overall it was a very productive trip and I am pleased. That being said, it could have been better.
In the last update, I ran through some of the quality assurances that we were setting up to ensure that the final product lives up to our standards. Hello backers!
  I’m writing to you from China! I’ve been here for the past week and a half, and I wanted to give you a sneak peak into proceedings on the opposite side of the world. I’ll quickly run through the environment, describe some quality measures, and give a production update.
Environment

Hello backers!
Just wanted to give you a quick update on the latest Clipless developments.
Manufacturing
In our last update, I told you that I was booking my trip to China for the first week of July. After giving the green light to the manufacturer, we started discovering a new type cracking developing on one of the plastic parts, the Connector. We were unsure whether it was due to the design or the specific run of plastic material that was used (it felt a little more brittle compared to the other ones), therefore we decided to play it safe and make the Connector slightly thicker to strengthen it. The tradeoff is that this added a week to the schedule in order to perform tooling changes and create sample parts.
